name: Nakia Byrd
text: If I could leave 0 stars I would. How is it this is a new location and it seems the night shift on certain nights is A HOT A!! MESS!!! Is this what work looks like with a drive through line wrapped around the building while the employees turn customers away at the door..Mind you they are standing in there dancing around plus more. Oh not to mention the drug transaction that we just witnessed from an employee to a customer.. SMH SMH

name: Zipperand Stitch
text: Food is good, but I really wish dine is was open. The drive thru line is always so long.

name: Chris Clark
text: Food is pretty good but if I order 30 minutes in advance via the app for pickup I shouldn't be pulled around to wait for them to bring it out to me after spending 15 minutes in the drive thru.

name: Marcus Perry
text: Lobby closed ! Drive thru only. Shell tasted old

name: Aretha Sellers
text: Food was literally thrown together. The taco looked like it had been bitten off. This was not a good experience for a fresh opening. I'm very disappointed.

name: MADE BY CHANTELE
text: Every experience so far has been good.

name: Thomas Landers
text: One of the best Taco Bell’s I have been too. Hopefully they keep it up after the “new Taco Bell smell” fades.

name: M.G. Sturm
text: Tried get breakfast this Saturday, no one answered the drive thru. Emplyees sitting outside told us they would be open at 830am arpund  a little bit

name: Duane Anders
text: Employees do not even know when they open, was told two different times, says 7 doesn’t open until 9.

name: Austin Ya
text: I'm a little Susy baka pog

name: Shaun Powell
text: Left out half our order, won't answer phone, inside is closed so you cant go in. Food we did get was barely cooked.

name: Deborah pellem
text: This is a new one and it's close to home!❤️❤️

name: Marsha
text: Order was not accurate☹

name: Brad “Fly High” Carter
text: Incredibly slow service... Sat at the speaker for almost 10 minutes with a line of cars to the road behind us before our order was ever taken with absolutely no one in front of us. Not to mention the maybe 15 minutes we sat in line before the speaker with only 3 cars ahead of us. Finally get our food, 2 quesadillas, 2 burritos and a taco. Well they got the order right but the quesadillas where literally wadded up in the bottom of the bag..... needless to say we'll stick to the one on 72..

name: Denni Peek
text: Great food and great service. I haven't had any issues. Consistently hot, fresh, delicious food.

name: Jason Gilbert
text: Go get a frozen pizza instead, don't waste your money at this dominos.The only good thing about this place is when it's closed.

name: Matt St. John
text: We have repeatedly had problems with this particular store.  Tonight, we tried calling from various phones for over an hour.  They didn't even bother to answer.  I would hate to know that I was too lazy or ignorant to know how to answer a phone call at a business that offers delivery.  This is the WORST dominos we have ever dealt with and we won't bother with them again.

name: Matt Qualls
text: Best costumer service ever!! Have yet to be disappointed all around!

name: Eric Wilson
text: The best buffalo chicken pizzas ever.

name: Brad Bell
text: Awesome store with great service

name: Barry Johnson
text: Great food, but they need more help

name: Robert NOD
text: This franchise has ruined the menu. None of the current special sandwiches are here, no oven roasted chicken either. They only keep one employee on site, never seen a manger unless the manager is the only employee. Go a mile either direction on 280 and visit the other subways and save yourself the trouble. They have the full menu.

name: C Cubed
text:
Didn’t have my online order ready when I got there

2nd time this location has let me down.

name: Anaya Patel
text: Food and service is very good. Nice and clean store , staff is great too. Had a steak and cheese sandwich , which is strongly recommended.

name: Chaitali Patel
text:
UNDER NEW MANAGEMENT SINCE 2/2019

Well maintained, friendly staff and  they make great subs. They actually listen to what the customer wants. Definitely coming back to enjoy a good sub, cookies and soup.

name: Javier Pineda
text: Clean and great service

name: Chase Greene
text: Always a pleasure getting food here. Service and food have always been top notch in my experience. The manager and staff have always been great to me!

name: Lashon Williams
text: The customer service here at this location is amazing I’ve never experienced such a great customer service in a while most times when you go to fast food chains they employees act like they don’t want to be there but this particular young lady Mona was amazing .  Greeted us as soon as we hit the door Made sure we had everything we needed .  I will definitely be back because this place strives to give a great experience every time

name: josie callins
text: I like the indian girl she is very nice and she choose everything in my food it was very very delicious how she does.

name: Brandon Mitts
text:
So when you order the 2.99 spicy italian hows does that equal 4.87 B.M.T. beware they will steal you money and act like they dont know, this place is crooked and doesnt even know their own job or menu I WILL NEVER RETURN OR RECOMMEND TO ANYONE.... THIEVES
When you walk in have your wallet and jewlery ready with hands up

name: Sears Steele
text: Mona and her staff do a great job

name: Aaron Conley
text: One damn employee and couldn't get off his cell phone. You have one job to do and it isn't being on your cell

name: Nevy Rupani
text: Worst service ever.It says they close at 10 we reached at 9.35 and they said we r close.So unethical and unprofessional.I also heard a lot of bad reviews abt them.Thats the reason for people nt wanting to opt for subway in walmart.Wont be back.Be aware of this kind of service!!!!

name: Mari _D
text: The Subway employee would not get off her Cell phone to make any subs . I tried twice wile I was at Walmart.

name: Jack
text: So incredibly rude ! No one in the line,  two working with backs toward us, they saw us standing there and didn't even acknowledge us. We bought our meal at another location.

name: Kim Rollins
text: Got a meatball sub and it was delicious :)

name: Latoya Macon
text: The absolute worst experience ever.. I stood in line 25 minutes to not be served!!! Place was filthy!

name: Nelly Leguisamo
text: It was only 1 person for a lot of costumers

name: James Gross
text: The manager there is a total asshat

name: Kathryn
text: Slow service! Took forever.

name: gustavo esaa
text:
(Translated by Google) Delicious

(Original)
Delicioso

name: Reba Phillips
text: Great Quality Pizzas with Delicious Toppings. Crispy Base is my Favorite and they made that really good. Awesome staff always their to help. When i went inn This place was Rushed by People but they Served me my pizza in just 20min. Surely Visit again.

name: Coonass
text: Good pizza, bad location. I'd eat there again.

name: Jesse Dalton
text: Crust was outstanding. Toppings and cheese in good proportion. Sauce on the pizza was good. The marinara that came with the Calzone wasn't what I expected. It was like a cross between marinara and hot sauce. I'm not sure this was intended, but it gave a unique bite to it. All in all it was a pretty outstanding shop, they sell by the slice, so make a great lunch option.

name: Elizabeth Gardner
text: OMG I'VE BEEN EATING HERE FOR YEARS AND I'VE NEVER BEEN DISSATISFIED. THE FOOD SO AWESOME AND THE MAN THAT RUNS THE PLACE HAS GOT TO BE THE NICEST PERSON I KNOW💛💛💛💛💛 LOVE IT

name: Kierra Ealey
text: I've definitely had better calzones.

name: Matthew Holmes
text: Really? Can deliver to a motel but won't deliver to the Pilot Truck stop right up the road. Their loss.

name: Xander Felargo
text: The pizza is really good and the guy that runs the place is nice. I don't think I'll ever stop coming here.

name: jack roberts
text: I love it because they deliver close to home

name: Redd “Reddhead” Blatt
text: They won't answer the phone getting pissed

name: Ron Olsen
text:
No Delivery Today Because of Traffic?
Google Maps has 0.4 mi away Sad..

name: EverybodyKnowMe
text: Great pizza, dope crust.

name: Teresita C-Price
text: Love the wings

name: KEISHA COMBS
text: I LOVE THIS PIZZA

name: Aaron Stringer
text: This place no longer exists

name: Tiffany Posey
text: I love this place

name: Lakesha Davison
text: Great calzones

name: Chris Orange
text: Good food

name: Kim Sims
text: Now that's a pizza! Remind me of New York.

name: C. M.
text: Love the delivery service!!!

name: bluedaniel16
text: Awesome Pizza Place

name: Lawrence Edmond Jr
text: GREAT PIZZA !!!

name: Shavon “vonnieboo” Fincher
text: Food

name: Gavin Thor
text:
Just couldn't do another chain restaurant on our trip. This place does have local charm and pleasant staff. We arrived about 930, so the grill might have been off...if true,then that's why breakfast took a really long time to arrive. I was assuming the food should have been extra hot then right? No... but done correctly and very tasty. Styrofoam plates and plastic utensils take away from what could be a cute place. Overall good fare, but needs fine tuning.

Show less

name: Fredrick Caves
text: Great service and great cooks

name: Leigh Turberville McElroy
text: Awesome breakfast and superb service!! Will visit again soon!

name: Romeo Vellutini
text: This is a nice little out of the way place. Definitely a local hangout, but they are nice.

name: Angela Walker
text: Always delicious.

name: Larry Allday
text:
They cook one fine breakfast omelet.
Along with the other items.

name: Justin Parker
text: This place is awesome for breakfast and lunch. I highly recommend it to anyone. The breakfast wrap is phenomenal! Brownies, cookies, cakes and pies are also spectacular! Prices are very reasonable.

name: Amanda Younge
text: They always have great food and awesome service

name: Anthony Quinn
text: Loaded hashbrowns for breakfast are incredible! Good service and prices. FRESH taste and ingredients.

name: Tolethia Kidd
text: I really enjoy their loaded baked potato

name: Nathanael Evans
text: Excellent food, and better service

name: Matthew Rhodes
text: Great food. Get the omelet for breakfast

name: Chris Raley
text: As always Perfect !!!

name: Deonna Prince
text: Great food!

name: Jason Johnson
text:
We found this little gem about 2 years ago and fell in love with it.

We have only been one time but it has been memorable.

Delicious, nutritious, and healthy sandwiches with a mix of new and inspiring.

Their Sweet Potato Fries are just the best and worth the trip every-time.

name: Micheal Porter
text: Great food. Great staff. We got the Fish, the Bacon LT, and the Smoked Turkey sandwiches. All were VERY good. Sides we had were sweet potato waffle fries and pasta salad. I would highly recommend both. All food came out fast and was very fresh.

name: Robert Sung
text:
This place is amazing.  So amazing I briefly entertained the thought of quitting my job (which I love) and opening a chain of these restaurants.

They prepare the ingredients correctly and compose it so that there is a contrast of flavors and textures.

Small menu, but everything is done well, which I like.  Every sandwich place should be like this.

This place is a must try next time you are in Huntsville!

name: Rachel Fortson
text: Everything on the menu is good. I cant say anything bad about the place. I love the breakfast served thru lunchtime. Buttermilk pancakes with citrus syrup is so yummy and made with fresh ingredients. Who knew candied oranges inside syrup tasted so good! You can tell the difference with the ingredients they use. I wish there were more restaurants like this. If you have been to Hillbilly Tea in Louisville, it is very similar. Eclectic. It's always busy and has limited seating, so you must be patient!! I order to-go and my food is always ready when I get there.

name: Chandler Reynolds
text: Great food at a reasonable price. The SOS (toast, chopped steak, gravy, and eggs) is my current favorite, but I've tried many of the other dishes. They were all excellent. It can get crowded during common meal times, but mornings typically aren't bad.

name: Drew Scott
text: This is my new favorite sandwich place. The sandwiches taste super fresh and all the ingredients taste quality. The pasta salad is excellent as well. Probably the best turkey sandwich I've ever had.

name: Anna Mitchell
text: Best sandwich shop in town!  I love the turkey sandwich and the shrimp and grits benedict the best, but everything else is wonderful.  The staff is amazing.  Can't say anything bad about this place!

name: Ester
text: Great customer service! Hidden treasure downtown. Looked for surrounding places to get food since I had a two hour wait at the DMV. Only three minutes away, literally. And now they're working with grub South.... It doesn't get better!

name: Shauna Olson
text: Food was good, but there was so much smoke in the air and my eyes are really sensitive I had to leave. I don't know if that's a normal occurrence, or if something caught fire or what

name: Gena Rawdon
text: Amazing food, awesome people who are dedicated to their craft. I love this place.

name: Andrew Walker
text: I really enjoy the laid back atmosphere along with some runny eggs! Love the various options, one of my favorite brunch options.

name: Cody Hornbuckle
text: Found a hair in my sandwich. Pasta salad was  tasteless and it was way too expensive for what it was. Plus from the moment I walked in the door the front counter girl with the thick hipster glasses gave me tons of attitude. Never going again.

name: Mallory Dotson
text: Delicious! Turkey sandwich is one of the best I've ever had! Can't wait to try breakfast foods!

name: Evan Suggs
text: Breakfast was great! Both syrup options were delicious - I wish they sold them by the bottle.

name: Justin Bzdell
text: I like the atmosphere, location, and view of Downtown Huntsville & Veterans Memorial big U.S. Flag. But the the prices are too high. Food is okay, and it took 30 minutes for food to be cooked.

name: Stan Reese
text: My son and I had excellent burgers and outstanding service. We will be back!

name: Amy Hasenyager
text: Super disappointed. We wanted Reubens. From all accounts online, they had a reuben on the menu. We get there and no reuben sandwich. In fact there were  very few sandwiches, considering it's a sandwich 'farm'. And we got a lot of "we are out of that" when we did try to order. Fish on the fish sandwich was rubbery. The chicken sandwich was unexpectedly buffalo. And the bun on the hamburger was chewy (maybe that's just a thing.)

name: Miranda Fike
text: Name's changed to Lumberyard Kitchen, but the food is the same. Delightful flavor combinations, decor with personality, and happy staff make this an easy favorite of mine.

name: J Mac
text: If you live in the Huntsville area and you aren't eating here, you are doing it wrong.

name: Jacob van Akin
text: It's good.

name: Matt Varian
text: Very tasty sandwiches

name: Scott Harden
text: Great sandwiches!

name: Mike Masinelli
text: Excellent!

name: Uzi Bahar
text: Great sandwiches!!!

name: Rachael godfrey
text: Delicious breakfast and it was very clean inside :)

name: Kimberly Holley
text: I am so excited about this location!  Great spot!  Easy access to the interstate.  Waffle house never seems to disappoint!  You can't go wrong with the All-Star breakfast!

name: Lauren Nelsen
text: We came in when the resturaunt was really short staffed, but jordan was absolutely amazing. one customer gave her a hard time because they were short staffed, this customer was extremely rude and unpleasant, but jordan handled the situation professionally and  made sure they were taken care of. Jordan did everything from bussing dishes, taking orders, helping make the food, and taking care of the checks. She did it all with a good attitude and a smile. Give her a raise. She worked well despite the obvious poor management of the resturaunt. Also food was delicious.

name: Troy Price
text: Charged me $25 for two $7.50 meals plus a coffee, I'm assuming because I added cheese to the eggs and hash browns.. excep they forget all the cheese!

name: Marie Knott
text: I love the Waffle House,  the food is always hot

name: Harvey Mellard
text: Always a pleasant experience when visiting this location. Never too crowded or busy. Staff is friendly and helpful, and I've yet to have a bad experience.

name: Enigma Song
text:
Not really about food, but I tried applying to work there online and when I called to check up on that application (I was told this one was where the hiring manager was at), I got told that they don't look at online applications.

Got basically gaslit over saying I don't currently have the option to go to that store, too. That is just abysmal behavior.

I don't know about the quality of the food or service there, but if you want to try to get a job at this particular franchise, well, screw you if you can't get you're butt there, I guess.

name: Lisa Davison
text: I love to use the app I can just walk in and it's ready for me.

name: James M
text: This is a high quality Subway. Great food, very clean, and I love the couch seating!

name: Big EL
text: Great experience!! Took 20 softball girls in for a pregame sandwich. 2 man staff handled it very well!!

name: Ronnie Kalatizadeh
text: Very friendly staff and fresh ingredients

name: Bay Brantley
text: The Dauphin St store refuses to make the pizza like the other ones do. The owner won't let them add any cheese after ingredients and everything winds up burnt

name: Kristin Jandran
text: This location doesn't open on time. It is now 7:15 and the doors are still locked. Looks like I will be going to Starbucks for breakfast. I will not be coming back here.

name: William McHenry
text: Best place around for take out

name: T Denton
text: Veggie Delite was delightful.

name: Georgia A Robins
text: Food was good

name: LaTice Scott
text: Very friendly staff

name: HeatherNailedMe Nguyen
text: RUDE!!!!!!

name: Brandi Gibson
text: Really bummed. I ordered a BLT salad with avocado and extra bacon added and got neither. And the bacon I did get wasn’t chopped. Really a bummer since I come here often.

name: Kamaljeet Kaur
text:
Very rude staff (one of the ladies, seemed Mexican). The requirement of a mask even when you show you're vaccinated entails the willingness to provide one to the customer if he/she does not have one - that too when it is situated on campus / near UAB hospital
Never coming again

name: Michael Brown
text: This is a newer location so everything looks nice, sharp, and new. They've always been on top of it when I come in.

name: Daniel López Rubio
text: Refused service and not offered a mask.  Fully vaccinated and had my shirt up covering my face.  Too strict, without cause.

name: Tiffany Robinson
text: I just went today for lunch. A lady with burgundy hair wrapped my sandwich half way in the paper, took off her gloves and threw it on my sandwich to take out someone else’s sandwich from the toaster. She did not put on gloves again to finish wrapping my sandwich ….. this is extremely un-hygienic.

name: Melody Colvert
text:
Wonderful customer service
Very Clean

name: Eric Taylor
text: Very clean and modern. The "sandwich artist" could be a little friendlier though.

name: shelia vaughner
text: Customer Service is Awful the servers have very mean attitudes.. For it to be a new store and a beautiful restaurant the workers makes it look very bad, they rush you to place an order and they don't give you enough food for your money I bought a salad and they charged me $8.00 for it and my salad was not a full salad only a few spinach leaves..I won't be coming back..

name: Giovanni Garcia
text: It feels as if I’m inconveniencing the staff every time I walk in. Today they ignored me for a solid minute while I stood there. Last time, I went at 7:45 (location closed @ 8)and they were “completely out of bread”. Employees were outside talking & were too lazy to take 3 mins. Subways don’t “run out of bread”.

name: prasam patel
text: Poor customer service. Won't come back here again.

name: roshj93
text: Still demanding masks with terrible service. Go to pita stop instead

name: Joshua Davis
text: Typical subway. Pretty clean

name: Xavier Goodwin
text: Food wise it’s a subway service wise it’s the worst one in the city the workers will give you an attitude and act like they are mad at you for even coming through the door have only had one good experience here and it was a busy day where the manager was working behind the counter and I’ve been going down there since they opened since it’s right down the road from my work

name: Jennifer Justice
text: The women working there are extremely rude!

name: Youlanda French
text: Worst experience I've ever had at a Subway. Maybe it was because it was lunch time. They advertised menu items they no longer carry. The girl fixing my order wasn't listening to anything I told her I wanted. Would've just walked out if I hadn't been there for someone else.

name: K gill
text: Bad customer service employees need more training.

name: Andrew H
text: Great experience. Extremely efficient.

name: GoldTop556
text: Good Subway

name: Amanda Vieth
text: What a great personality. Had us laughing and the food was amazing! Great place to pick up food to go! We will be back FOR SURE!

name: Shaquilla Sewell
text: This place is great! The food came out in a decent time and the staff is very friendly. I do wish it came with soup or salad though.

name: David Smith
text: Real good they give you a lot of food

name: Jessica P
text: Picked up some delicious lunch from hibachi joe today and it was DELICIOUS! The steak was perfectly cooked and that chicken couldn’t have been flavored better! Highly recommended!

name: Kaska Howard
text: This is THE BEST Hibachi place in Dothan AL! Joe definitely knows what he is doing and on top of that he is super nice and always greets people with a smile and a little joke here and there. Its takeout only but food can be ordered ahead of time and picked up.

name: Jason Brooks (Jmb3d)
text: Lots of food and is really good for take out. I would recommend eating here. You will have enough for at least two or three meals.

name: Noelle Sternberg
text: This place has great food. Came to Texas during our worst storm in year and made meals for the lower class. We are so thankfully and blessed. God bless you

name: Lydia “laceychilds” Childs
text: Food was really awesome, a little bit pricey, but excellent food and service.

name: Jordan Lopez
text: Great food and prices. The staff is great and very nice and helpful

name: Autumn Valentine
text: Amazing food!! Worth the money for the amount of food you get. Cant wait to eat it when I move back in a few months ❤

name: Caleb Harvey
text:
Worst experience I’ve ever had at a restaurant. I wouldn’t give them another penny of my business in my lifetime nor will my family.

From the moment we arrived, the two ladies running the front were extremely rude, and acted as if they didn’t want us there at all. Once we were seated, our drinks were slammed down on our table. 15 minutes passed before we saw them again to place our orders, of which we were given major attitudes.

We ordered a mango lassie, which was very gritty and was made from some sort of powder. The yogurt tasted rotten, and we told the server about it. She snatched it off our table, and rolled her eyes.

While we were here, and the 15 minutes passed by, we saw two other tables get up and walk out without ordering because of the terrible customer service given to them by the “manager”. Please roll back your cameras and watch people walking out after encountering the most rude servers/managers in Huntsville.

The rice was so dry, we asked for a different entree. Once we got the bill, she refused to take off the drink that cost $3.99 because we took one single sip out of it to find it wasn’t good, and the yogurt was sour. She said “you took a sip so you’re paying for it”. I told her that was ridiculous, that it was rotten, and she rolled her eyes, snatched my debit card from my hand and charged it.

I asked where the manager was, and she said “I’m the manager” and laughed. I truly hope the owners read this review because I have been a very loyal customer to this location, and the chef despite the Ruchi drama. Now I’ve decided to never come back here. If the owners are reading this, please take this seriously and do something about these two because they are running off loyal customers.

resp.text: Hi Caleb I appreciate the review and your experience at the restaurant. We spoke to the staff about their behavior and their attitude towards our customers. We gave them a verbal warning regarding their service towards you and your family. Just give us one more chance so that next time you come to the restaurant you can have a good and better experience. Hope to see you soon.

name: RalphFLA
text:
I have never eaten in a real Indian restaurant before--just a couple of small take-out stands in large cities.

The person with whom I was dining has had experience dining in Indian restaurants so I followed his lead and my own instincts based on what type of food I generally like.

One of my favorite foods, and one that I do not often get to eat, is lamb. With that in mind, I decided to try the Lamb Tikka Masala. It was served in a metal bowl. There were a great deal of lamb in the mixture (see the photo). There was also a lot of it. I ate about half of the dish and got a take-out box for the remainder to enjoy it later.

It was a tomato cream sauce with spices harboring a different flavor than I am used to experiencing. It looked like a thick tomato bisque soup and had some tomato flavor but with different spices.

I also had a Naan bread to accompany the dish. It was very much like the pita bread often served in Greek restaurants and had a similar flavor. There were four large slices of bread.

Overall, the meal was very filling.

My dining companion ordered the Tandoori chicken. It is pieces of chicken with yogurt and spices and cooked in a clay oven. I had one of the chicken pieces and liked it very much. Again, a different spice than I am used to having but it tasted good.

The chicken was served on a plate that was sizzling when it came out. Obviously, it was very hot and an impressive presentation with the chicken sizzling rapidly.

For a drink, I ordered Masala Tea. Again, I had never had this tea and ordered it on a whim. It was very good. Strong black tea with milk and spices, probably cinammon and some other spices. It was robust and filling and served hot.

This restaurant is in the back of a shopping center and can be easy to miss. Until we got close, I did not see the sign although we were looking for it.

The meal was tasty and the prices were very reasonable. The servings were generous and many adults will have food left over to take home for another meal.

For those who have not tried Indian cuisine, this would be a good place to start.

resp.text: Thanks Ralph for you good review. We were happy that you had a wonderful experience at this restaurant. Thanks once again for recommending this place to other people. We need loyal customers like you so we can improve on the quality and quantity of food. Hoping to see you again.

This should’ve been my first indication. We received our food, the food was ok, but we asked for a few things to be taken off. When the bill came the “manager” said since you “tired the food and drink we can’t take it off”. This makes no sense to me… I swiped my card then she turned the screen and I’m not sure if she tipped her self, or changed the amount. She also forged my signature to be able authorize the purchase. This is not right, and I recommend never eating at this restaurant.

Don't worry they did'nt overcharge you or took off any tips. Please try to come back again and have a good experience at this restaurant. Hope to see you again.

This is one of the best restaurants in the city. Not one of the best Indian cuisine restaurants, of which there are too few. One of the very best, any cuisine, any style.

We have enjoyed a few very nice Indian restaurants in the area over the years, but they closed down or were sold. We have been craving a place like this and when we saw it was open, we took a chance. Long story short, we we back two days later.

Tried a few different entrees, naan, samosas, and a few cauliflower dishes. The Gobi Manchurian is a real treat. And the samosas with the mint chutney/sauce.... I put the leftover sauce on a sandwich.

This is a bit of a hidden spot but I really hope everyone goes there. They are making amazing food.

name: Annika Rettstadt
text:
Indian Kitchen is where it's at!! My boyfriend and I were visiting from out of town and love Indian food, so we decided to order from Indian Kitchen on a whim. We were not disappointed! This is a mom and pop store hidden away in an outlet mall. Please support small and local businesses!

We ordered two vegetarian entrees: Palak Paneer and Paneer Tikka Masala. We also ordered the Mixed Vegetable Pakora appetizer, and a side of Garlic Naan. I will say that this is a LOT of food for two people since the portions were huge (we have days worth of leftovers) and we were served rice to compliment our meals. All of the food was absolutely delicious, and I look forward to returning to Indian Kitchen very soon.

resp.text: Thanks Annika for your feedback. We are glad you and your boyfriend liked the food. Hope to see you soon.

name: Taylor Satula
text:
Really impressed with the food me and my significant other ordered. We got a spread just to try it out and everything we ordered was delicious.

We got palak paneer, panner tikka masala, naan, (a boatload of) rice, mixed vegetable pakora, and it came with mint sauce and tamari sauce.

The paneer was firm with a great mild flavor. You could tell it was made fresh by the firm bouncy texture.

The spinach and the tikka masala sauces were nice and thick. Just the right amount of good spices talking to each other in the sauce.

Naan had great crispy tips and was also clearly homemade

Pakora was KILLER dipped in the mint sauce

I will absolutely be going back to Indian kitchen. It was a little bit hard to find because they don’t have an illuminated sign yet. It has a red curtain draped out front. Staff was very nice and I have nothing but good to say about it,,,,, it was just a really good spot. Glad they’re near my house.

resp.text: Thanks Taylor for the feedback. Now with your comparison we know where we stand. We will try our best to give our best in terms of food. See your soon.

name: Amy Ragan
text:
I was loyal to Ruchi when they were at this location. Tonight my husband and I did a taste taste between the newly-relocated-Ruchi and the newly-opened-Indian Kitchen. We got a medium chicken tikka masala and a garlic naan takeout from both restaurants at the same time.

Indian Kitchen’s curry was thicker and more flavorful, and their chicken looked like it had been nicely charred. Ruchi’s gravy was thin and much more bland, and the chicken was dry and kinda sad looking.

The rice and naan were pretty comparable for both, but Indian Kitchen’s naan was totally loaded up with garlic so it had more yummy garlic flavor.

We did not expect this outcome! We just thought it would be fun to compare. But it looks like we will be returning to Indian Kitchen!

resp.text: Thanks Amy for your feedback and  for the hardwork you and your husband did to compare the food. We will try to keep up the good work and keep the consistency in terms of the food. Hope to see you soon.

text: Great food and amazing prices! The owner truly takes pride in what he does and always makes sure to put the customer first! If your looking for food that's cooked with love this is definitely the place to go!👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽

text: We ordered for the first time tonight & SOOOO glad we did!! Not only were the burgers, fries, & wings AWESOME & the food hot, the customer service was GREAT, too!! We will DEFINITELY order again!!

name: Thomas Montgomery
text: Only chicken place that delivers in Huntsville. Great food, reasonably priced, fast service! I’d eat here everyday if I could....

name: Kay H
text: the wings are very good and well seasoned. I have ordered them several times from the South Parkway location and each time I have been pleased. The customer service is great and I recommend them to anyone looking for good wings at a great price

name: Yvonne Johnson
text:
Amazing fried chicken at an affordable price! This place holds a special place in my heart and in my stomach. First off, it's fried chicken; who doesn't love fried chicken?! It's also me and my fiancé favorite spot. Real down home Southern Fried Chicken & fixings!  Chicken Delivery is an Huntsville staple so if you haven’t tried it, you're missin' out, y'all! A fast food chicken restaurant that has a walk up counter or delivers to your doorstep. They also have sandwiches and baked potatoes. Last but not least, their sweet tea is amazing every time! I love this place from the tea, to the sides, to the fried chicken! Service is quick and friendly as well. Definitely a place to check out if you love fried chicken that's delicious all the way through it. It's seasoned so well. Ugh. Drooling thinking about it.
PS. They also do catering. Every event has been an absolute hit, and crowd pleaser. I will continue to use them and pass along the word of mouth advertisement. A review is the least I could do. I owe this restaurant. I got the fiancé from eating this GOODNESS to my LIPS giving me my HIPS (wink). Okay so what if I had hips before eating here. Can’t a girl dream!

name: Derrick Long
text: I would have given 5 stars but they pick and choose when to answer the phone, and this is almost every day. I know cause I order frequently. It's sad that the food is good but the service sucks due to non availability. If you can't handle being busy close your doors for good. I tip them very well so I expect them to answer the phone during business hours.

name: George Freas II
text: Best chicken tenders that you can buy!  Huge, tender, succulent pieces of chicken breaded the Southern way!  The potato wedges are excellent as well.

Now, today, I remembered them and Googled them and was SO EXCITED that they are seemingly still open....SEEMINGLY!!!! Apparently missing out on HUNDREDS OF ORDERS FOR OVER A YEAR didn't kill their business. I'm impressed... But still incredibly pissed off that these people haven't figured out that getting orders from your customers is imperative for receiving business..... BECAUSE THEY STILL WONT ANSWER THE PHONE AND TAKE MY FREAKING ORDER. 👿

text:
I absolutely love Taco Bell and have been going to the ones in Decatur and Florence for years. Last night though, I stopped at the one on Memorial Parkway around 10 pm.

At 7 am today and all day today I am so beyond sick. Something in their food destroyed my stomach (I know it’s Taco Bell, but I’ve never had trouble keeping the food down.)

Something isn’t right about this Taco Bell. Go to a different one.

name: Brad Miller
text: It's Taco Bell. They did get one of the items in my mobile order wrong.  Would have given them 2 stars.  But Asst Mgr gave me the correct item (loaded nacho fries, which were surprisingly good) and threw in order of the cinnamon crisps (puffed fried packing peanuts?).

name: Angela Olivares
text: usually i really do like this place. nice employees and food is always correct. but recently around the same time every night they say they’re system is down and they can’t make food? but employees are sitting outside smoking cigarettes just chilling? if y’all can’t do anything then why are y’all “open”. i work fast food i know how it works. how can y’all afford 5 employees in labor and not making any money? just doesn’t make sense. go home instead of sitting in the clock doing nothing claiming “system is down” so y’all can’t make food. okay. this is a brand new store, y’all should have just kept the old one up.

name: Tom Parker
text: This taco bell is a JOKE! I just went there to get a replacement for an order that they couldn't get right the fist time. As soon as I arrived and told the lady at the box who I was and what I was there for, I got massive attitude. I could not believe the way I was treated! Hey taco bell...don't be mad at me if you can't do your job right the first time. I have NEVER been anything like that with you....I'm a single man who works local. I spend upwards of $200 a month at this store! (Infact just got a $54 work lunch from them YESTERDAY) I hope you've enjoyed my money because I promise you'll get NO MORE. Good day.

name: Deonna Tucker
text: I work here. Love the new building.

name: Erin Conn
text: I have been to this location 4 times total. I have NEVER received a correct order. The most painful thing about that is that the only thing I order “off menu” is extra cheese. Today, I ordered 2 bean burritos and 2 hard shell tacos, all with extra cheese. What I received was 2 beef burritos with nacho cheese and 2 soft tacos without any cheese at all. WILL NEVER REVISIT THIS LOCATION.

name: Curtis Lindsay
text:
I've had good service here and the food has been up to snuff.

One night recently, though, I was given two packs of sauce for a large-ish ($20) drivethru order. When I pulled back through and politely asked for more sauce, the bespectacled red-headed young lady expediting for the window made a sickly exaggerated smirk at me and then tossed an armful of sauce packs into a bag. The young man at the window then handed the bag to me with an amused grin and without comment. There were 54 packs -- I counted them later out of curiosity. I'll never visit this location again.

name: alex B
text: If you're coming from downtown going Southside, stop at the taco bell on airport road. In the last 3 weeks, I've gotten the wrong order, I've been asked to pull around front to wait for 20 minutes for my order, and I've been told that their system was down 3 times. I don't know if it's management or what, but this location is terribly unreliable and it's safer to go somewhere else on your way home.

name: Michelle Owens
text: If you're thinking of ordering pizza at the Domino's Pizza in Priceville, AL, you're better off ordering from somewhere else. My first encounter with them, I placed an online order 30 minutes before closing, & was told they couldn't complete my order, even though it showed online that they could. On top of that, I was STILL charged for my order...that I never received! Yeah...I'm not even joking. I received a phone call telling me they already closed off orders or something, but that my card had been charged. I was like..."Whaaattt??!!" How can I be charged for food I never received?? I mentioned that they didn't close until midnight, & he said that was correct, but because they don't "normally" get orders that late, they had already closed off orders or whatever he said. I guess he's never heard of people that work second shift?? So, now I'm out $22.00 & no food! Beware!

resp.text:
Michelle Owens
I am very sorry to hear about your experience.  We want to make this right.  Please email us at teamdaks.customercare@gmail.com so we can look into the matter.  Please include what store you shop with, your phone number and address so we can fully address this for you.

name: Richard Shepard
text: Just an awesome place to stop on your way home from work and grab a pizza. The pizza is always hot and fresh. This place deserves 5/5.

resp.text:
Richard Shepard
We work hard to earn your 5 star and seeing your review means everything to us. Your feedback will be used in in continued training at the store level as we strive to provide a great meal and service to our community.
THANK YOU!

resp.text:
Kevin Breuers
Thanks for choosing us and your review is very important. I apologize your experience was not at a 5 star level and I want to make things right. Can you email me at teamdaks.customercare@gmail.com when you have a moment so I know exactly what happened and how I can fix this?

text: If I can put negative stars I would.  I am an over the road truck driver.  The person on the phone said that they are not aloud to deliver to my truck and that I would have to leave my truck and walk across a busy street and then wait there to get my delivery then I would have to walk back across the street with my food in hand to get back to my truck.  I always call and order when I am in a different location and it never seems to be a problem to deliver to an 18-wheeler. All the other location I have gone to in Alabama do not have a problem with.   What a waste of time to call this place or even order from them.

This was the worst "chili cheese dog" I've EVER,  in my ENTIRE LIFE, seen!  NO cheese,  on either one. SOGGY  buns! The "chili" appears more like refried beans than any chili I've ever seen!  Is chili supposed to be BROWN MUSH? And apparently they usually put yellow mustard on their "chili dogs" because my friend knew to tell them not to on my "chili cheese dogs,  all the way". That's how my friend ordered my meal. And under the brown mush they had put ketchup!
So, to summarize,  an over boiled hot dog, with ketchup and a little bit of brown mush, on a soggy bun wrapped in white paper X2 standing up in a brown lunch sack!

After ordering a sandwich and chips I asked for a water and even though they have plenty of cups and water in their fountain drink dispenser they refused to let me have water without paying for a drink. I feel like that is the scummiest thing a business can do it shows they only care about profits and don't care about their customers at all. I would never recommend anyone support a business with these kind of ethics and take your business elsewhere. Also even if I did buy a drink refills are .99¢ if I'm not sitting in the 20' - 20' seating area

name: Jason Sharitt
text:
Used the app to place an order at 6:44 Saturday evening from a house party. Socialized with friends for a while and saw two missed calls a few minutes later at 6:53. No voicemails but I figured it had to be Domino’s so I called back. Waited for 10 minutes and no one picked up. App said pizza was being delivered. Called back at 7:26 to see where food was. Finally got someone on the phone. The gentleman said he tried calling twice to tell me there were no delivery drivers available. But he could’ve left a voicemail for that! Why did I have to try and call him back for that information? At this point we’re all hungry and now the guests are upset.

So a few things here:
1. The app shouldn’t show my food is being delivered when it hasn’t even been made.
2. I shouldn’t have been able to order delivery if the location doesn’t offer it.
3. The employee should have left a voicemail with the information and not wasted my time trying to call back for it.

So be careful using this location. The communication is very poor. Call ahead of time to see if they can deliver. Don’t use the app.

EDIT: Bumping up a star since the manager called me to explain the situation and obviously wants to make things right. I may give this location another try since it seems I caught them in a perfect storm of "things going wrong", and being a former restaurant worker myself, I can sympathize.

My order was flagged for review since it was associated to an address that has been linked to multiple phone numbers. This is a national Domino's corporate policy to keep tabs on potential sketchy orders.

Domino's corporate always expects their franchisees to have delivery drivers, and never anticipates a scenario where a given store has no delivery drivers show up for work. So don't expect the app design to improve, and I can't fault this location for that.

Domino's typically doesn't leave voicemails as they prefer to talk about potential order problems in person, and in my case, try to present an offer for me to pick up the pizza myself. Even so, we'll agree to disagree as the voicemail could have said "We have no delivery drivers for tonight. Please call us back by X time if you still want the order and can arrange to have it picked up."

resp.text: Our team appreciates your review and feedback. We apologize for not earning a 5-star review from you and want you to know we will be working hard to earn your 5-star review from you. Thank you and have a great day, Jason!

That much was understandable since I know people are having a hard time finding workers. After I called to check on my pizza, she said I needed to place my order again online since she couldn’t apply my coupon over the phone. She told me they now had a driver, and it would be delivered. I order my pizza again and the tracker says it has been delivered. 30 minutes later- still no pizza. I was left on hold for 20 minutes or so and called back several times with no answer. I love dominos, but I hate to say I won’t be ordering from this store anymore. Save your money!!

Edit: Updating from 1 to 3 stars because the very kind manager, Samantha, called and apologized for the mix up and refunded me for my order!

name: Duncan Mills
text:
Honestly it just all around sucked.

The line/checkout was confusing, I did not know where to pay or wait for my food. My sub wasn’t made right in front of me like literally every other sub sandwich place. They got it served through the window then I got asked “what you want?” And they peel open your sandwich to add ingredients.

The food, albeit edible for a hungry shift worker, was pretty sad. All I wanted was a normal BLT sub sandwich with mayo, and some chips. Instead, I got served this weird but sad triple-decker pressed Texas toast BLT. I didn’t mind the non traditional approach, but the execution was bad. The Texas toast was smashed so thin I had this dense layer of mayonaise soaked bread to peel off my teeth. The bacon was cooked well but the lack of lettuce, tomato, and a normal sub bun kinda ruined it.

At least it was cheap, around $7.50, so at least it wasn’t an expensive mistake.

Original:
Placed an order online, paid, and got a confirmation. FIFTY MINUTES later, we received a call from the manager letting us know that they do not deliver to our area. I informed her that the mailer we received 2 days ago had us in their delivery area (3 miles away). We are in the range ON THE MAP ON THE MAILER.

I asked for a refund

name: Alex Nelson
text: A friend recommended that I try this new pizza joint, Marco's store 8354, according to my receipt. I placed the order online for deliver and was told the pizza would arrive within the hour. An hour and a half later I call Marco's because my food had not arrived and was told the deliver driver was around the corner. Twenty minutes later I call Marco's again and talked to the manager who finally admitted that they had "lost" their driver. The manager offered a refund which, three months later I have not received. I understand that people make mistakes and would have written a much better review if the manager had kept his word. But hey, that's ok, there are plenty of other delicious pizza joints in Birmingham.

resp.text: Alex, we’re so sorry that we let you down. Please fill out a feedback form at www.marcosguestfeedback.com so we can have someone reach out to you directly and make things right.

name: Kurt Bensch
text:
Had a heck of a time with this one.  Tried to call and place an order for delivery two times.  Both times the person on the phone acted or flat out just couldn't understand when I began to say the address of where I was.  Apparently 18th is hard to understand and when I even included that we were staying at the Hilton,which is literally a few blocks away, there was still confusion.  So, we get in our car and drive there.  We tell the person behind the counter about our 2 phone calls and he laughingly shows us his phone which has a damaged cord.  Pretty sure this guy was a manager of some sorts too.  We tried to ordered a couple sandwiches and of course, they had no bread.

We ordered a thin crust pizza and some sodas.  We got back to the hotel and opened the box only to find the greasiest pizza I have ever seen.  The thin crust pizza was as flimsy as a paper towel.  The grease basically covered the entirety of the bottom of the box.  It was disgusting.  Thin crust pizza should never be that greasy or flimsy.  This was just a horrible experience all around.

resp.text: Kurt, please give us a chance to make it right and fill out a feedback form at www.marcosguestfeedback.com. This way, we can have someone in your area reach out.

name: Ambria Rush
text: Best pizza I've tasted in all my 28 yrs on earth .. Enjoyed the grand opening specials ..Drivers very friendly .. Had no complaint against the company until today 08/16/16.. When we ordered a salad  from Marcos ...and the driver called back and claimed he was lost and he couldn't find our residence .. ( which they have delivered to us many times before) .. They gave the driver the correct address and he repeated it  and replied I can't deliver it AND HUNG UP !! .. So upon calling the store to complain about the "CUSTOMER SERVICE"..  I was informed that because I lived in a "urban " dwelling.. ( south town projects ) we wouldn't be able to receive delivery .. However we could walk and spend our money with them.. I will NEVER spend my HARD EARNED money with them again . they advertised their business in our neighborhood and the entire neighborhood showed up and spent money at the grand opening. Now all of a sudden you can't deliver here. There is a diverse group of nationalities here and believe it or not everyone here doesn't rob and steal. You really don't deserve any stars at all.  ONE STAR

name: Steven Newsome
text: I ordered a pizza with pepperoni and sausage and it was delivered without sausage. I called and talked to Marcus, who had good customer service. I told him, "it's not a big deal, just wanted to let you guys know". He insisted on getting the manager on the phone. Skylar, the manager, asked me to send a picture, which I immediately sent. After putting me on hold and observing the picture he told me "you're lying, I did that pizza and I don't make those mistake. You picked the sausage off the pizza." He completely caught me off guard and I had to ask him if he was being serious. I thanked him and hung the phone up. Skylar clearly isn't a business manager and I definitely won't be ordering from this location again.

name: Justin Twilley
text: Stopped at Corner Quick stop to get two cups of ice for drinks I already had. Went in and got two cups from the store side and noticed the I've had black chunks in it. I'm disgust I walked to the counter and explained to the cashier with black rotted teeth that that was inappropriate and was going to pour it out. I looked over at subway and seen they had their own drink dispenser marked subway customers only, I was at the point where I would pay their price for Ice just so I would not have to drink black mold. I pushed my cup against it to fill with ice and wow disgusting the same thing, black chunks in the Ice. I threw my cups away and decided to leave. Would give negative stars if I could. Very nasty place. Will never be back. If the Ice looks that way I could only imagine how the food is stored at this location. I hope someone In upper management steps in before the health department shuts the doors!

name: Brian Moore (Armyballer)
text: Good Subway, great ole lady's usually there with a great attitude.

name: Shawn Bowman (Shasas)
text: Stopped by to ge a sandwich on my lunch break and was met by an older lady who was busy helping another customer, ok fine. She looks over and says " push that button as soon as your ready" to which I replied "sure thank you". Well I was having a difficult time deciding on my sandwich as I eat here alot and have had almost every combination you could think of. Well there was no one behind me and in fact hardly anyone in the store but while I was debating with myself the lady reaches up and pushes the button herself and another older lady comes from the back I immediately inform her I was not ready and did not push the button and the first lady says " well you was just standing there". I declined to patronize this establishment after this as I do not like to be rushed by the employees of someplace that's supposed to be serving ME not the other way around. Now things like this have happened here before these ladies are always working together and one is nice and the other is not. The one that is not often times has smart things to say or is very rude and short with customers and today I just wasnt having it. I understand your elderly but if you cant handle customer service you should perhaps find another job. It's because of this unprofessional attitude that this lady has on everyone of my visits that I will NOT be returning as a customer , possibly all subways but most definitely this one.

name: Boyanna Weaver
text: Best sub ever..

name: Caleb Hawn
text: I absolutely LOVE Subway. This specific Subway location is definately no exception. It's located inside of the Wavaho gas station, so you can buy more then what they sell at Subway, so you can get a candy bar or anything else to go with your meal instead of only chips. Don't get me wrong, though; I do enjoy their chips. I also love the avacado/guacamole season, which happens every summer. I LOVE their avacado and guacamole sandwhich toppings. You can choose any toppings you want, or just order something on the menu. I almost never order from the menu. I just choose exactly what I want my sub to be, which is what Subway's all about. I love this location because it's like right near my house, so it is really convenient for mybfamily and I to order take out. If you want to eat IN the place, they do have a single two-peeson table you can eat at. If you are passing by this nice building, you can stop by and get some Subway, as well as anything else they sell at a gas station/car oil place. Thank you for reading my review of this unique Subway location, and I hope that I could help you choose weather or not to visit it. Thanks!

The people at the drive through window have always been lovely.
The food however is the reason I'm giving one star. The Chicken Quesadilla is what I typically order and it is barely filled with anything. The ends are typically just tortilla, and 50% of the time there is no sauce. Just chicken and hardly melted cheese.
This picture is from my most recent order. Both of my Quesadillas were filled like this.

text: First thing, the $5 Grande Crunchwrap promotion, real bust because they’re “out of crunchwraps”. Second, there’s a total of 7 vehicles parked and waiting on food from the drive-thru.

text:
Sign says breakfast and they don’t have breakfast. Why even bother opening in the morning?

Discontinued about 2 months ago? Even though you just opened?

Either remove the sign or serve breakfast. Either will make me happy and I’ll be willing to order some food to give a better review. The people SEEM relatively nice and the location SEEMS clean but I won’t know until they stop with the false advertising.

name: Christopher Jackson
text: Complete fail. First off they can't make the order correctly. Asked for an order and make with just meat and cheese, and they screwed that up. Also the sweet tea IS GARBAGE, brown water, no tea flavor, no sugar. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY. AND THEY THINK THEY DESERVE $15 PER HOUR. SMH

name: Amanda Davis
text: If you guys are going to have on your website that  you're open tii 11 o'clock,, don't close at 9😒

name: Elliott Smith
text: This taco bell is so poorly managed that they never have featured items in stock. There's no point in even having this location. Just go to a different one.

name: Michael Hooker
text: Waited in line at the drive thru for 20+ mins. When the lady spoke, it was hard to hear her. I asked her to speak up, it didnt help. I began my order then after I mentioned the first item she asked me to hang on. 5 mins later, still hadn't come back on the speaker. Went inside, used the kiosk, still standing here waiting over 20 more mins for the food. They just locked the doors at 10pm yet are supposed to be open till midnight. Told people walking up that they are closed.

name: melanie vinson
text: They have never gotten my order right! It doesn't matter what I order, something will be left off, mixed up, or doesn't make it to the bag. Now, they don't make fries anymore?? I guess I'll go to Prattville for fries, at least I know they won't forget the cheese.

name: Mercy Andrews
text: Rarely have what I want to order. Didn't have breakfast, usually don't have the doritos tacos...Tried getting the potatoe tacos tonight because they are really good and they gave me potatoe bowls 🤷‍♀️. Zelda road location gets mainly all our business.

name: Jasmine Perry
text: Food is never fresh! Day or night; I’ve eaten there over 5 times within the past 6 months and each time I was disappointed. Fast is not cheap. The staff is pretty nice and friendly but corporate needs to step in for quality control and really focus on training  the cooks. The food should be severed fresh regardless of the fact of it being fast food. No one should have to pay for food that’s has been sitting under a warmer too long. Every time I have ordered a chalupa it was hard as a brick and I didn’t even feel like disputing it. The ONLY chalupa that I have eaten, “that was actually fresh”, was the chicken bacon ranch chalupa that was there for a limited amount of time and they had no choice but to make it fresh because it probably wasn’t at high demand. I’ll probably never eat there again now that I have made this post, but something needs to be done. Work ethics and training needs to be reevaluated. Workers should take pride in what they do even if it’s making fast food!

text: Drive thru is extremely slow, continuously have lobby closed, sign says breakfast but was told they don't serve breakfast,

This place needs some serious help and a change in management.

I have been served breakfast by different employees, just don't even bother going if it's before 8, the employee is lazy and basically refuses to do her job.

text: I went there this past weekend, and it was filled with cars waiting for their food. I considered turning around, but I actually got through the line fairly quickly. I appreciate the staff's professional service. I parked and my food came out a few minutes later. I saw the staff inside and know that they should have had twice the number they had when you consider how busy they were. They did a great job under those circumstances. I think we all forget in these times that we all must understand that things shouldn't always be given to us immediately.

name: Sierra Sapp
text: You know how every town has a terrible Taco Bell? Well, this is this town's one. And they haven't even been open a whole year yet.

name: ⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻
text:
Giving a 1 star review based on one poor visit seems kinda lame tbh. I've been coming to this location very frequently during my lunch breaks and it's been nothing but great every single time. The absolute worst I've experienced is one visit where the food was a little cold, but I've had that at other locales as well, plus my overall experience easily consumes that.

I'd 100% recommend this Taco Bell to anyone.

text: I’m not from here and It was 11:25 when I made it and they was already closed but they suppose to close at 12:00am. That won’t right at all. And it also was other people in line also trying to get food but couldn’t just as well as me. Bad view.

name: James Hines
text: It took for ever to get around the building at the drive-through. The parking lot is set up so you are pretty much trapped  by the drive-through traffic If you have to park. So when you get to the drive-through they take your order and make you drive all  the way around the building to park and bring your food to you but now you are trapped in the same drive-through line that you just waited in for ever on your food  to get out of the parking lot. They should not make you go park when you are at the drive-through window you should wait on your food so you don't have to be trapped for 30 minutes in cars. This does not make sense and I won't be going back To get in that situation again. To make matters worse I barely parked when they brought me the food so making me move and park because it took an extra 2 minutes cost me 15 minutes trying to get out.  Bad design on making people park .

That wasn’t the problem, the problem was it took almost 30 minutes for them to even find what car I was in because they took no measures in finding out who these orders belong to at the window. NO SYSTEM AT ALL! If there is a manager there they need to be trained better. Not to mention my daughters order only had a few thrown in chips for nachos, I order a side of sour cream that was literally a teaspoon size amount, and my quesadilla had the wrong sauce and was burnt. TAKE POINTERS FROM CHIK-fil-A please!!!!

Guess I will not be going back there and will drive to another location if I want Taco Bell.  Also, some days the line for the drive up is in the parking lot where it belongs and some nights it is all the way up the road instead which blocks the urgent care office along that road.

name: Olivia Burg
text: If I could give ZERO stars I would. I was served absolutely RAW chicken. Not even attempted to be cooked. Disgusting. And the only way to find out was by biting into one. Wasn’t even offered a refund, and was treated like it was no big deal. Do not order here and give these lazy workers your service.

name: Kathy Barron
text: The Fantastic pizzas and awesome customer service you guys give! Whatever the customer wants the customer gets at Alabaster Pizza Hut!

name: UR Obsolete
text: Have the oven hot enough to thoroughly cook the pizza.

name: Kendrick Curry
text: I was supposed to take a picture before I ate it... 😓 But it was perfect fresh out of the oven. 🤤... My review: I messed my order up, my online receipt said I messed  my order up... I was going to take the "not my favorite pizza" but the guy who was working offered to fix it. 🤯 Was not expecting that especially since it was my fault and I didn't make a big deal about it. He said he wanted me happy. 🤯 I always get good service and pizza from this location and always end happy. I don't know his name I'm assuming he's the manager as I always see him working late. The last time he helped me was a year ago, when we talked about their wings being fried, and we agreed that baked soggy wings are the worst. I was impressed he took the time out to talk to me and explain their products when he was busy. A year later he's still great and helped me tonight. I felt compelled to leave a review and tip better next time. I took this opportunity to point out to my wife that this was why I tip even if I'm just picking up pizza.

name: Vickie Ward
text: I accidently ordered the wrong type of crust online. I called the store and the young man was able to correct my mistake and the pizza was wonderful!!

name: M Walters
text: Hot, freshhhh, and delishhhh! Stellar customer service as well, by the way.

name: Ale Rivera
text: a horrible experience with the employee she is rude and grumpy….  I definitely won't be back

name: toni hampton
text: I know I’m surveying Pizza Hut but it was hot and ready.Perfectly cooked and fresh

name: bridgette chism
text: Pizza was fresh and hot. Also, the Pizza was ready as promised

name: Krystal Phillips
text: When I place a delivery order it always take two hours if not longer. When it gets here the pizza is freezing like the driver has been driving around. This place is horrible. Dominos is the best!

name: Brannan Kramer
text: Unacceptable Experience: Placed online order for delivery at 6:16P.M. on a Monday and didn't receive order until 8:26P.M. I called to ask about my order at 7:55P.M. and was told that they were out of the Meaty Marinara pasta I had ordered. They replaced my order and delivered my food to me. I understand busy evenings and being cripplingly short staffed. I worked a pizza place for years. What is absolutely unacceptable about my experience was the lack of communication. As soon as my order was received I should've been called and informed that there was no Meaty Marinara. As soon as any order hits 45 minutes elapsed there should be a call to inform and reassure the customer that there order is on the way. Really disappointed in the management tonight.

name: Jackie Cottingham
text: Great customer  service and pizza  was great

name: Florence Muhindi
text: I made a delivery order from this location, and the people that work here told me that they couldn’t deliver my order to me because their driver had car problems..... so basically they only have one driver in the whole store so I never got my order

name: Nancy Stephens
text: Order medium pizza with cinnamons sticks to go. Food was good, but when I ordered on the website it told me how many minutes it was going to take to be ready. But no where did it say to call when you arrive in the parking lot. I am only complaining because I have ordered before and my pizza was brought out to me without me calling that I was in the parking lot.

name: Donnie
text:
I ordered a specific pizza from the app, asked while picking up the pizza if it was that pizza, the guy running the register (and by running I mean he was kicked back with headphones in) tells me that it is that pizza.

I go home, discover that it a different pizza, call the store to ask about it, and a woman asks if I ordered from the app. I say yeah and she says they don't even serve that food and I shouldn't have ordered from the app.

The receipt clearly says what it was supposed to be. So instead of just not selling me that pizza, they make me a wrong pizza, charge me for it, and won't give a refund. I'm never using this Pizza Hut again.

Update - I gave this Pizza Hut another chance since I was ordering for my father-in-law and it was the closest one to him. I don't know if it's an app problem or what, but I got the wrong order again. Whoever answered the phone did offer me a refund, but I am definitely ruling this place out. Spent almost 50 bucks the first time, and only 12 this time. Both wrong and not worth the hassle of trying to get the right food. I will just order from the one a few miles away in Helena, which has always been reliable.

name: Brian Davis
text: Prompt polite service. 😎

name: Jacquelyn Craig
text: Staff always friendly

name: Russell Morse
text: Fast friendly and always on time

name: Andrew Edwards
text: Incredible , as always.  They were out of large dough and gave me 2 mediums ...  No complaints at all!!

name: Rachel Cattell
text: Pizza is good, but they were not very helpful. My husband ordered a pizza, and it was missing some ingredients. We called, and they didn’t apologize at all. The employee didn’t apologize and the manager didn’t either. They just said you have to bring the pizza back in or we can’t remake it for you. Even though coronavirus is going around, they said it’s company policy to bring the pizza back into the store. I don’t really believe that, and will be emailing the company. We order here frequently, and never had a bad experience until today.

name: Faireca Anderson
text: Great curbside service. The pizza was a little dry but still good.  The wings were a hit!!

name: Corey Lamon
text: This location always gets my order right. My order is always fresh and the wait time is no longer than 15 minutes for any order. Awesome staff and clean restaurant. I highly recommend

name: Jeff GACESA
text: I asked for extra extra extra extra sauce. It doesn't look like I got any sauce.

name: Cecilia Lopez
text: They were super busy, but gave great customer service. Good job!

name: John Jackson
text: Very well organised and convenient place. They serve big meals and for inexpensive prices. We liked the food a lot and the staff members were very friendly and chatty. Will definitely recommend this place.

name: Randall Murphy
text: I remember at a time when Pizza Hut took pride in their pizza. We just ordered pizza and picked it up within 20 minutes after placing the order. Pizza looked and tasted old, was not even cut properly and poorly prepared. I am completely disappointed in the direction this company continues to go down. We basically ate cardboard with a little bit of tomato sauce and a few toppings. Do better Pizza Hut!

name: Patrick Knotts
text:
When the app says 30 to 40 minutes on delivery and your pixza shows up almost two hours later,  there is definitely a customer service disconnect somewhere. Customers understand busy if they are accurately informed.  You have my phone number,  give a courtesy call and you can gain repeat  business. Keep this up and I'll be headed elsewhere for pizza delivery.
****Update - they have improved noticeably. I am giving them more chances especially the rapper.

name: sierra gutierrez
text: So I had ordered a pizza last night from you guys around 9:30ish or so and got it in all great timing but my only issue was your driver first she tried handing me the wrong order and insisted I was wrong & that it was mine for about a few minutes finally after I showed her the receipt online she had made a phone call to a manager to make sure then had finally brought me my food. but all I'm saying you guys should really pay attention to who y'all hire this lady was really high on drugs  or something the way she was acting and moving her jaw was out of control! Very very uncomfortable

name: Len Brown
text: They can not deliver a pizza to the correct address and by the time I call  and they get someone to my correct address the pizza is cold.  I will never use them again.

name: TheCool Mom
text: Pizza is great, however customer service is not so good. The girl at the cash register (Ashley Tatum) was not friendly at all, she didn’t greet me. I said “Hey how are you?” she didn’t say anything. My order was “ready” on the screen but she told me I had to wait because it wasn’t ready. She just looked like she’d rather be somewhere else. No smiles, etc.

name: DeAnna Grayson
text: Fresh. Hot. Friendly. Recommend.

name: Kim Cook
text: Wow...Pizza Hut has really gone downhill. Need new management. Spent 30.00 on 2 pizzas and I could have gone somewhere else and received good pizza for that price. We ordered the BBQ pizza and have been getting it for years. It has always been good but this was dry, hardly any sauce and they forgot the cheese. Worst pizza ever. Pizza Hut has lost my business....it and because it used to be a great pizza place.

name: Barbara Jones
text: I don't know if there are short handed but I order @ 5:50 pm and 7:20 may food still deliver. I called and couldn't get anyone to answer the phone so I could cancel my order

name: sean thomas
text: The 5 dollar deal is pretty good. I ordered pizza, garlic knots, and wings. Guy behind counter brought me pizza and knots. I told him I also had wings. He didn't look happy. He threw some wings in a container and shook them for maybe 5 seconds. There was no garlic parmesan sauce on the wings.

name: FeedTheTeethMachine
text: The food has been hot and consistent the last few times

name: Andrew Ryan did nothing wrong
text: Pizza Hut Alabaster is really a joke. I've never had a good experience with them. They're always late. I've had pizza delivered twice that looked like the box was shaken and the pizza looked like a ball of crumbled paper. Both times this happened they said sorry and didn't offer a refund or to bring another pizza. The bread is always under cooked. At the moment I'm waiting on a order that's 45 minutes late so far. Order from Domino's and you'll be better off.

name: Josh Buchanan
text: Ordered online three times and all three times the pizza was hot and ready when I arrived. The person helping me always goes over the order to make sure everything is as it should be. great location that is hardly ever busy so its in and out quickly every time.

name: C Carden
text: Called to place an order for delivery at 1pm today. Was told 45m-1hr, so no problem. 1 hour and 25 minutes later, it finally arrives. Cold, soggy pizza. Disappointed and very disgusting.

name: Charles Williams Jr.
text: Bad bad business waited over an hour for delivery ... for food.... called back and they placed us on long hold ... gave fake names.. and mocked us laughing in background.. then finally asked us did we wanna cancel a $45 order.. wow really need to talk to corporate... will never ever have to worry about us again...

text: They need a responsible manager yesterday we called from home no answer we drove to pizza as we went we called and no answer... We walked in no one was at front desk!!!! so I called standing in front desk no sound of phone ringing, I looked to the back the guy that had taken our order  and made the  pizza after seen us... had head phones on so didn't even look up for about almost 10 mins... After I told him about the phone calls he started answering the phone and wanted to give me a free coke to compensate, but I didn't take it I could have been home waiting for my pizza to be delivered but that was not going to be possible due untrained irresponsible personal.. this is not the first time not to long ago we called no answer so we drove to pizza hut and the person was seating out side with Jimmy John's employee like nothing was going on laughing.... Like I said they need a manager  a real manager in there!!!

Yall need to get some good people to work there and treat them well so they will help the blonde hair delivery girl out.

We hung up again and 1 minute later I got a call saying she walked in and where exactly was I because I didn't put nothing in the instructions box but I clearly wrote PLEASE CALL so they could know my exact location. My order finally shows up at 11:54 smh

We reported the issue to the cashier/food preparar and requested to pay an upcharge to purchase a juice/soda from the refrigerator.   Her response was $2.08 and that a drink from the refrigerator was sold separatly and could not be combined with a combo meal.  Fountain soda's only.

resp.text: Aaron, we apologize for the inconvenience. Our stores have specific areas where delivery is available.  We’d be happy to assist with a carryout order.

text: This is the most unprofessional place to get any food from...There very rude and all need to be retrained on how to work in the plubic..The crew manger is very unprofessional (Jeff) definitely need a new leader..besides him.

resp.text: Hello, Kameal. We take these things very seriously and want to know more. Please tell us about your experience on our feedback form at www.tellmarcos.com.

name: Stephen Bermudez
text: We ordered a pepperoni and one of their specialty pizzas. The pepperonis were smaller but there were loads of them. We got curbside carryout and the whole process was smooth and easy. The food/price is decent, but use a coupon and 👍🏻👍🏻. Overall a good addition to the 431/165 area.

name: Codi Burford
text: I agree with Aaron. 4 Pizza Pirates delivers to me as well and their pizza is always hot, but I would love something different. I was excited to have something new in the Seale area as well even if it was another pizza place, but the delivery criteria Marcos has seems ridiculous and will prevent me from doing business because of the inconvience the drive has to make. 4 Pizza Pirates will continue getting my business every week until I decide to carry out. It's a shame. A suggestion should be recommended to corporate.

resp.text: Codi, we apologize for any inconvenience. Our stores have specific areas where delivery is available.

text: Bobbie and tamira (sorry if I spelled your name wrong) are friendly sandwich artists. They handled a long line of customers and not 1 customer left upset. My sandwich today was the BEST I've had here in a long time. Please please keep these nice ladies employed.

text: Subway is always amazing. This one is usually good when it comes to the employees, they are fast and really nice but I went here earlier tonight and the 2 girls behind the counter seemed like they were having a competition to see who could be slower. It wasn't just my order they were slow with, but also with the person in front of me and behind me.

text: 3Xs in the last 2 weeks i have tried to come here. The first time they had no more bread. Huh? 2nd time they closed 2 hours early. Today i am here at 5:10. Says open till 9 and their closed, nobody here. Unreal!!! I will not come back again.

name: ipmanwanttobe
text: It's a nice place to get a pretty good sandwich. The prices seem a little to high, but the sandwiches are pretty good. But the new little sandwichs they just came out with, that cost only $1.85, is not a good deal. The roll is hard, and there's not really much meat. Also I ordered a 6" inch steak sandwich, and I'm pretty sure it was only 4" inches long. I think they need to stop calling it a "12 inch or 6 inch sandwich", and just say, Large or Small. The use of "inches", is very misleading.

name: JASON MAZINGO
text: Ok

name: Nain Alejandro
text: Nichole is the best employee you have. You should give her a raise. She is always so kind and pleasant to talk to, making it the reason why people want to come back to this place.

name: Anthony
text:
Rude, slow and won't honor coupons.  Brought a 2 week old coupon in which doesn't expire for another month.  Handed it to her before the sandwhiches were fixed and then told at checkout the coupon wasn't good because her manager hadn't entered it into the system yet.  Asked her to manually enter the price and was told that couldn't be done.  Asked for her to ring up a similarly priced item instead.  Was told very rudely "No".

Gave her a choice to honor what she admitted was a valid and local coupon or throw the entire order in the garbage.  She still refused...so I walked out.

name: John Doe
text: If you are using coupons at this location don’t even bother. We had a 100% valid coupon for Buy 1 Get 1 Free Footlong and were told no Subway locations are accepting the coupons that they are advertising. We were told every Subway in the area will also not accept the coupon because it’s too good of a deal. It’s almost as if Subway is advertising the coupon and telling their employees not to honor the coupon after the sandwiches are made so the customer winds up paying full price because they are already there. We said absolutely not and they threw away both sandwiches in front of us. Instead of making money off the Buy 1 Get 1 coupon, they just threw away 2 perfectly good sandwiches and made no money. Absolutely ridiculous waste of food and time.

text: Girl working inside not worth wasting your breath on. Can’t believe someone so rude is able to keep their job. I work in a restaurant and may be in a bad mood but still have to put a smile on for guests. I’m not asking for a whole theatrical but she ruined my whole mood with hers. Walked in and smiled at her..nothing. She was short with everything she said like I was completely inconveniencing her until someone she knew walked in and was oh so friendly to them. Won’t come back to this subway.
