name: Jessica Brown
text: Wow the two girls at the meat, bread and cheese end were so rude. First of all they didn’t look up or speak to me until they were good and ready. Once the one who took my order did, she acted like it was not only a bother and irritation, but if we didn’t have a bar in between us, that she would actually pounce on me. They were preparing a platter upon arrival and I guess they were so out of sorts about it they thought we will take it out on our customers & only kind employee that was there. The poor girl at other end that put toppings on and checked you out was extremely nice and did her job well. The other two scolded her and treated her like she was incompetent. I’m surprised she wasn’t in tears clearly they were frustrated with her as well, however I’d much rather have someone like her mess my order up than either of these girls touch my food again. The girl was counting my change out slowly so I left the tip on counter and walked over to drink station. One of the other girls came down and jumped on the girl asking in a bullying tone “what’s this?” I spoke up & answered and told the sweet girl to keep her head up and a smile on her face. Other two girls snickered, said something and laughed not in a happy laugh but condescending. I wish the poor sweet girl didn’t have to split the tip with the two mean girls. Whoever owns this location should be ashamed of themselves if they keep these other two girls on staff. I’m sure they will team up in defense together but I urge the owner to think hard before believing a word out their mouths.

name: Marian Carter
text: Staff was extremely rude! Acted like she didnt want to help and rolled her eyes at us when we asked for "9 grain wheat". Apartenly, we asked for the wrong type...so instead of explaining she kept asking if we wanted flat bread and rolling her eyes. We were getting 6 subs and cookies...so we walked out and went to Subway on Perdido Blvd. instead. They were super nice and very helpful. We are local and will never go back there again!

name: Tray Rasco
text:
Just pulled in and out of the drive through again. Apparently they have discontinued the Mexican pizza. The Mexican pizza was one of the only things in the menu unique to the chain. Everything else is better at a sit down Mexican restaurant. Now my decision to eat here will only be for quick food when I can not sit down at a restaurant.  This decision will cut my visits to Taco Bell by 70%. I use to go to Taco Bell 3+ times a week. Thank god for the party pack nachos, while they last. For today my money went to Jacks :(

I can only imagine someone did not do a proper cost benefit analysis on this decision. While it may look like they lost out in a Mexican pizza sale. In reality the Mexican pizza was my reason for stoping at Taco Bell. This was the unique item I could not get anywhere else. Once I was at the window for a Mexican pizza I would then add on the other 6-7 dollars Of menu items. I definitely do not crave an over priced taco or a burrito that has all beans..

text:
Some days it is excellent. Others your order is wrong or there is about half the food in the shell/wrap that corporate says there should be. Some days they wear masks, others they don't. Other days employees smoke next to the drive through line.

Its the roll of the dice any particular day what will happen when you visit. Be prepared to check your food before pulling away. And 99% of the time you have to ask for a receipt...which would be only a minor annoyance if they didn't act like you were asking them for super special treatment for such a simple thing that should be standard anyway.

resp.text: We are very sorry about this! At this time our receipt machine was down but we have that fixed! Thank you for your feedback!

text: I drive all the way up here to this subway at 8o’clock at night just to get there and be told that they’re closed. And they didn’t just tell me they were closed they were waving me away telling me to shoo. I saw the time on the door said they didn’t close until nine so I asked why they were closed and he said because we want to. Won’t ever be back here again.

name: Amanda Lord
text: First of all, both employees  Were supposed to be wearing masks. They were, but they were both wearing them below their noses. Good job guys. Not! Both employees were rude, one kept running the cash register with the same gloves she would handle food with. I asked for a chopped salad- my meat was NOT chopped up. She was going to give me cold bacon I had to ask for it to be heated up. I asked about dressing and the one employee rudely ignored me and  gave me my total for my salad. I paid and she was putting gloves on again getting ready to serve the next customer and I again asked about salad dressing. She sighed and said ‘well there should be some in there (there wasn’t) but what kind do you want?’ I told her and she threw the packet in there and slung my bag at me. Get back to eat my salad at work and the meat isn’t even chopped up. Not only were their attitudes poor (no ‘hi how are you, what can i get for you today’ or ‘thanks have a good day’ just rudeness. The freezer door was also open the entire time I was there. Im sure there are more than several health code violations mixed in all that. I worked at subway in high school and I know the masks aren’t fun but I work in healthcare so I have to wear them all day every day too. And if I would have acted the way those two ladies did today I would’ve been fired. No matter what job you have do it to the best of your ability. Shame on whoever the manager is for letting this go on. I WILL NOT be back. And I will also tell everyone I know not to use this store either.

name: Robert Jackson
text: Staff was friendly sub was good what else do you really want. Sure beats a drive through!

name: James R
text: Well, I've tried to post a review 3 times now but it keeps getting taken down. I guess Subway doesn't want people to know about the lazy employees, (line of 5 people while one girl makes sandwiches and runs register. wow.) letting their kids, not only come to work with them (no big deal), but let them in the back while they go through touching EVERYTHING. Then, I swear, almost systematically touching, wiping hands on face and moutch and nose, and touching ALL the food in the back that was to be brought up front. What's really concerning is the fact that they keep taking this down, why don't you handle the situation at work instead of trying to cover it up? Disgusting.

Overpriced mediocre sandwiches.

Visit tonight reminded me why i quit going to Subway...small meat portions...my choice of cheddar yielded a small sprinkling of "shredded" cheese so they could apparently limit the portion of it too.  Same for lettuce, etc, etc. One whole and one half skimpy sandwich cost $14.  Won't be back.

name: Don Julio
text:
I ordered 2 combos, a number 1 and a number 3 and some soup. Soup was cold out of the pot, it is supposed to be kept at a proper temp (140 or above).
Secondly, when I went to pay the numbers didn't come out right when she told me the total. When I questioned the total I was told over and over. Its right..Its Right, You order soup. When I looked at the receipt I was right, each sandwich had an Extra 25 cents tacked on, no not alot, I know but, that is the same as stealing...check your receipt if you go there, I wont be back. If someone lies about one thing they will lie about another and can't be trusted.

text: We found this place on our spring break. They serve light deli foods that are perfect for a warm day on the beach. They followed ADPH guidelines for Covid and even supplied masks for guests who stroll in from the beach and forgot theirs. Friendly service with a smile.

text: If I could give this 0 stars..i would! Very first time there and last! Oh.. everyone was really nice and that's not the problem. The problem is the sandwich! $11 Sandwich! I ordered the Amelia's Club. I waited 20 min for a to go order for an icebox COLD sandwich, with a piece of white processed(cheap plastic wrapped kind)slice of cheese(Not Swiss), bacon bits out of a package and white bread toast, a bag of chips and sm sweet tea!

text: Wonderful home style sandwich shop. The food was excellent and the people were very friendly. Great atmosphere.

name: John Tyler
text: Soup was great but bite side portion of potato salad

name: ARKTOS AUROCH
text: Judgement Day: I am one of those demands my money's worth. At first I was pressured / obligated (small business and all) to eat there. After eating quite a "few" times now, I can honestly say the sandwiches are "GREAT", when you have a salad there you've had a salad (none of this: ok I've had it, I'm still hungry). The cakes are made on site (from scratch no less) some of the best I have ever had, and the slices are so big, when you finish your sandwich you will have some to eat later. The service that you receive there is one of genuine southern hospitality but rarely seen nowadays....So yes they have truly earned a five star rating

name: Kathleen Morgan (LeenaBeena)
text: The compliments I could give this place would never do them justice! These ladies are absolutely wonderful! The food is always fantastic and the service is fast and friendly. I love visiting them for a bite to eat or ordering from Waitr if I can't go in myself. My ONLY negative comment would be that they aren't open on weekends and that's always when I start craving their food lol.

name: Dave Chase
text:
We are a party of 3 looking for a light soup and sandwich meal on the day before Thanksgiving. The soup was fresh and flavorful, exactly what we were looking for. The sandwiches used good quality meats. I had ordered a Rueben, and my only complaint was that it was on wheat bread and not a rye. Overall, a good quality lunch with very nice, friendly staff.

The surprise was the staff brought out a small chocolate cake for us to share that was to die for! I am generally not a cake fan, but this cake was super moist with perfect amount of chocolate. It's worth a 14 hour drive just for the chocolate cake.

name: Kyle Rockett
text: I have been eating here when I am in town since 2004. I love this place! Delicious food and very sweet folks.

name: Tiffany Ramey
text: Chicken Salad was amazing . Tea was cold & soup was yummy . I skipped cake and I regret it now ! #needcake

text: Awesome local restaurant. They have been around forever serving great home cooked meals. I really recommend trying them out.

text: We eat here at least once a week for lunch.  The lady's working there are always smiling and happy to see us.  I love everything I've had there,  but the loaded potato soup is yummy😋

resp.text: Thank you, Kimberly, we are happy to see you and love serving you.

Anna,

Cathy

Mr. LukiPooki

Cathy Lamberth

name: Katheryn Young
text:
A Cup of Everything Convenience Store is truly convenient--a menu loaded with coffees, teas, and sandwiches primarily; and a medium-sized cache of snack bars, bottled and canned drinks, chips, and even things like headache medicine, this little restaurant/shop is a wonderful addition to the Square in downtown HSV. In addition to having just about anything you might find yourself needing while out on a stroll around downtown, or serving jury duty, etc., the staff is incredibly friendly and will (in my experience) go out of their way to ensure your good day.
However, you will be paying convenience store prices for most of their selections: a cup of coffee will only leave you a little better off than a visit to Starbucks (without the carefully constructed flavor--ACoE's coffee has been particularly bitter in my experience, even with sugar and cream), and the food can get a little pricey as well. Packaged foods, on the other hand, seem to be a bit cheaper than, say, the store inside the courthouse but it's not really enough to keep me from driving the little extra distance to the Publix at Twickenham Square.
The cozy atmosphere and neat meeting space upstairs, though, may be enough to counter-balance the slightly higher prices and not-so-awesome coffee--and a warm Spring day sat outside with a cold cup of iced tea and a fresh-made sandwich can't quite be beat.
So all-in-all, if you don't mind spending a bit more and not getting Starbucks-quality coffee, you will get a cozy, unique atmosphere great for a refreshing time on your own or with friends.

name: Super Frivolous
text:
Was soooo good.  Had a rough Friday and came in and asked for a Chocopresso, one shot expresso, one shot chocolate wine, topped with whipped cream and chocolate sauce. Took the edge right off and had served by the sweetest batista.

text: Very disappointed in this store. Went in with my husband today to look around. Was trying to just find some cute jewelry. Unfortunately, we were subjected to a soap opera from the "manager" behind the counter and her friend in the store. We got to hear all about how the gentleman in her life was still talking to his ex and she would beat his a**. This is not professional for a work environment. The conversation was loud enough to be heard across the entire store. We left without purchasing anything due to the atmosphere there. I'll be highly surprised if I visit again.

resp.text:
Hi Marissa,

My name is Connie - I am the owner and manager of Fanci Free. Thank you for taking time to leave a review and bringing this incident to my attention.  I was not in the store on the day of your visit, but as soon as I heard what happened I made several unsuccessful attempts to contact you. I discovered this written review about your experience only last week.

I wish to extend my sincere apologies to you and your husband. I want you to know I have personally addressed the situation.

At Fanci Free, we value each and every one of our customers. We have a long-standing reputation of making our boutique and café a place where everyone feels happy and leaves happy. I am so glad that you enjoyed the quality and appeal of Fanci Free (as reflected in your ratings) - but on the day of your visit, we fell short of our overall mission.

As a token of our appreciation for your patronage, and to make amends, I invite you to return and enjoy a free meal with us. Then I will be happy to help you find that cute jewelry you were looking for - we have plenty to choose from!

Please call and ask for me (Connie Dismukes).

I look forward to meeting you and your husband. Thank you again for your comments and helping us to continue providing the best service and customer experience in the downtown Prattville area.

Connie Dismukes, Owner & Manager - Fanci Free Café & Boutique

text: This has to be the worst experience for any subway I've been in! We had been on the road for a couple of hours, kids hungry. Decided to stop at this subway, HUGH mistake and a waste of time! Came in, both girls did not want to be there. 1st order, meatball sub. Answer, we don't have meatballs! WHAT? Out of meatballs. Ok I'll ask kids to pick something else. 2nd order, spicy Italian. Answer, we are out of pepperoni and...... I never let her finish. Walked out! How can you own a sandwich shop and be out of meats to make sandwiches? Why open for the day? What a joke! STAY AWAY from this subway, unless you want to buy bread!

name: M A Bumgar
text:
I have never been treated so rudely.  After multiple incidents, I finally walked away without my order.  She had one person's order she was making when we arrived.  She asked us what we wanted and I told her we wanted 4 sandwiches so we'd wait for her to finish and check out the woman already there.  She complained that she was all alone and she didn't want to avoid taking off her gloves to save time.  So then when we tried to tell her our order, she kept asking what we wanted, and I kept repeating it every time she kept saying it wrong.   Then after several go arounds she said she'd fix the sandwiches but we needed to tell her what we want. I said I had and asked if she could hear me, and she said she couldn't because there was too much noise.  That was about the time another customer came in.  So I spoke louder and began repeating the order once again, and she interrupted me and told me to hold that thought.  And then proceeded to finish and wrap the sandwiches for the woman ahead of us very very very slowly.  At around this point in time, I looked and it was 4:06 pm.  We had pulled into the parking lot at about 3:51, and upon entering the store I briefly looked at produce then went into the restaurant.   She made several remarks through the course of this time she had started with our order at  about 416. She said she had problems just like me and that the customer wasnt always right and that she wasnt disrespecting me.  Yeah right.  I was in an amigo so these things she bent down and said then through the glass. Then asked me if I understood her.  I told her I didn't.   I heard her but I had no understanding of what she was trying to communicate.  Her response to that was "see, now you know what I mean". The woman behind me told the little girl with her not to say a word to this employee because she was frustrated because she was working alone.

She mixed up the sandwiches, and instead of 2 BMTs, there was 1 and 2 hams instead 1.  This is when I realized she had put pickles and mayo on the wrong sub.  My husband said he didnt want it with the mayo on it.  So i tried to tell her he wasnt going to pay for it and she told me she would  throw them out and had another customer, so I needed to decide what I wanted.

I have never been treated so rudely and it wasn't just what she said , it was how she said it.  It was 4:23 when I finally gave up.  I walked over to a Walmart customer service person to see if I could talk to the subway manager but she and 2 others didnt seem to know anything about it.

So... at 4:26, we exited the store, and drove a few miles away to the Subway in town across from Dollar General.   There were 3 employees there, all of whom were very pleasant and the subs were bagged before I paid for them.  The time on the receipt was 4:45. This is the sub shop to do business with.

So if you want good and prompt service stay away from the Walmart Subway.   The employee who was rude had a name tag on.  I would never post it, but I
Will check before I ever order there again to make sure I never have to deal with her foul personality again.

name: Barbara Prewett
text: Depends on which one you go to... Some locations are great

name: Brianna Melvin
text: I have never met a store, or worked in one for that matter, that didn't try to upsell. I am a manager at a pizza hut now and that's the point. To give customers the best bang for their buck. I sent my stepdad to subway for sandwiches for my husband and I. I knew the sub i wanted was a $5 sub and my husband's would cost a little more. I gave him the money I had and told him to get us foot long sandwiches. He says the lady didnt specify, which i understand, but i paid $4  for a 6" sub when the woman could have informed him for $1 MORE HE COULD HAVE GOTTEN A FOOTLONG! needless to say, i ate my sub and my husband ate his. Plus the food my mother and stepfather got tasted bad and he wanted to bring it back. My point, you should at least INFORM YOUR CUSTOMERS SO THEY CAN MAKE THE BEST DECISION BASED ON THEIR MONEY. For 1 dollar more I could have had twice the sandwich. If i could give 0 stars i would. This is my first review on this subway and i never try to give bad reviews working in the food industry myself. But i will not EVER use this subway again. I will go out of my way to bypass this one.

name: jon shook
text: Always a good choice when eating never had a bad meal or experience

name: Kaylan Hand
text: HORRIBLE. I went at 9 AM this morning to get a sandwich on white bread. They open at 7 AM. The lady whose name I do not recall, told me the bread would not be ready for another 30 minutes. They have been open for two hours. Yes, I could understand being open for 30 minutes and not having the bread done, but two hours is absolutely ridiculous. So, I travelled to another subway up the road to see if the situation was the same. The man in this store was very friendly as he already had his bread done. I called the manager of this subway of which I experienced the bread not being done and she informed me that it was not a priority nor the first thing they do. If you do not have your bread done by time you open, simply change your hours. It is SO RUDE for customers to be under the impression that they can "eat fresh" when they can't even eat at all. While on the phone with this manager, I asked if all the subways did this. She replied with "no.. wait I mean yes." I explained to her I went to another subway directly 10 minutes after I was told there was no white bread done but he seemed to have all of his stuff together. She informed me that it could have been left over bread from yesterday, but it was not. Guess he is just more concerned with keeping his job and keeping the customers happy than having them complain about stupid bread situations. This subway does not even deserve one star.

I’ve never had an issue with the RCC store, I guess I’ll just go there from now on.

Just stopped on our trip back home from the beach when I checked the bag it was missing 1 of 3 croissants ordered. I called and the male employee actually argued with me and said he personally made them. You may have made them but you didn’t deliver them. He hung up on me. Of course it’s rated 2.7 stars.

name: cottonwood rescue
text:
Dunkin' let me tell y’all about the team at 1865 E. Main St. Dothan😍 This team is always the most friendly and helpful I have ever experienced at Dunkin’💯 & I have visited them from Panama City Beach to Tallahassee, to Birmingham to Gainesville & no other compares to my home store!🤞🏼As an Emt I’m on the go with 911 ALL day & believe me we are blazing the roads all day to and from the hospital. & I know if I need a pick me up I will only stop at this location. They know how to get my coffee fix prompt and exactly how I like it. 90% of the time they see me pull up on the ambulance and they already have my order going before I make it in the store! I know they have to be tired of seeing me but they always greet me with a smile on their faces! I couldn’t ask for better service and great personalities!  It’s the “Be safe out there today.” For me! 🥲 Y’all are just as essential as I am and I thank y’all for your service!  & keep being great!☺️

With much love always!💕☕️

- a very great full EMT🚑💙

name: Harley Wambles
text: Got there when they were supposed to be open this morning at 5, waited 10 minutes in the drive thru before checking the front of the store and seeing that no one was even there.

name: Molly Cox
text: DO NOT get the peppermint mocha here. I ordered it cold, it came out hot. They said I ordered a hot drink but I have NEVER in my life ordered a hot drink, I only drink cold so that was wrong on their part. My coffee didn't have the shot of espresso I paid for and the drink made me sick for 5 hours after drinking it. Idk if they tried to poison me or what out of retaliation of having to make another drink. :( I work right across the street so I was so excited but now I'm incredibly sad and disappointed.

name: Little Micchelle
text: When this Dunkin first opened I was extremely excited. Its right across from my job and it was a welcome addition to the area. But in the 3 times i've ordered from there every time it has been a struggle to get a simple powdered donut. I have eaten at Dunkins in many states. My family and I have driven 60 miles to get a dozen donuts from a Dunkin we know to be a good one. Today the lady at the window said I couldn't get a powdered donut because they are seasonal! What season is a powdered donut for? I was planning on frequenting this establishment but if i'm going to be outright lied to and denied items I know should be available I would rather drive across town to the krispy kreme.

name: Lil Yung Powerful
text: The employees have an attitude and the girl who started working in the beginning with the tattoos that has the morning shift is really slow...I was excited when they first open but oh boy was I wrong...Also it seems like they didn’t get no training.

text: Awful order never right and then they argue that it is

name: Julie Overton
text: I made a large order and expected better food. One pizza was so dry it tasted like stale crackers. Two of my pizzas barely had sauce on them, and one pizza had NONE! The garlic parmesan wings were fine as plain wings because sauce was just barely drizzled on them. When I tried to speak to the shift manager about the issue, she was rude and treated me as though I was making it all up to receive free food. I did not ask for a refund. I just asked that it be made right. I drove 20 miles to order and pick up food from this location and I will not be going back. This is the worst experience I've ever had with a Domino's.

name: Rebeckah Faye
text: So last night we ordered, and things got a little mixed up and our order was a late. They were super busy, it was a Friday night,  phone steady ringing. Well the manager on duty ((i didn't catch his name)) lovely gentleman, went above and beyond to fix the mistake that was made. I was so mad when I went in and bless his heart he caught an earful, but when I say he handled it with ease and grace. Baby he did WONDERFUL. Kudos to you sir. I know this store has much growing to do but they are lucky to have a boss man like you!!

name: Brad Seal
text: The food is awesome!  Pizza is good but the wings are great, even better!  They're a real life save because it's literally the only place in town that delivers and like many others I'm working from home and can't find time to get much shopping done.  Thanks to Dominoes for coming and saving our town :D

text: I would give them zero stars if possible. 1st I tried placing an order that should have been $18.99 + tax. It came to $24.50 + tax. Finally got that corrected and when it said my order was ready they told me 5 more mins. Then after that I was told a delivery driver took my pizza. After agreeing to make another one I get a phone call stating that I have to take the one that the driver took. Nope!!

text: Love this place!!! As a food industry worker myself, I commend these folks on doing such a great job. Theyve blessed us at huddle house with free food. Anyone who does that is a winner in my eyes 😍

So keep up the good work guys, and don't let these other reviews get to you.

text: I was placing my order over the phone, as the girl goes to repeat my order back to me and tells me my total, she giggled. I got very frustrated because of the situation. I asked was something wrong and she said no im trying to find you a coupon so you don’t have to pay 50 dollars. This made me laugh after my long day of work, the little things people do or say make a difference, and most workers do not realize that. thanks kyla. i did not really catch the name so i tried my best. amazing food, my lava cakes were the best. i definitely plan on being back!

name: Jamie Chambers
text: Waited 1.5 hours with no update on the tracking. Other experiences were fine during the day

resp.text: Jamie, we take pride in getting our customer orders within the hour and our order tracking ability for our customers. That said, we could not find your account on our system and we are trying to make things right for you.  Please email us at FetcherOps@fetchmedelivery.com so we can research and make things right for you.

name: ken evola
text: Favorite delivery service in Auburn!

name: Dominic Binkley
text: I ordered carryout from a local Italian restaurant through FetchMe and was told to pick up my meal at 4:15 p.m. But when I showed up, the restaurant told me they don’t open until 5:00, so I had to wait for them to make my food - totally defeating the point of ordering online. I would not recommend ordering through FetchMe.

resp.text:
Hey Dominic, we apologize for the inconvenience due to this. After looking into this matter further it appears that our restaurant partner had altered their ordering hours and did not make us aware. We have since fixed their changed hours so this should not happen in the future. As a locally owned business we value your feedback. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to see you ordering again from us.

Regards,

Harrison
Owner
FetchMe

name: Jonathan Williams
text: Great to have some local delivery guys in Auburn. My food was delivered quickly and safely. Couldn't recommend these guys enough!

resp.text: We live to serve our customers! Thanks you for the wonderful comments.

name: Kellyanne Brown
text: Came to visit Auburn and was told to try this App. Not only did they mess up several of my orders from some of the restaurants in the area (Burgerfi, five guys, and a few other places I had never tried before), I was also accused by their customer service of lying about my food not showing up! How about you take some responsibility? HOOORRRRIBLE business who doesn't care about their customers, I bet all of these positive reviews on here are from friends and not actual satisfied customers. Do not waste your time using this app, unless you are fine with your money disappearing and being accused of stealing.

resp.text: Hi Kellyanne, we looked at our customer files and we looked at our customer ratings and feedback.  We can not find the information on the above.  Please send us an email at support@fetchmedelivery.com with your information so we look at your orders and make it right.

name: Tori Brown
text: Cheaper and quicker than any other food delivery service in the area. Excellent customer service!!

name: Patti S.
text: FetchMe really helped in a pinch and we will always use FetchMe, from now on. Great quick, friendly and most importantly ... professional.

resp.text:
Thanks so much Patti! We love hearing such positive feedback. Yall are the reason we do the things we do. Please see us again soon!

-Harrison from FetchMe

name: Autumn Garrett
text: Do not work here

text: Best delivery service in all of Auburn/Opelika. They are up to date with their COVID-19 practices, and I will be continuing to order from them from here on out.

name: FetcherOps HQ
text: FetchMe Delivery is a great LOCAL company that keeps their customers wants and desires at the heart! They always call to confirm if something happens at the restaurant and even provide me with extra things that I didn't even know I needed (sauces, wet wipes for my wings, etc) Truly a great company and should be the only delivery company you order from!!!  P.S. They also delivery groceries and can complete on-demand orders.

name: A Foster

resp.text:
Thanks A for the feedback. Glad you enjoyed using us. Please see us again soon!

-Harrison

name: Megan Huff
text:
FetchMe Delivery....delivers ;).
I love this service and I can't express how simple it is AND how wide their territory is!! I live pretty far away from everything and I see FetchMe Delivery drivers all the time in my area, it's nice knowing that if I don't want to cook FetchMe Delivery has it covered!!

resp.text:
Thanks for your support Megan! We love reading reviews like this, you made our day! Let us know if you need anything.

Regards,

Harrison and the FetchMe Team

name: Nick Patrizio
text: I've been using food service delivery apps for awhile now (i.e. Uber eats, Grubhub) and then I visited Auburn U and came upon FetchME. I dont understand how this small time delivery business provided me much quicker and more enjoyable service than the larger players back home but it made my first experience at Auburn much more enjoyable. Quick, easy service. The next time I visit for a tailgate, I know who I'm reaching out to. And you probably should too.

name: Lacey Harbula
text: Food was excellent.  The service was wonderful. Server was chipper and very polite even though she'd been there all day. Definitely would like to go back.

resp.text: Thanks Lacey! We are a locally owned and operated company.   We love it when we make our customers day.

name: Patrick Kennedy
text: FetchMe Delivery is the go to delivery service when you want to get it done right.  I use them every time I am in town.   Thanks for the great service.

resp.text: Thank you Patrick--We love serving you and appreciate your feedback!

name: Matthew McMullen
text: Couldn't ask for a better delivery service to work with or for! Both as a patron and an employee, FetchMe has been nothing but top notch. Fast deliveries and a great side gig!

resp.text: Thanks Matt! We love that you are part of the team that strives to have excellent customer support by going above and beyond that was expected and by ensuring customers issue are quickly resolved.

name: Alice Evola
text: Used this service several times while in town. They were on time, meal was fresh, and the driver was courteous!

name: Alex Harris
text: Honestly what's not to love about FetchMe? Super fast delivery times, super great employees, my only regret is having to leave such a wonderful service behind when I moved out of Auburn. They truly make you feel like it's FetchME, not FetchEVERYBODYELSE.

resp.text: Thanks Alex!  FetchMe is striving to be the best online retailer that you have ever dealt. Our goal is to quickly follow up on your purchase and ensure you satisfied with your experience!

name: Jamila Mills
text: Great service, friendly delivery, but the charging process is a bit wonky. Accidentally tipped twice and felt bad correcting the tip. The final bill is usually different than what you think you spend upfront. So if they fix that, 5 stars.

resp.text: We appreciate the review, Jamila, hope you are doing well!

name: Patrick Lovell
text: FetchMe rocks! Quick delivery, very friendly drivers and staff, and they’re always helpful and easy to work with if there any any issues. Not to mention the wide range of food and grocery options they provide.

resp.text: Thanks Patrick. We strive to ensure everything is outstanding, from the website selection to the fetchers to the delivery experience.

name: Valerie Hawkins
text: They are quick and have reasonable delivery charges.

resp.text:
Thanks so much valerie, we love the feedback and are glad to hear we were able to take care of you! If you need anything please let us know!

-Harrison

Would recommend for anybody in the auburn area to use.

text: Over charged my card

resp.text: Hi Lakeisha, we were able to find your order and wanted to ensure that you were aware that there was an authorization on your card for an amount greater than the price of the order. This is temporary and a pending transaction in case we have to make a substitution on your order. We are seeing only one charge and if you have any questions please feel free to contact us at 334-209-7730.

Harrison and The FetchMe Team

We have ordered food delivery with FetchMeDelivery multiple times and they all went extremely well with each arriving earlier than expected.  We even asked them to make a delivery with a restaurant that was not set up in their system and they did it without a hitch.  Great service!

resp.text: Thank you Scott! We are working hard at delivering an AUsome experience for the community.   Appreciate your feedback!

name: harry harp
text: This service is terrible use tiger town to go they’re much less likely to completely butcher your order which they’ve messed up slightly or entirely every time I’ve ordered from them. Also when I called to tell them they butchered my order to the point I didn’t want to eat and they said they’d refund which they did but they refunded $8 for a $12 meal not including the $7 delivery charge and tax and the tip I gave the terrible delivery driver. Either go get your food yourself or order from any other delivery service because this is not worth it.

resp.text: Good morning Harry! Thank you very much for bringing this to our attention.  We acknowledge that sometimes mistakes do happen and am sorry you did not have a great experience.  Your experience is the most important thing to every employee at FetchMe.  We reached out to the restaurant who controls the food quality and have addressed quality control challenges with them given they prepare your food.  We have also reached out to you in order to ensure things have been made right with you.  Please engage our delivery center so we can resolve this to your satisfaction.

text: The three ladies who were working today 9/13/2020 at approximately 2pm were not wearing masks while make sandwiches. When we asked about why they weren't wearing masks the lady who was coughing became belligerent and said they had been "slammed all day". My husband reminded her that this is all the more reason to wear the mask as she had served a large number of people without a mask. We were then told that we dont have to eat there and we could leave. So we left and went to Burger King where everyone was wearing masks and gloves and they were friendly. I hope the coughing employee isnt infected w covid but I will report this to the Alabama Health Department and Subway corporate offices just in case there is an outbreak in the area.

Service is poor and they usually get my order wrong that's why I've stopped eating at this location. They really need a better manager. And an employee also drop a customers sauces while delivering curbside and didn't pick them up. Just very unprofessional location and very lazy.

name: Michael Rizzuto
text: Got a phone call minutes after placing my order to inform me that their hours had changed and they no longer delivered to the address for the hotel I was staying at. They need to updated their website to reflect this. I understand they are low staffed but she said until the end of summer the hours had changed. Need to fix that so other travelers aren’t wasting their time.

name: Drew Hill
text: Overall good. I would suggest sticking with the hand tossed pizzas. Tried the pan and got the extravaganza, basically the supreme with everything and it turned out really doughy like it needed a few more minutes in the oven. This is typical when there's that many toppings, but was still a bit disappointed. Ended up finishing it myself in the oven at home.

name: cowanization
text: Quick, hot, and fresh!! Thank you for delivering to a trucker 😎🚛

name: Brandon Holt
text: The pizza is good but it's a little pricey when you can go get it somewhere else cheaper but a if you want better Pizza you pay the money

name: GERALD PLOTT
text: Phone rang for over 10 minutes, got there and they said they dont answer the phone. Papa Johns's had no problem taking my order. They should just close it down.

name: Chris Ferguson
text: Placed order and they took my money. Then tell me we can’t put in ur order and it’ll be 3 to 5 days before u get ur money back.  Bs I bet I want use them again!!!

name: Triniti Evans
text: I did not get garlic butter on my bread knots!

name: Jessica Driggers
text:
First off, the female who answered the phone hung up on me when i asked her to hold on.  I understand not being able to hold,  but all she had to do was say that and not hang up on me.....because when i called back she then had me hold.

Then when i got to the store they couldn't break a $100 bill...when my bill was $40, so they claimed they didn't have $60 worth if change in the drawer..... frightfully inconvenient....and the female at the counter told me to 'just go to the gas station and get change'.....so much for customer service....

We WILL NOT be going back to this location.... there are much nicer, friendlier, more customer-centric locations with the same area.

AND, don't order cheese bread and expect any sauce, THE MANAGER said that 'every franchise does it differently'....I guess I misunderstood the concept of a franchise.

name: Johnathan Wealth
text: Ordered at 8:30pm still haven’t gotten my order and it’s 10:27pm now called 5 times no answer

name: Ellie Miller
text: the last four times i’ve called i was on hold for ever and when they finally picked up the phone they hung up on me immediately.

name: Kimberly Patrick
text: Order online. Order was cancelled because no driver and they said they called 3x but I only go 1 call...and couldn’t confirm refund...bad service

name: Judy King
text: I asked what they had for special i was told larg specialty for 14.99 told the guy that i wanted that then said i wanted a med pepperoni. When it was delivered i got hust the med pepperoni. When i called back the guy who i placed my order with when i told him that i was to have 2 pizzas one was a larg specialty an med pepperoni he said i didnt specify what specialty i wanted i thought a specialty was with everthing one it futher more he didnt even bother to even ask me what specialty i wanted. I guess nectime inorder i guess ill go to all the way to auburn to pizza hut cause when you ask for specialty they give you all the way on it unless younask for meat lovers or a supreme pizza. I guess thats what i get for not realy asking down to the details what their specialty means. Your people who answers phone needs to learn how to place an ask your guest what they want on pizzas cause they just cost you money. Cause i dont like to go all the way to auburn to get pizza when i can have it delivered but not any more for a person who dont like the auburn trafic guess i will have to fight it next time for a pizza. Thank you for your hospitality an for not trying to make things right with you customer.

text: I'm a Delivery Expert here, fast, friendly an great customer service.

text: Please an order before closing my order was canceled because they didn’t feel like fixing/delivering the order called next day manager was very rude stated he wasn’t there add they had there reasons I thought that was so unprofessional

text: I have had them deliver to my house for the last 9 years and all of a sudden they don't deliver out here . You will not get any of my business anymore .

text: My daughter came and picked up a pepperoni pizza and cinnionmon twist.. I am very displeased with both.. They were burnt and very tough to eat.. I don't think I will be coming back...

name: Jessie Hodges
text: My daughter came and picked up a pepperoni pizza and cinnionmon twist.. I am very displeased with both.. They were burnt and very tough to eat.. I don't think I will be coming back...

name: Kristina Wilkes
text: If I could give zero stars I would. This place is run poorly. They are always understaffed. I placed an order for delivery and they called me 15 minutes later (when the delivery quote was 22 minutes) to inform me that they could not deliver my pizza but I could come pick it up for the SAME PRICE even though the delivery fee is 3.99 and I tipped the driver 20%. The manager was useless. I don’t even blame the staff there, seems like it stems from corporate. Absolutely awful.

text: My pizza was burnt and it was a hot mess. I wont never spend a dime with them

name: Muffinman Wolfe
text: Dude, this dominos was operating with one manager and one delivery guy on a Thursday night! Constant phone calls, rushing back and forth, the delivery guy helping make pizzas and taking four to five deliveries out while we were there, I mean these two guy were killing it! Absolute badasses and deserve some praise!

name: Tammy Stafford-Bellflower
text: Ordered, through the app, a large Brooklyn MeatZZa pizza a few minutes past 5: pm, and the alert came up a few minutes later saying it was ready. I live 40 minutes away, and I get home, open up the box, and no meat; just plain cheese pizza. I called and was told they would do another one...and plus one, for free, and that it would be ready by the time I arrive. I go in to pick up and both orders are wrong, again. I had to wait 15 minutes for them to redo the orders. It ended up being 2 1/2 hours before me and my family finally got to eat.

name: Kesia Drake
text: Been on hold for a hour every time I call😡😡😡

name: Shelia Hoyett
text: I ordered my items online... I did not get them until way too late..it was not hot. They knew the service was terrible because they immediately gave me a 20% coupon off of my next order.( I didn’t even speak to anyone about my order nor did I leave a review).. so they knew it was terrible service...so fast forward to today I ordered my items online and when I got them they were not hot... I was trying to track my order.. and couldn’t so I called the store and was told the GPS system was down. I don’t know what is going on but being that I live only 2 minutes away I would think my food would be much better than I have been getting considering I include a “suggested”  tip every time .. my first order was under $20 but the next day my order was over $50 and it still was the same thing... Luke warm pizza and desserts!!!!! Very disappointed!!!!

name: Kristine Rogers
text: They made our pizzas exactly the way we asked them to.

name: duke likins
text: employees are awesome

name: Savannah Ellsworth
text:
UPDATE: I changed my review because after getting in touch with HQ the manager called to formally apologize and take care of it, which I really appreciated. Hoping for better experiences from here on.
I never order from Domino's and always get papa johns. I decided I wanted a drink and they have sprite so I ordered from there today. The driver brought the wrong drink and was gone before I notice so I called the store. Whoever answered the phone said do you want us to have the driver bring you another one. I said yes because that's what I ordered and she said I don't even know how long it'll be and then hung up without even asking where I live or anything. Took a chance and will not be ordering here again. Talk to the staff about some manners. I work in the food service too. (Still waiting on soda to be here. Who know if it'll come)

text: So why don't you deliver to the Golden Cherry hotel? They waited till after my pizza out of oven before calling me. I don't have a car so I can't pick it up. Seriously?!

name: zjp1995
text: I normally never have issues with this particular location but I placed an order online. I got to the place checked my pizza out and it was burnt around the crust and it also had very little cheese on it with bubbles. I asked the young lady that rung me up to remake the pizza and she was very nice about it and was about to remake the pizza with no problem! Although then the manager came around the corner and was making smart remarks. He said and I quote "order your pizza right the first time online". Now mind you I ordered the pizza correctly it was made poorly. He was very unprofessional and rude. Kuddos to the young lady though, she should take his position because he clearly doesn't know customer service. 3 stars  because management needs work.

name: Jennifer Clark
text:
The pizza was hot and ready when I arrived. However, it wasn't up to the quality I have come to expect from Domino's. The toppings became sparse before ending at the signature garlic crust edge. Our pizza was full of bubbles and actually had burnt portions. Our cutter may have been new because it was highly inconsistent. We had slices equal to 1 1/2-2 slices then baby slivers.

I was just passing through so I can't speak on if this was the typical quality or if we caught them on a bad night. My typical experience at other locations 500 miles from here are much better so hopefully this location was just training a newbie.

name: Justin Edwards
text: They never have enough drivers the food is always cold I wouldn’t recommend anybody to them 5 thumbs down

name: D Brown
text: I don't like to do negative reviews, but 2.00 frozen pizzas would have been better than what we paid over 30.00 for tonight!  it took an hour just to get the food out the door!!!  Apparently this store is poorly managed.  Worst pizzas I've ever had... one pizza had burnt bacon, very thin crust, overcooked, stale, and was very drrrrryyyy.  The other one was very dry, stale tasting, and the inside of the pizza was undercooked.  We ended up giving nearly all of it to the dog but she didnt even eat much of it, and she usually eats anything until she over stuffs herself and throws up and eats that too. She also enjoys trashcan food and cat poo.  She walked away from the pizza.  Only 8 minutes away, and it took almost an hour and a half to get 2 pizzas and 1 cheese bread.  And as if this wasn't  enough, we ordered marinara sauce, which was non existent with our meal.  The delivery person was very professional, kind, and punctual with the order.

name: Jennifer Washington
text: Pizza was great.

name: Mon Petit Chou
text: We had been very happy with their product for the most part. However, between our last pizza being burnt black and just receiving a phone call to inform us that our order would not be delivered for 2.5-3 hours(!), they have lost customers. We are not happy.

text: The driver was on time. Very nice. And constantly kept a smile on her face. And very respectful. And the food is very good. My first time eating from this dominos pizza since I moved here and I'm very impressed. Thank you. You have my business.

My order with one other was all that was in process. Had to use debit card because they did not have $22 for change. Good pizza awful service.

(Supposed to be hand tossed)  and mass majority of the pizzas were black on the bottom.  Typically pizza is GREAT.. it's been a bit but Domino's fell short last night.  Cinnamon twist and customer service was just fine.  Was in and out no wait.

name: Tanya Singh
text:
I know it's not that to give it just two stars since for the kind of quality food that they  provide and of course who doesn't love their pizzas. But one of my very first delivery experiences that I just had today.
It's not about the 50 cents or so that I paid for that Marinara Sauce but all that matters a lot is when you have it on waiting and no wonder they forget it. If I forgot to ask for it when getting my breadsticks and the pizza delivered, I think it's still majorly on their part wrong for not to provide it.
Sometimes even the slightest of the wrongs piss a lot. I tried to call them right back immediately and was told that they going up sending it right back but none showed up.
Must be wondering who comes back for just this much, right? I knew it too somewhere in my mind but didn't really know that they be lacking behind this low on customer satisfaction. I, myself deliver stuff at my other side job to my  Customers and I make sure everything is so pitch-perfect knowing that eeling of the customer excitedly waiting and having all their eyes on the person delivering it, because, "FOOD is love, FOOD is Happiness".

It was cold, and half of the crust was burned so that we couldn't eat it, and the other half was almost burned.  What a huge disappointment for $24.00!  We switched from Papa John's to Domino's months ago, but we never experienced this disaster!

text: After waiting an hour and a half for my pizza to be delivered I decided to call the store just to make sure the order actually got placed. The manager told me they only had one driver on that i would get mine soon (I got it about 30 minutes after this call). I understand the lack of staff BUT CALL ME AND LET ME KNOW WHATS GONIG ON. Also DON'T DELIVER MY PIZZA LUKE WARM AND DRIED UP FROM WAITING TO BE DELIVERED!!! Honestly even a apology from the manager or driver would have been nice.

Waited another 20 minutes on the re-bake only to be given the bread twist that were cold after sitting for 25 minutes.  I asked them why they didn't re-bake the twist as well only to receive bad attitude from the manager.  I will not order again from this store.

Have used this location consistently (weekly/biweekly) for last few months - food nearly always hot, orders have all been accurate so far.

Only complaint is drivers are hit and miss. Sometimes they get here quickly, sometimes has taken them 35 mins for a 10 minute drive.

Out of all the chain pizza places in the area, this Dominos is easily the best and most consistent.

I know of places that would deliver 30 minutes away. Step up your game Opelika Domino's.

text: I was very happy with the Dominos in Opelika because they made me feel important when the Dominos in Auburn made me feel very unimportant. Oh the place I used to go by Kroger doesn't deliver here but atleast  they wont make me feel like the customer no one wants.

name: Gullatte Acres
text: They forgot my garlic butter. Excellent pizza.

name: CHRIS Teague
text: Hands down the best Dominos in the world and I have used a lot of Dominos locations all across the map. Service is outstanding, never have had my order made incorrectly or lost or whatever. Most of the people that work there know my name, say most because this is a college town so there's always new faces when I go there. Order is almost always ready when I get there or just coming out of the oven, almost never have to wait around long which makes it super convent. Food is always hot when I pick up my order, unless I am late so can't fault them for that lol. If your going to get Dominos in Auburn/Opelika go to this store you won't be sorry even if your south or west of campus the extra drive is worth it. Also if you use a smartphone use there app or go online makes ordering a breeze but you can call in too they handle that easily as well (just try to know what you want, they will thank you for that and people in the store will thank you for that. Having to recite the entire menu isn't fun when you can get the info online). Hats off to my favorite Dominos crew, thank you for the great food and great service!

name: Dana Williamson
text:
Placed an online order 10/17/18 a little after 5 pm. My husband picked it up and brought it home. The super supreme I ordered was made wrong so we called to have it replaced. My husband went to pick it up and was given yet another pizza that was made incorrectly. When he called back up there the assistant manager Renee on duty argued with my husband telling him that there were not very many olives on the pizza because we had ordered extra toppings and if they put to much they get into trouble. The pizza had no olives at all on it. I called her back and informed her that I did not order extra toppings, only substituted two of the toppings and that there were no olives on the pizza. She continued to argue with me. Made me so angry that I took the pizza back up there and asked for her to show me just one olive on that pizza. She proceeded to tell me there were olives on it when she made it. I told her this is what my husband brought home. I told her how I was treated was wrong and that I would be contacting her general manager and the corporate office.
Update..... Just bit into the third pizza and it has Italian sausage on it.... Of which spurred the original complaint. So still an incorrect pizza.  Three trips for an incorrect order and not even an apology.

text: The community is lucky to have such a friendly, affordable place to get quality pizza and desserts.  Sign in online to order and start receiving points toward earning free food!  A couple weeks ago, I picked up a pizza and cinnamon knots and they forgot to give me the glaze.  I spoke to Patricia the manager and she treated me so kindly!  Came back the following week and she had made a comment on my account to provide me a replacement dessert for the missing glaze. Devan added an extra glaze which I put in the fridge as a back up!  Excellent staff that always provide a smile!  Dominos purchased the old Burger King and remodeled it.  They have a indoor seating area, which I hope will be open for guests to eat inside someday.  I could see many wonderful birthday parties and celebrations there!

text: Excellent service and quality pizza is hard to find at chains, sometimes, but this store has both. This local Domino's is new and delivering pizza quickly is what they do. Great carryout service as well, a large dine-in area and a free-to-use (by reservation) Community Room makes this a great spot for groups as well as celebrations. The drive thru pickup window is just a bonus, especially if you're in need of pizza and cheesy bread and the lobby is closed. Definitely worth trying.

text: There's not much you probably don't already know about a sub sandwich shop, but this Lenny's location certainly has a great staff and great food.  I've always loved the clean taste of their Italian and Classic subs.  This location also does a great job of keeping the place clean.

name: connie garcia
text: This Lenny's is ALWAYS dirty! My husband goes but I will not eat there. The tables are dirty, the floors, and the machine they use to slice the meat with is dirty. Compared to other Lenny's this one is not up to standard. The employees are standing around or on their phone. One person doing the work while others do nothing.  I hope the owner or manage changes this because I love Lenny's subs but I don't want to get sick eating in a dirty restaurant.

name: Wes McKay
text: Just well-made, tasty, flavorful sandwiches.  I love the pepper relish on top of a sandwich made Lenny's way.  The rewards program is another major plus.

name: Heather Hill
text: I hate to say this because I believe in having a light hearted atmosphere in your work environment but they do it a little too much where they screw up orders. The first time I was there I had order for take out and they were busy and 5 people before me ended up getting the order wrong they even got one table's order wrong twice. Then I get my order and I checked it just to make sure and sure enough they had gotten my order wrong and it's because the whole time the workers are constantly joking around with each other that they aren't paying attention to what they are doing. Then the second time I order a sandwhich and salad and I was an idiot not to check my bag because they didn't even put it in the bag and it was the main thing I wanted out of the whole order because it was for my paralyzed grandfather who I take care of full time. I get him Lenny's as a treat and don't get much time to get away from the house for this and the manager really didn't act like it was a big deal. We pay good money for your sandwhiches I shouldn't have to waste gas to correct your screw ups just because you think it's better to not be focused on job. I will never return to them. I have even had other people tell me they stopped going to Lenny's because they always screw up their order because of the joking around. Get it together.

name: connie waddell
text: Great we haven't eat there is a while we ate there today it was great. The bread is far better then any other sub shop.

name: Terri
text:
It was great when it first opened ... in fact my family loved the quality of the pizza and freshness of the ingredients! However, slowly the quality has declined. We order from there a lot and usually go pick up our order. They leave out sauces or extras that you order a lot. This really isn't much of an issue because I just ask them when I get there.

However, the consistency of quality of the food hasn't been good since around June. We order bread bites a lot from there and sometimes they are drenched in oil to the point that they ooze out a lot with every bite (not good) and others it is bone dry with not even sauce to dip them in (also not good). Sometimes the bites are REALLY undercooked and sometimes they are just right. I understand it is different employees making the pizza, but sometimes the stuff is good and other times I don't even eat it because it is inedible. Ordering now is a 50/50 gamble on whether I will actually be eating what they give me. The pizza is often the same (undercooked or just right).

Also one time they gave us a cheesy bread instead of bread bites and then when we called about it they basically called us liars. We just wanted what we ordered and we order from there A LOT.

Recently we have cut back on ordering from there because of the consistency issues. We used to order at least twice a week and now it is about once a month.

The manager also told me that 11:30pm is the last time you can place on line orders but the website say 12pm he's losing money for his store and for Dominos.

name: Jerry Dean
text: I have had great service from this location in the past until recently. I ordered a pizza and received the wrong one. It wasn’t a super big deal but I was given a free pizza for the future. Well tonight I ordered that pizza and I was told it was going to take between 35-45 mins to get it. I understand there are some nights that you are busy or down a driver but in the mean time watching the tracker the pizza had to go back in the oven because it had been sitting on the self for more than 30 mins. Finally, after waiting an hour I called in am was told it would be out soon. The gentleman was very polite and apologized for the inconvenience but I did end up canceling the order just because it was already so late and I was hungry. So it may be sometime before I order from this location again.

name: Melissa Marsh
text:
Online ordering was down so I stopped in to order and had to wait about 10 minutes for them to make the pizza and I was SO impressed by the comraderie between the employees there. Almost every employee made an effort to speak to me, they were cutting up with each other, helping each other, and simply enjoying their job. What a pleasant and professional group of people. I may wait on pizza again there.
Also, they do have seeing if you want to eat there and a special step for little ones to stand on and watch them work the dough.

text: If you're depirate or a job don't work here. You're under constant threat of termination, constant accusation and ridicule. The manager and owner harass and bully staff only to pay off customers who are unsatisfied or even robbed by employees, meanwhile  workers in the store can lose their job over giving one too many coupon or giving away sauce. Employees are not allotted breaks or even allowed to eat while on the clock all the while being yelled at and cussed out by customers unhappy with a policy that t cant change or bend out o fear of losing the only thing supporting their families. Workers are expected to close with one driver and one manager(sometimes from 9-close)as well as clean,sanitize,mop, make pizzas,handle money,deal with customers and not cancel any orders AND be out of the store within an hour of closing or run the risk of being accused of stealing time,money,or product. if you value our sanity you wont work here, an i you think you're a decent person try to be understanding because they're always being watched and cant help or comp as much as they'd like.

name: Beth Johnson
text:
Dear Lord. This Domino’s is so, so incredibly awful, words can’t adequately describe it. I’ve had a couple horrendous experiences w/ the McClellan Blvd. Domino’s-the time before last even warranted an apology call from a bigwig regional manager/owner in Birmingham, and he mailed me free large pizza coupon directly to my house...yea-the big guns got pulled, and the red carpet rolled out for me. 🙄
The very next order I placed (Nov. 2017, I believe) after receiving the Domino’s manager apology call-and while using the damn free pizza coupon he had just sent me-I wound up getting completely comped, and I didn’t even have to use the free pizza coupon! The food was THAT late, and prepared incorrectly THAT badly!
Now here I sit, waiting for a pizza delivery.....it’s been over an hour.....the app told me it got pulled out of the oven 45 minutes ago.....the store told me the driver “just left, he had like, 3-4 deliveries BEFORE yours”...and I tell myself, for the last time, I will never order Domino’s again-no matter HOW badly I don’t want to call Papa John’s.....at least Papa John’s does what they say they’ll do, and they actually deliver my order in under 2-3 hours...

I step back outside watch him thru the window look at my order on the napkin. 10 mins after that i saw the worker look for someone(customer) i walked in and he said as to me as he walked by me toward outside i got you man. A second worjer came in and said why we only have to drivers im bouts to walk out on yall. First worker look at the second worker who just walkef in to get my order. text:
GAVE IT A 1 STAR. BECAUSE ZERO STARS WERE NOT AN OPTION. I ORDER FROM THIS PLACE ONCE A WEEK. ALWAYS SPEND $45-65.00. BUT TONIGHT; CHRIS THE ASSISTANT MANAGER, DID NOT THINK MY $65.00 ORDER WAS A BIG ENOUGH CONTRIBUTION TO THEIR PROFIT MARGIN. I ORDER THE SAME ORDER EVERYTIME I ORDER. PAY SAME PRICE EVERYTIME I ORDER; BUT , TONIGHT CHRIS WAS GOING TO MAKE ME PAY MORE. $20.00 MORE. WAS HE NEEDING GAS MONEY. DID HE NEED GROCERY MONEY. WAS HE OUT OF CIGARETTES. I ASKED HIM HOW COME IT WAS HIGHER. HE SAID BECAUSE OF COUPONS. IMAGINARY COUPONS THAT HE IS THE KEEPER OF & GIVES OUT AS HE PLEASES OR DOESN'T PLEASE. HE DECIDED THAT DOMINO'S HE WORKS AT TONIGHT WAS SO FAR IN THE BLACK THAT HE DID NOT NEED MY SMALL CONTRIBUTION TO THEIR PROFIT FUNDS. CHRIS DECIDED TO TO LET HIS BIGGEST COMPETITOR;  PAPA JOHN'S , SHARE IN THEIR PRFIT SHARING. I AM SURE THAT CHRIS THE ASSISTANT MANAGER'S BOSS DOES NOT THINK THEY ARE FAR ENOUGH IN THE BLACK TO GIVE A $65.00 ORDER TO HIS COMPETITOR, PAPA JOHN'S. I BET THE OWNER AND FRANCHISER DOES NOT THINK THEY ARE FAR ENOUGH IN THE BLACK THAT $65.00 WOULD GOTO PAPA JOHN'S. SOUNDS LIKE MANAGEMENT TRAINING AT DOMINO'S IS NOT ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICE. BUT MORE ABOUT CHRIS'S TITLE THAT HE WAS VERY PROUD OF. AND IN TELLING ME THAT THE MANAGER IN THE MORNINGS WOULD TELL ME THE SAME THING. GO TO PAPA JOHN'S THEN. I DONT THINK THAT IS PROPPER MANAGEMENT OF THIS SCENERIO. I COULD BE WRONG; BUT, CHRIS THE ASSISTANT MANAGER , PRETTY MUCH TOLD ME TO GOTO PAPA JOHN'S. WELL THANK YOU CHRIS, THE ASSISTANT MANAGER. I DID ORDER FROM PAPA JOHN'S. AFTER TELLING THEM THE ORDEAL I WENT THROUGH WITH YOU AND YOUR ORGANIZATION. THEY APOLOGIZED FOR YOUR ACTIONS, THANKED ME FOR MY BUSINESS, GAVE ME A DISCOUNT &  TOLD ME TO HAVE A GOOD NIGHT. PAPA JOHN'S EARNED MY BUSINESS TONIGHT. NOT ONLY DID THEY ESRN IT, CHRIS THE ASSISTANT MANAGER GAVE THEM MY BUSINESS.  CONGRATULATIONS ON YOUR PROMOTION CHRIS, THE ASSISTANT MANAGER. AND THANKS AGAIN FOR GIVING MY BUSINESS TO PAPA JOHN'S.
RICKY WHITT

text: I have been to many other subway locations, but this one stands out. The staff here are AMAZING! Great customer service, especially Rebecca and the owner who’s name I have forgotten. Anyways I shall also mention the main thing, great food and very fast!  My mother and I come here very often and encourage anyone looking for good food at a good price to come and try it out!

name: Ronald White
text: Best fresh sandwiches. They have so many choices. The prices are good and it is a good fast food alternative for those who have to eat out alot or just wanting a healthy alternative to the other things. You choose your toppings and they have fresh everyday. The cookies are to die for. This is a great atomsphere and good food. Highly recommend

name: Adam Lee
text: Excellent service

name: Danny Niblett
text: Great food and friendly service

name: jennifer hieftje

name: juan alcocer
text: Good

name: viren patel
text: Enjoyed lot, very clean and fast restaurant...

name: Lashawna Smith
text: We ordered 2 quesadillas tonight and they both looked like this. Where is the chicken and cheese???? Total rip off!

name: Heath Usry
text: Once again I have fallen victim to the drive thru gamble of will it be right or not. The answer.....not. It is my fault for not checking to see if my simple bean burrito without onions or red sauce would be made correctly. Instead I get a bean burrito with some spicy yellow goop on it. Oh well.

name: Tracy Caswell
text: The drive thru is always fast. I recommend it.

name: Clint Austin
text: I can understand if you are understaffed but when your location says open until 1 and it’s 11:30 and someone is waiting at the drive thru how about have some customer service and say I’m sorry we are closed.........  not just look at them and go about your day. Zero stars for plain lazy employees. I’m sure the owner of this location is unaware you are closing 2 hours before you are suppose to. Your google page was just updated with this new time.

name: Kye Parker
text: Got our whole order wrong, did not get anything I paid for at all!! Bags need to be rechecked before handed out, I work fast food myself and we check everything before we give it!

name: Erin Ford
text: This is the ice machine in the dining room area. Totally nasty. I would hate to see the kitchen in the back.

name: Cheryl Rose
text: The new naked chicken chaloupa is awesome.

name: Andrew Reaves
text: I eat here all the time, but with the expectation that they will get something wrong or I'll have terrible service, or if I'm feeling extra lucky, both. Other than those, if you adjust your expectations, you won't be let down.

name: Amy flournoy
text: We went and ordered. It was wrong and food was missing. I called when we got home and the young lady was very rude, so I spoke with Dakota (manager) who was very polite and offered to fix our food.

name: Deborah DeeDee
text: The family enjoyed the tacos, they love tacos

name: Gabby Hall
text: Good food and service exceptionally  good.

name: Spartan 154
text: Staff is rude and not very helpful when you have a question. It's pretty bad when you can see how filthy the store is from the drive through window... Pretty sure the cashier was high

name: Jeremy Hilton
text: Messed order up told them twice and she repeated no sour cream and I got???? Probably guessed it sour freaking cream..... Ahhhhhhhhb

name: Jamie Williams
text: Best Doritos taco I have had

name: mars
text: I was missing my chips and cheese, went inside and the guy was very rude and told me to go through the long line again. This isn’t my first bad experience here, I’ve dealt with many rude individuals here. My food has been not fully cooked before many times.

name: Hondaia Accordia
text: My Husband wants to give Angel a raise. That Lady go over and Beyond. Way to Go

name: Jody Brown
text: Do not allow you to mobile order and they are very rude at the drive-thru and also they close early. On a Friday night they were closed with lights off by 11PM. Since when do they do that? Highly not recommended.

name: Caleb Kiley
text: They always forget something on my order whenever I order they drive-thru

name: Chad Davis
text: This was a KFC/ Taco Bell. I ordered a chicken sandwich and fries and both were old and dried out. My wife and daughter ordered from the Taco Bell side and had the same results. Also, we never received any straws.

name: Mark Winslow
text: This kfc is fantastic

name: Keith Hodge
text: It's a KFC/Taco Bell. Ordered an original bucket of chicken and when I got home it looked like a puddle of meat/crust. And I had to wait for it because they were "making it fresh". Never again.

name: Kandice Martin
text: Good fast hot fresh

name: Melissa Simmons
text: After waiting a whole year I found out this location has gotten 10x worse I went to purchase food today from this location when I got home and looked at the food it looked horrible the taco was soggy and the quesadilla was burnt and to add on they got my two supreme tacos wrong and when I went to return them after biting half of one and realizing it wasn’t what I paid for the lady asked for the food back which was a big NO NO with COVID-19 and other viruses you should never receive food that has been in someone else’s possession and I witnessed other employees opening the food which I had took bites out of and still preparing food (CROSS-CONTAMINATION!!) The employee and manager refused to give me two supreme tacos because one had been bitten out of and I got shorted my money because she did not give me the taco I had took a bite out of and after I received the replacement I did not feel like eating it because of the cross-contamination. This is a breeding ground for all types of illnesses the window they are serving out of has dirt piled on it and finger smudges and from what I’m told this is nothing new. Every single one of the afternoon shift employees (and managers) need to get retrained on their customer service skills and cross-contamination.

resp.text: That's not okay, Melissa. We want to know more. Please DM us on Twitter @TacoBellCare.

name: Christopher Lovett
text: As good as Taco Bell can get

name: Tracy Stanford
text: Food was good lady that took order was ugly

name: Susan Burch
text: Love love taco bell

name: James Mitchell

resp.text: Your order should always be perfect, James. Let's make up for that. Please reach out to us on Twitter @TacoBellCare and we'll help you out.

name: Alnita Mitchell
text: They got my order Totally Wrong last night,

name: Anna Baybay
text: Super friendly drive thru cashier, and order was correct with all condiments

name: Amy Coffey
text: Terrible service. Ordered a fill up box and did not get everything that is supposed to come with it. Food was cold.

name: dee baby
text: I ordered 10 wings and a biscuit. Was told I would have to wait 20-23 minutes. I asked would they all be fresh if I had to wait. I was then told to give her a min. She came back to say I couldn’t get them because they didn’t have 10 and they only cook 2 at a time with the batch. I then asked her so you don’t have any cooked, well wait, I have to go look was her answer. A few hrs earlier a friend of mine ordered 8 and more items totaling $30. After a few secs, someone found it funny to tell me that a bird only comes with 2 wings, 2 legs, 2 thighs, and a breast!!!! I was raging mad 😡 to be treated this way after I had already sat behind several cars!!! Service here is always terrible, but today took the cake!!!!!

name: j play
text: Day shift is usually solid. Supper time is the B team at best. Drive thru line was 25 minutes.

name: Jennifer Turner
text: Horrible place! They interrupted several times when we placed our order. We could hear them goofing off over the speaker at the drive thru. When the rude lady handed us drinks she didn't know which was diet Pepsi and which was dr pepper. When she came back with our bag of food she said "here". Nothing else. Just rude miserable people.

name: Latanya Ham
text: Asked for sour cream paid for it but wasn't on my taco🤔

name: Dave G
text:
Newly remodeled, great food and service.
This particular location has taken on some changes for the better. Not really bad before but better now.
I like going to Taco Bell, they have good food, fast service and nice staff.
If you haven't been there, go at least once to see for yourself.

name: Marty Jones
text: Rude, smart mouthed, not concerned about quality bunch of employees, but seem to be more clean than the last ones

name: Nikki Bennett
text: I am very upset with this place I got to the drive thru at 20 til 1 and they completely avoided me and when I said hello they turned there lights off. Will not be going back to taco bell in gadsden.

name: Cheryl Stith
text: Need to open the inside for dining in !

resp.text: We appreciate your rating, Cheryl. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Jackie Helms
text: Employees are regularly acting up. Nearly every time my husband and i are at this location we have our order given to us wrong. We are going to start going further out of our way to a different location to ensure we recieve what we order and pay for

name: Stacy Adams
text: Food is always hot and delicious.

resp.text: We're feeling the love, Stacy. We're glad to hear you're a fan and hope to see you soon.

name: Rodger Deerman
text: Just good 😀

name: Towanna Wilson
text:
The associate was on the speaker taking drive-thru orders was awesome! He was happy, fun, and energetic! He made me feel excited to be there.
Unfortunately, they usually mess up my order. Either they leave something out; drink is wrong;  leave something off you requested and paid extra for, etc. As with this order, I asked for a "little" sour cream; it was LOADED with sour cream!!😢
This was one of the better visits, but food was still wrong. 🤷🏽‍♀️

name: Ian
text: Orders have always been correct. Staff is polite. Lines and cause a wait on weekend nights, but only so much can be done about it.

name: Chiquita Mayben
text: Just don't do it.

name: Erin Ford
text: This is the ice machine in the dining room area. Totally nasty. I would hate to see the kitchen in the back.

name: Kathy Roark
text: I understand drive thru being busy due to Covid-19 pandemic. My experience is generally good at the Taco Bell on Meighan Blvd in Gadsden AL.  On The evening of May 3, there was a very long line at this store. We could hear the cashier cursing thru the ordering speaker. The ten soft tacos we ordered were ugly sopping messes of meat and cheese with big piece of lettuce thrown on top of some of them. The pintos and cheese I ordered was a small bowl of taco meat.  Do better,.

name: ethan johnson
text: The chicken tenders were tuff,  and dry. The  bean  burritos  were cold, and the "extra" cheese wasn't even melted. It wasn't 40 dollars worth of food. I was not impressed  at all! The best thing  about it was the peppermints that I got AFTER having to go inside because they gave us not one piece of silverware  with us having 5 sides

name: Aaron Strickland
text: Couldn't ask for a better place when it comes to customer service. Fast, friendly, and always put the sauce in the bag!!

name: Christa Lagan- Headrick
text: When I say we waited a long time,  I am not exaggerating!! About 5 cars ahead of us, but waited over 30 minutes in the drive thru line and then received the incorrect order, so we had to go in and wait 10 more minutes and the food was not hot, but we took it and went. I really do not think they would have been able to fix it without another 45 minutes and we did not have the time.  It was frustrating,  but the gentleman in the drive thru was working his hardest and fastest, and with a good attitude! He mentioned they were short staffed, so not much more he could have done.

name: lendy Barnard
text: It's Taco Bell and KFC. we got KFC and today is not the day to go get chicken. it was horrible today couldn't chew it. it was hard i just gave to my dog but, it's not always like that. the guy that was working at the window was super nice.

name: Michael Boyles

name: Jennifer Sterling
