name: S G
text:
Waited an hour and a half when promised an hour. Pizza was made correctly but was cold. Called to check on status; while on hold, the pizza arrived, and I put it in the oven to heat and stayed on the phone to complain that it was late and cold. After 15 minutes on hold, I hung up.
We hadn’t ordered from Domino’s for a couple of years or more due to multiple problems with late, cold, incorrect orders. We preferred to order from Papa Murphy’s, but found out today that they closed. What a sad day for Leeds! Not only was the pizza far superior, but it was much less expensive. From now on, I’ll make my own pizza. There are no good options for pizza in Leeds. That is pitiful.

name: Wolf J. Flywheel
text: I order from here like 3 to 5 times a week. I've even placed 2 orders in the same day. This Domino's is solid. 5 out of 5 stars, because 6 out of 5 isn't possible. 👌💪🤘🍕🍗 🥦🔥☁😑

name: Lynn Cleghorn
text: If I could give a negative star I would. These are the absolute rudest people with the social skills of a snake. I ordered online contact less curbside pick up at 6 pm. The tracker said it would be done between 621 and 631. At 640 they still hadn't brought it out.  I went in. They hadn't even started it. I asked for a refund, especially after I looked over at a pizza a lady was returning that was burnt to a crisp. They said 3 to 5 days for the refund. And were rude about it. They could care less of they lose business.  But let me tell you I have a big mouth and will make  sure that I tell everyone I know to go elsewhere.  I've never hoped a business would go under. Buy this place would be better served to clean house and start over from scratch with people who want to work.

name: Nia Green
text: This place is literally horrible. I’ve been waiting for my food patiently for 2 hours. This isn’t the first time i got food from here, & I don’t know why i decided to even give them another chance. The customer service is horrible, they all have attitudes, especially the driver. Like how are y’all going to all have attitudes? No one told them to get this job. No one forced them to work.  i’m honestly so upset but i don’t want my ghetto side to come out. So, anyway.... if you thinking about ordering here, DON’T.

name: adam ledbetter
text: Was on hold for over 30 minutes before I gave up.

name: Ky Jones
text: Food was perfect! Would have given 5 stars if the people working there weren’t in a competition at being the rudest person on the planet... Weird.

name: Heather Conn
text: It seems there is always some problem. Couple of weeks ago I waited on my deliver for 3 1/2 hours. Finally I went up to the store, door locked. I asked guy that works the add he was taken trash out. About my order. He said all orders were cancelled and refunded. Mind you its now 12@ night. I was not notified, he answered  he didn't send any info on it bout it. So many people were lined up around whatabuger BC of this. Someone needs to get help in there or clean house fresh employees to do the job. Have lived here for 1yr and I still havent had a good experience. Always a problem ..never solving issue

name: Stephanie McElmurray
text: As much money as we spend with this Dominos, and we call to complain about there not being the extra cheese we ordered, the guy on Friday May 21st at 8:22pm put me on hold for a long time only to come back to say he'd be glad to retake my order for me to pay for. Really? I told him I'd bring the pizza back, to which he just sat there. You have lost a valuable customer Sir, and I'll make sure to call the owners at how rude you were. What ever happened to customer service?

name: Savannah Stamps
text: We placed an order for delivery at 7:57 and checked the status of our order at 9:00 pm. It said our order was being prepped, so I called the store, waited on hold for 10 minutes and when the lady picked up, I asked about our order. She immediately said, “we just don’t have the staff to do all these orders so I’ll cancel it.” I told her we would still like to order and she said “well we haven’t started making it yet.” I expressed my frustration and asked her how we would’ve been notified if we didn’t call and she said that she’s already gave us a refund. When I asked how we would get our rewards back that we redeemed on our order she hung up. So I called back, placed on hold for 4 minutes this time and asked her how we would get our rewards back and she said “I dont know how you would do that, I dont know how to work the website.” We’ve always chosen dominoes over any other chain pizza but I think we will head on over to Papa John’s next time and see if they are competent enough to make a pizza and have it delivered in under an hour, or at least communicate properly.

name: Michael Donnelly
text: Always on time. Never had any problems.

name: Terry Brown
text: Dominoes was good but they did burn my first pizza and tried to serve it to me. Luckily I checked before getting too far away. But they replaced it for me and fixed the issue. The food was tasty .

name: Freebie Babe
text:
Wow. I ordered my food at 9 pm on 4/24. It is now 12:35am the next day and I never received my food. Their phone lines are busy and the tracking is no longer available. Never again will I order from them.

Update: I called the next day and asked to speak to the Manager. The Manager says to me, "Yeah what's up? I mean my bad.How can I help help?"

What kind of ghetto establishment is this? I consistantly ordered from there and always tipped. They lost a valued customer. No apology was given and no incentitive. Not to mention an employee in the background was getting smart with the Manager because I asked for a confirmation on my refund. Wow.

name: Daniel Davis
text: The worst experience I’ve even had with any food place! I don’t even Write reviews but this was so awful, food was cold, wrong, and over 2 hours late!

name: Forbidden Goddess
text: Very very slow and always cold pizzas. Need to do better

name: Fred Westrom
text:
The food is always good enough, but the delivery service is extremely inconsistent.
I have frequently waited 2 or more hours for deliveries from the Leeds dominos when the website predicts 25-45 minutes.
Consider calling the manager in person to place your order and ask if they can deliver in reasonable time because sometimes they just don't or can't.
Frequently when they are busy they don't even answer the phone so you can't even check on your order.

I restate though that the food is usually what you expect.
It could just take a long time to get your order.

I do still order from them.  I just have very low expectations when I do.

name: Loren Henderson
text: Terrible customer service. Employees clearly do not care and management does not hold them accountable whatsoever. I will go out of my way to pick up rather than use this location. 0/10 do not recommend.

name: Beckii Perea
text: Extremely laid back atosophere.  They were helpful with local deal's.

name: Elizabeth Bendall
text: WORST PLACE EVER!! Was promised 15 minutes and ordered at 7:10 and was ready at 8:20. Late to our movie and the place was disgusting.

name: Geoffrey Allen
text: I was pretty mad that every other Pizza place in the area was closed by 9pm. We chose to go to dominoes as a last resort and boy that was a mistake. Our experience with Noah was hands down the best customer service experience that we have had in a long time. He provided us with menu choices as we had no idea what we wanted. He even knew the exact cost of menu items after tax. Excellent customer service we will definitely be back.

name: JACOB FREEZE
text: This is the worst food service establishment in history. I should have learned after the experience that took us 3 hours to finally cancel a pizza that never came. I ordered a pizza and chicken around 10:15 on a Monday. An hour later the order is still in prep. I called the store to be put on hold for 20 minutes. I drive to the location and when i show up the phone is ringing and the manager just walks lazily out of the back. He hasn’t made the food, he isn’t doing anything. He says he has one driver that is about to quit. He asks if he can give me something for free. I said my food. He says he’d have to make it. This place would be better off as a parking lot. Add to that Domino’s has no real corporate support for these situations and you’re in for an evening of pulling your hair out.

name: rick baker
text:
The pizza arrived on time but it was Cold no cheese barely any toppings
Just a bad pizza

name: Josh Locklear
text: Absolutely horrible service. Called to check on my order, keep in mind I live less than 2 minutes away, and was told it would be right to me. An hour later, still no food.

name: Bradley Soto
text: Pizza was burnt and not even cut. Not even cut!!! Both of them!

name: N C
text: They will cancel your order after making you wait over an hour, not contact you to tell you if anything is wrong, and have an angry response for you when they finally answer after making you hold for 15 minutes on the phone. Save your money and just order from carpenetti's.

name: Caleb Smith
text: I understand being understaffed, but I waited for my food for hours with no call and the store wouldn’t answer the phone either. Never received my pizza and still am waiting for a refund.

name: Miguel Gabriel
text: Too expensive   small pizza $15  ridiculous  had about six pieces of sausage  a couple of pepperoni  never again

name: Nicholas Toth
text: Very nice people and good food.

name: slydawg97
text: Placed an order that was "being prepared " for 1.5 hours, called and sat on hold for 10 minutes only for someone to pick up the phone and hang it back up. Went to the store that was for once not understaffed and not busy, the cashier said she'd check the status of it but who the hell wants the food that long after ordering, they didn't even give me a refund, just a store credit for next time as if there's ever gonna be one

name: Austin Park
text: Got lunch from here for carryout and it was ready   in about 10min and tasted great!

name: Ethan Keating
text: Me and eboi just had the best pan pizza we ever done ate. Man that was good. Hold that crown, kings

name: Nicholas Toth
text: Great people and good food.

name: Oshun El
text: Food made wrong i waited an hour on a 45min wait time. Dont order from here it took 3people to get on the phone to do a refund

name: ashley decker
text: I don’t normally do reviews but let me start off with the lady on the phone was great. She was trying to help me. Now I ordered the $19 mean deal 2 pizzas parmesan bites and a 2 L and cinnamon twist. I got everything came inside got everything out and the Parmesan bites had nothing on them no butter no cheese so I live 3 mins from there. I called them asked if they can just send me some more.... she said yes but you’ll have to pay the delivery charge... uh no I already paid it once for the order to be right but it wasn’t she said ma’am I can give you a credit I said okay I’m thinking she just going to refund me the amount that it was for just them. No she said it’s a credit for when I want to order again I can call them. She said they are under new management and couldn’t do anything but what she has already tried to do... I was done fighting I just said okay thanks and hung up. I’m tired of this dominos not the first time something like this happened at this one.

name: Sareena Bagley
text: I wouldn't even give one star. Placed order at 7pm and it said Dustin was preparing.  Went to the store because nobody would answer the phone and they said they had not even started preparing yet, 8:57pm... plus, they acted like they could care less. So, I canceled my order and its a Sunday where everything closes at 9pm. Dominos, you SUCK....

name: Christopher Nix
text: Placed an order online a whole hour before they closed and they rejected my order. Negative five stars. Horrible service

name: Hannah Abrams
text: Well after my order took longer than it should, my drink was not included. So the guy ran to the store and then when I opened my box of pizza I didn’t receive any of the sauces I PAID for. Is didn’t even come with the regular garlic sauce. So I have been on the phone waiting for someone to answer for 10 minutes trying to let them know to bring the sauces with the drink. But of course, no one is answering. I’ll just start going back to Papa Johns.

name: JT Kendrick
text: Order took over an hour on more then one occasion, didn’t answer any phone calls.

name: TJ Piazza
text: Ordered a pizza at 845PM for delivery. Called the store at 10:30pm requesting an update and was left on hold for 15 minutes while some one went to “check” called back at 11PM and was told they’re short staffed and had to cancel my order. It took them 2 hours to tell me that. Ridiculous

name: manuel delgado
text: Very bad, I waited 1:30 and I saw a lot of people making complaints

name: Jeff Viehland
text: Don't expect curbside delivery, when there so busy. corporate should resend the ad. If they only had a clue.

name: Carl Benefield
text: Twice now it has taken over two hoirs to receive our pizza. I habe called multuple times and have never been able to speak with anyone.

name: heather kelly
text: Ordered boneless chicken tonight 2 buffalo and one plain from the Leeds, AL store. Got home I had 3 buffalo and one order was nothing but the crumbs cooked. Had to go back to the store, and when I got there a young gentleman asked what was the problem I asked for a manager another young gentleman said Im the manger. I opened the box and "YES" I tossed the open box on the counter and ask is this what you have people pay $8 for (trash) crumbs. The young kid said I can give you a free order NO its called replacement. Was waiting in truck when one of the employees came out and tossed the box of chicken on top of my hood and walked away. Then to top it off NOT one of the employees had on a mask.

name: Artie McIntyre
text: Very efficient and easy to use.

name: Debbie Alexander
text: Ordered pizza & it was burned & the garli c parmesan wings are just plain wings with what looks like dressing on them !! Won't order again

name: Jennifer Netherland
text: If I could give them zero I would ordered my pizza at 10:30, being the patient person I am I calmly wait at 11:57 it stated my driver left. Never showed up, and I called the store for an hour and no one answered. I am livid , and will never go to dominos again. I tipped 25% and can't even get my money back for pizza I never received.

name: Cherryl Streeter
text: The pizza was horrible.  The customer Service was excellent.

name: Jon Bryant
text: Average pizza and average customer service

name: YoungSandwich
text: its service is slow and its attention to detail is lacking such as if you dont want a certain thing such as onions on your food it will be ignored so i wouldn't even bother with requesting it to be taken off but outside of that and its extremely long time before you receive your order its ok i suppose as long as you are willing to wait 2 hours maybe more before getting it

name: Andy Hawkins
text: No one answers phone after recording. On hold for 15 minutes or more.

name: Bobbie Jean
text: Was doing an online order. But couldn't because I had to pay with card and only have Cash

name: Robin Ransom
text: If I could I would give this place a ZERO! I have tired to give them the benefit of the doubt, however that third times a charm! First time delivered burnt pizza and yet still was delivered when it was “checked”, 2nd time they only had ONE driver and ONE cook with the driver having to deliver to 5 different homes once again why was delivery an option? 3rd time I wanted to see if they had anymore drivers to help with delivery since well today is Friday and should be a busy day and their should be more drivers to help speed things up plus my children wanted pizza, however it was taking up to 45 minutes  to an hour to deliver if I would have known that before selecting delivery things would have been different. Preparing and keeping quality should be number one! Delivery  should be the new norm and prepping should be done quickly as possible as well as workers being prompt to show that Dominos values and respects the rule of less contact is best and  social distancing is being taken seriously. Leeds,AL location lacks this lesson.I use to live in Hoover, AL  and would  order from the Vestavia Hills dominos and my order was done all within good timing and even on a FRIDAY at that! So for the manager to give such a poor excuse as to why they are not meeting the same expectation as a more populated area like Vestavia, AL  is just plan sad. Leeds location should not have ANY reason for such a long wait.For a small community you would think the turn around time would be within reasonable time frames. Plus per the manager they have SEVERAL drivers! So trust me save your money invest in Papa Johns!!

name: CHRISTOPHER TAYLOR
text: Drivers will get lost and blame me because they can't find my house. I haven't changed my address and have no control over their navigation.

name: Austin Park
text: Food is delicious. They get a little behind sometimes but you just gotta make sure to order ahead of time if you wanna order on the weekend

name: Bare Grilles
text: If bipolar disorder was a restuarant this Dominos would be it.

name: Collin Snider
text:
Ordered a pizza on the online app and waited 3 hours and called a couple of times before I finally went to the dominos myself. This was the day COVID-19 started and they had a sign on front of store claiming they were closed. Which is fine, I completely understand. That being said, no one was answering the phone to tell people this. What I do not understand is the young guy at the counter yelling at me and other people and telling them they would get their money back in a couple of days. There were a lot of cars waiting outside on the phone. We never got our money back and called corporate multiple times. Months later and still no refund.

I would not recommend doing business with this particular Dominos. They need a heavy dose of class.

name: Sophia Hussain
text: Absolutely do not order from this Domino’s. My fiancé wanted to order pizza for a zoom game night with his family and not only was it 2 hours late from the 1.5 hours it spent in quality control, it was cold by the time it got to my house. Then both my fiancé and I got food poisoning. When I called the next day (May 28th) and spoke to Ned who promised me a refund. One week later my account was still charged. I reported it to corporate and they basically brushed it off and said they reported it to the local owner. There has been no action since. This place sucks.

name: American Patriot
text: Domino's is always good.

name: Adrian Lacey
text: Every time I order a pizza from this location, it always arrives cold. It takes over an hour for me the receive my order even though I live less than 10 minutes away. When I use the tracker, it always sits at “quality check” for at least 30 to 40 minutes. I have been very unhappy and will most likely never order from here again. I hate that it has come to this because normally I really enjoy Dominos.

name: Brandon Coffey
text: The folks at the Leeds location do a great job. The pizzas/cheesey breads are always cooked well (not soggy in middle or burnt crust) Good attention to odd special instructions. The deals are great for fast family dinners before or after a ballgame/practice.

name: Adrian Lacey
text: Every time I order a pizza from this location, it always arrives cold. It takes over an hour for me the receive my order even though I live less than 10 minutes away. When I use the tracker, it always sits at “quality check” for at least 30 to 40 minutes. I have been very unhappy and will most likely never order from here again. I hate that it has come to this because normally I really enjoy Dominos.

name: Michael Altman
text: Was left on hold for thirty minutes, I literally had to drive to the store with the phone still running, didn't even get a please hold. Went into the store with only one customer, I could here the phone ringing,they were just ignoring it this really upsets me  since I  am a regular customer

name: Richard Diamond
text: Easy peasy like always.

name: Ashley Lewis
text: Couldn’t order on the app because it said the store was closed (at 7:30pm on a Monday). I called to try and make an order and was on hold for 30 minutes. Cool. Papa Johns it is

name: grace alexis
text: Ordered 2 pizzas. The pizzas tasted ok but the pizzas were cut terribly. On one of them the edges were burnt.

name: Chris Batton
text: Got crust wrong and was home before I noticed

name: Jazzed MO
text: Cold medium pizza (supposed to have been a large)..and raw chicken wings

name: BloodOfCrimson Roll Tide
text: Food is great!! The staff is really friendly as well. The best part about it that my son has the opportunity to watch the process from start to finish.

name: Todd Sims
text: Placed order at 7pm and was told would be approximately an hour. Started calling them at 8:30 to find out where pizza was....no answer....called again at 9pm....no answer. Called again at 9:15 and just let it ring until they answered. Was told they would cancel my order and refund me within 2-3 business days. Told them I would be there the next day to get cash. Was also told my pizzas were never even made. Hang up the phone and 15 minutes later the driver calls and says he's in my driveway. Cold pizzas and all. Never again.

name: Denise Mayo
text: We ordered a five topping large pizza! It was ready when told! the toppings were great!  A large number and covered the whole pizza!

name: Tammi Hinds
text: Absolutely love their Philly steak Pizza and their Vegetarian Pizza.  Only issue is they need to offer Coke Zero instead of Diet Coke.

name: Lynn Reece
text: Every time I try to place an order over the phone for delivery, they always say they can't deliver it to me because my order wasn't enough money ($13.00).  However, I can immediately go online and place an order for the exact same thing I tried to order when I called and the order goes thru with no problem.  How is that possible?

name: crazy cat Lady
text: Got their cinnamon twists to try & a hand tosses pepperoni pizza, & those twists are heavenly!! Also got one of their Caesar salads to try & was surprised how good it was. Beautiful green lettuce with delicious chicken and shredded cheese! Very happy with my visit!

name: Star Stemas
text: Good quality, decent wait time. In and out in thirty minutes, and saved money because of the enployees sharing information on deals.

name: Wanda Monti
text: Wonderful place, I actually was standing in Little Caesars ordering my Hot Wings. Little Caesars allowed my order to go through for the wings and they didn't have any. So I ordered the wings from Domino's while standing in Little Caesars. And of course Domino's had just what I was wanting. Thank you Domino's for an awesome dinner

name: Chris Jones
text: Horrible, Horrible, Horrible. Tracker said order was ready at 611, got the at 622 to be informed my order was not ready. Did find out that two of the 4 were sitting there and also once I got home found that I had someone else's order, so half of my pder was sent to someone else so they had to remake mine. The girl at the counter acted like it was a task to help me or anyone else that walked in. Once I finally got the pizzas and returned home, well Walmart deli pizza is better than this. Two of the 4 were burnt, the cheese bread was burnt on the outside and not done on the inside. Each pizza barely had any sauce at all on them, you could not see it or taste it. Just a very bad experience all over. I usually love Dominoes but this is ridiculous.

name: Samantha Smith
text: Delivery driver was fast earlier than 30 minutes  good job

name: Taylor Madsen
text: This location is THE BEST!!! We just moved here and they were very nice, welcoming and informative on the current deals and specials. You can even watch them make the pizza!! The pizza and cheesy bread was BOMB! 10/10!!!

name: Amanda Tucker
text: This is my favorite Dominos. I order here online at least 3 to 4 times a week. Thank u crew for always having my order ready on time and hot.

name: Shawn Hamby
text: Its dominoes. No more ..no less.  Courteous though

name: Slater Brazeal
text: I love Domino's Pizza in general because they are moderately priced and their Domino's app and rewards program makes ordering Pizza extra awesome! While I have never had any issues with product quality from this location on several occasions the pizza has been extremely late the last time my pizza tracker said my food had arrived when it had not and when I tried to call the store no one answered... Finally 20 minutes after my pizza "had arrived" my driver finally pulled up. He was polite but offered no apology.

name: Leslie
text: I always order from Domino's because I can watch how my order progresses, and they've always been nice to me. I would remove half a star because sometimes they under cook my pan pizzas. I like them crispy. But full credit for effort! :)

name: Lexi Williams
text: I’ve been waiting on my order for an hour and a half I call and guy yells saying I’m waiting on a driver still my pizza isn’t here and I payed 41 dollars for two pizzas

name: Joshua Dodson
text: The worst dominos i have ever they hung up in the midfle of me ordering my food dosnt take 50s or 100 doller bills the manager is rude as hell when i called to get the general managers number she wouldnt even tell me by far the worst dominos experience of my life

name: Minis Tirith
text: Trash service. All I can say.

name: Ericka Byers
text: My pizza is always good from here.

name: william powell
text: Still taste like cardboard with tomato sauce.

name: Melanie Payne
text: Deliciousness on thin crust! Had never had a Supreme on thin crust, and it was so much better than the thick crust version. Great service!

name: karen everett
text: Always get good service.

name: Alexis Colwell
text: pizza is always fresh tasting and hot when we pick it up. Has always been ready when we get there and no mistakes. We love the new deep dish pizza, so yummy!

name: Nickie DiMartino
text: Steak sub.... Very good

name: Matthew Pledger
text: Their driver kept almost $20 in change from my mother-in-law's order without her permission back in January 2018. She will never order again from Domino's (Cowabunga Pizza franchise from Atlanta) again. The previous local franchise owners took better care of their community than the Atlanta based Cowabunga ever will!!!

name: LRice 9018
text: Pizza was great tonight!

name: Emmerald Sado
text: Great place and always a deal

name: Austin Fondren
text: I would definitely dub this the highest quality pizza joint in the state.

name: Don Blackall
text: We ordered a pizza for delivery and it took the pizza place an entire hour just to prep it and another 3 just to get it to my house. I have no idea what has to go on in a management stand point here but something needs to change. Obviously things aren't working out if it takes 4 hours to get pizza delivered.

name: Jenn Cornwell
text: Ordered pizza and stuff at 7:26pm over an hour later still no pizza! Called on hold for over 17 minutes and never and answer or a call to say hey your pizza is gonna be late we are trying our best or something. Doesn’t make sense

name: Debra Cowan
text: Meat lovers was awesome..the 2nd pizza was to be thin crust n it wasnt. But roommate said it was still good. Live on Margeret, to far to drive back. Over all very good!

name: Bobby B
text: Their Philly Cheesesteak pizza is the best

name: Amylia Phillips
text: They stopped delivering to moody. I have been a loyal customer to this company. I always tipped well and even when they messed up my order I wouldn't be a bother. I am extremely unhappy with their new 9 minute rule.

name: Monica Montes
text: I like the quick service and the option to track the delivery using the “Tracker”. Drivers could be more fun when delivering, sometimes they don’t look happy.

name: Kelly Williamson
text: These guys rock. Food is always fresh, made correctly and on time (most of the time it's here early). ~Kelly W

name: Monica “Beautiful Moe” Henderson
text: The pizza was awful..it was full of grease. I took it back  the next day because It was night when I purchased it didn't feel like taking it back. They tried to give me a hard time about bringing it back..needless to say they gave me my money back 🤔

name: Tamika Miller
text: The staff are wonderful and the pizza is really good and their handmade pan crust is the best!

name: Vexing Devil
text: Pizzas were made correctly and on time every time I've been here. Couldn't give 5 stars tho, cuz they are very skimpy on the toppings and cheese

name: Tina Thomas
text: Just disappointed!  I finally convinced my husband to try Domino's again and our large Meatzza pizza was awful. I ordered online and watched the tracker to make sure we arrived on time to pick up our order.  He went in and had to wait almost 20 minutes to pick it up.  We opened it up at home and it hardly had any cheese on it after I ordered double cheese and paid for double cheese!  Also, very little meat and it was cold!  We only live about a mile from Domino's.  At least the bread twists were warm.   So disappointing.....guess no more Domino's now!

name: S M
text: They're okay, food sometimes takes a little longer than I'd like (45-70 minutes). Also even though they are less than 5 miles away it won't let me place the order online so I have to call. They know this, but when my order took over an hour last week they sent me a voucher as an apology and when I read it it's for a deal they already run and only for online orders which sucks. They do tend to over cook the food and a few of the employees are kind of unprofessional on the phone but all in all it's an average pizza joint so don't pay attention to the people judging so harshly. It's dominos not some high class restaurant guys.

name: Latonya Bowman
text: I'm not sure if they don't care what you order or if they are soooooo busy that they just cant get orders correct.

name: Alex Algiere
text: Always forgets to put hot sauce on my pizza, otherwise it's good.

name: Michael Howell
text: Every time I order late they cancel my order. You can’t order more than $25 on app for cash delivery. I order minimum of $300 a week from Pizza Hut in Moody. Receipts to prove it. This restaurant is hurting themselves by not accommodating this bar.

name: Cassandra Naylor
text: Clean store

name: Amanda Hatcher
text: I ordered over the phone. The man told me it would be 15 mins. When I got there they didn't have my pizzas. Also, they told me they couldn't take a $100 bill. Alot of people use cash over cards because of the identity theif. The guy that told me they didn't take 100's looked like he was high. I will not be back to that domino

name: Justin Gilbert
text: On time and very courteous!

name: Janet L Hunter
text: This was another awful experience and the last time I try to do business with Domino's pizza. I was told go to Sonic to get change for my order. Why didn't I avoid the hour wait and go to sonic to begin with? There very rude customer service. Slow and food suffers as well as customers with there bad attitude.

Second time our pizza, sandwich, and bread were over an hour later than the tracker said it would be (last time was 2 hours) paid for extra chicken was given THREE pieces on the entire sandwich. Pizza wasn't cut, was cold and our bread bites which were supposed to have 16 pieces only had 8..needless to say, we won't be ordering from here anymore.

name: Kim Evans
text: Always hot and fresh, courteous delivery staff.

name: Debbie Oden

name: beardenjim

name: Katy Southerland
text: I wish I could give this store zero stars. Food delivered literally an hour late with zero remorse. An incorrect order that was, not surprisingly, cold. No forks delivered with one salad when two salads were ordered. Wow. Wowwowwow.

text: The customer service was not good. My order was sitting ready when I got there. The young lady wasn't paying attention I sat for 25 mins waiting. My food was cold, I am disappointed.

name: Maureen Henderson
text: Horrible service, horrible attitudes from staff. Asked for assistance on the online order, 2 for $10.00. I put my cc  number in, emai, phone number, etc.. and submitted order. After 15 minutes, lady said the order didn't process. She didn't care one bit, so I payed full price for 2 sub's, this staff is horrible!!!!!!!!!

name: Curt Brewer
text: Although the appearance of the store is a 3, I rated my review at 5 because of the customer service. I ordered a meatball sub. The girl who helped me was very friendly and did not hesitate to insure my happiness as a customer. I will visit this place again even though it is not the nicest or I've ever been in. It goes to show you what friendly customer service will do.

name: Mehri Hall
text: It was ok. Any subway I stop at is good. Their food is great.

name: Aint It Chief
text: Good service good food but boring atmosphere

name: Lacticdog 92
text: Absolute worst subway in the greater mobile area, staff is always rude and will literally roll their eyes when asking for anything extra. Usually they leave out ingredients on my sandwich. I wish I could attach a picture of my sandwich on here. It looked like a prison sandwich. Hardly any meat, lettuce piled up on one side, mayonnaise EVERYWHERE, no cheese, no mustard, absolutely foul service, I will NEVER return. They don’t care about quality or service here and corporate should probably step in and do something. It’s sad that I have to drive across town to get a decent subway sandwich and if I want decent service

text:
Went in to purchase $50 in gift cards. Only one person was working and she was busy with drive thru, and told me she had never done a gift card before, but told me another employee should be there any minute. After waiting about 5 minutes, I told her I would come back, walked over to Starbucks and purchased additional gift cards in less that 1 minute total.
Walked back to Smoothie, where 2 employees were now busy making smoothies. The other employee had never done a gift card either, but after waiting another 5 minutes (I was the only customer in the store both times, besides drive thru) I left without being spoken to. Good luck being open 6 months, and I hope you are because Athens needs places such as this. I have bought smoothies there before which I was very pleased with, although a little pricey.

text: I like how now their smoothies are more healthy and more variety. Some fruit you can choose if you prefer wild ones with no sugar added. What i don't like is their app. It doesn't always function when you went delivery but recent with all the fees for delivery, it's no reason to order. The fees alone are so high it's like you ordering the same thing again. I order a smoothie that's 11$ but the fees also equal that much, so to me it's like I'm missing out on a smoothie so it's pointless to use until they figure out a better approach.

name: Jessica Lewis (Jess)
text: A very large menu with all assortments and addons! They are featuring a tart cherry flavor add-in right now. I wanted to try Banana Boat because it sounded absolutely divine but alas, they were out of the frozen yogurt used to make it so I settled for a Caribbean Way, which consists of strawberries and bananas blended with a nonfat yogurt. It was actually really good. They offer 3 sizes for their smoothies. Lots of Smoothie King merch for sale, as well as various "health" chips and snacks. I would have given 5 stars except for their being out of stock of  a main ingredient for items on their menu. The young man that was the cashier was very knowledgeable and helpful, polite.

resp.text: We appreciate the 4-star review and your feedback about our Caribbean Way smoothie, Jessica! We look forward to serving you again and making it 5 stars. 🥤

text: Typical Bojangles food and environment, but my experience was marred by poor service. On a Sunday lunch, the store was poorly staffed, the staff that was present seemed to be untrained by the poor service I received, and the food quality was lacking. If you are a Montgomery local, unless things change, visit the Eastchase location.

resp.text: Mitch, would mind sending us additional information on your visit to social@bojlangles.com?

name: AA Beauty
text: I give bojangles 5 stars. The chicken is always hot and fresh. Great spot to stop to eat while traveling.

name: Steven Penny
text: Apparently they were originally giving out incorrect size cups for the first few weeks so I was expecting a larger size when I placed an order tonight. Instead of just saying sorry for the confusion, offering me the medium cup or asking if I'd like to pay the difference, the male manager that took my order just acted like it was my problem. I was annoyed but I drove away and wanted to eat the Mac and cheese but they didn't give me any utensils(I was working) so I had to dig around my car and luckily I saved some plastic ones from another restaurant. I then tried to eat and there was a hair in my food. I went back received a refund and was told sorry by the cashier and possibly another manager that was around but the male manager that had to process the refund didn't have anything to say.....hair in the food and you couldn't say sorry for the inconvenience? Not anything major, just disgusting hair where it shouldn't belong and not very cheery attitude from the manager. I can get the same service from KFC if I wanted...which I don't and they've been around for years.

name: Chelsea Dodge
text: The girl that is working the register this evening was the most rude and ugly person. I ordered a drink with my salad and was giving attitude about it then no dressing no forks and she acted like it was above her to do her job. I won't be eating there for a while.

text:
I visited bojangles at about 8:40 pm on 1/7/2018 .
My experience with this reastaurant establishment was not a good one.I went through the drive through and waited about 10 mins before i received my food.I didn’t find out my order was incorrect until i got home.I had to ask for napkins and a fork.When i asked for hot sauce for my chicken they told me they was out .Who sales chicken without hot sauce? The 2 guys who worked the window was very rude..They act like i was bothering them for asking for things that was suppose to come with your meal.

resp.text: Shaun, we're very sorry to hear this. Can you please email the details to marketing@landonholdingsinc.com?

text: Saturday afternoon, 15 -20 min wait, flew by the ambiance in door and outdoor was live. Our server was was great, recommended several items on the menu. We tried the Baked pretzels with queso cheese dip and Honey mustard dip. Ordered the chicken sandwich with french fries and the Brisket and Double burger  with potato wedges. Sprite, water, and Mojito for drinks. the food was served hot, everything was fresh and juicy, seasoned well too! We will be back! Had a great time!

resp.text: Hey Shir. Thanks for the kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Danny Neaves
text: This particular location is great, plenty of parking, some free, some are metered. The facility is top notch and very nice. It is a new facility (as of February 2020) but it goes beyond that it is just a well done space and they stay busy. I've been as early as 11:15 and as late as 12:30 and it is usually very busy. The staff is good and the food is good too. This chain has become a little pricey over the last couple of years, but we enjoy it every time we go. I've been to this location with 3 people and with 6 people and both times we were able to sit quickly even though they were busy. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a quick lunch, they can get you in and out.

name: Hannah Fuller
text: I work in food service so I know some days can be tough, but the lady working to-go with the long blue nails was the rudest ever!! I tried to call and place a to go order and I couldn’t even stand to continue speaking with her using that tone. Then I go in to order takeout inside and she acted like it was so irritating that I was even there. I tried to compliment her to maybe brighten her mood but she still spoke with me with an attitude. Then after I paid 3 dollars for a lemonade, she brought me what tasted like water with some drops of lemon juice in it. I want my refund for my drink!!! I went there a year ago and had bugs in my food. I should’ve learned then not to come back!

text: I go here quite often and get lunch. Awesome service and the food is always amazing. Whether  we go in and sit down to eat or order to-go, food is always phenomenal and always exactly what I order.

resp.text: Hey Trey. Thanks for the feedback! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Hello Terry
text: I ordered my lunch online and went straight to the restaurant about 5 minutes away by car.  The staff was pleasant.  I paid for my food and waited in the van for my co-worker to pay for his food.  As I waited I looked into my bag to inspect my lunch and eat a few fries.  The fries were hard and lukewarm at best.  I go back in and ask for fresher fries which they obliged by taking my entire lunch back and putting the "fresh fries" in my clamshell.  After returning to the office to eat; the parmesan garlic chicken nuggets were obviously not fried to order.  They were dry and barely warm as well.  Every time I've gone to BWW this has been the case whether dining in or carry out.  I think they cook everything in bulk and its never fresh or hot when it reaches the table.  In my dine-in experiences bone-in wings are never cooked to order and always seem like they're been sitting under a heat lamp and brought out to the table.  I will not go to another BWW again; food is just not done right and is never good!!

resp.text: Hey there. We apologize for the food you received…thanks for letting us know. Please fill out the form at the bottom of BuffaloWildWings.com/FAQ where it says 'Orders & Visits' so we can make it right for you.

name: TaNeiqua Jackso
text: The absolute worst chicken I've ever eaten, I ordered ahead and the food had to be brought to the pickup area, the room was ten minutes away from BWW so there shouldn't have been a reason for it to be cold as though it had been sitting out for hours. The chicken had so many feathers, I couldn't even enjoy . I ordered kids meals for my girls both of which were supposed to have a drink that we didn't receive, and also their order was completely wrong,  the whole order was wrong  actually and the taste of the food was mediocre at best, that was the first and last time for me and my family. And when I tried calling no one answered the phone, it was already late and I was upset, we basically ate fries for dinner . if I could rate it a Zero I really would. But I'll just do one better and not give them my money at all.

resp.text: Hey there. Thanks for letting us know about this, we are very sorry. Please fill out the form at the bottom of BuffaloWildWings.com/FAQ where it says 'Orders & Visits' if you don’t mind so we can make it right for you.

text: Our server told us she was training a new girl. She took our order and promptly disappeared. She never came back to check on us. Someone else brought our food. Our fries were cold. That young man took them back and returned later with fresh fries and also refreshed my daughter's drink.  We finished our meal and started stacking the dishes before the trainee arrived to ask if we wanted dessert. We decided to just pay and leave.  We never saw our original server again.  The place is brand new. Very nice sports bar atmosphere. Everyone else seemed friendly. I just think we had the wrong server.  I will go back again to try another server.

name: Kelsey
text: 11 of us went for lunch to celebrate a coworker's birthday. We ordered and waited almost an hour for food. The server started out good refilling drinks but that really only happened once. It took effort to find out why the orders were taking so long considering we arrived before the lunch rush. The food finally arrived and wrong. I ordered a black bean burger. The only correct thing about it was the patty. Instead of the cheddar and ranch advertised on the menu, the burger was slathered with mustard. It also had lettuce, tomato, mayo, and pickles. I'd have requested no pickles had I been aware it's come dressed differently than advertised. The restaurant is nice. The potato wedges were good. The lack of service and an incorrect order when it could've come as advertised is baffling. If you visit, be prepared for a lengthy wait. Beverages will come but everything else may be a battle.

name: Jasmine Daniels
text: Do not eat from this store!!! I had 3 call in orders for wings from here Tuesday night. The wings were not cooked all the way. The wings made my brother, cousin, my boyfriend, and I sick on the stomach. My brother woke me up at 2 a.m. from puking so loud! I called the manager on today and was nice about telling him what all happened. He responded by telling me that they cook their wings all the way and that there is no way possible we got sick from THEIR food! He stated that “If you all were food poisoned you all would still be throwing up today and it usually takes 24 hr to get it”. So they have doctors on site now? My family and I hadn't eaten anything since the morning of before eating there last night around 7:20 p.m. Once your stomach digest your food, if it doesn’t agree with what you’re putting in it it is going to come out one way or the other! It doesn’t take 24 hours for your food to digest! My brother did not eat all day today. The manager was rude and that is not great customer service. They just opened this store and this was my first time eating here last night. I see Why I don’t now. BUFFALO WILD WINGS will never get another PENNY from me, but y’all enjoy!!

resp.text: Hey Jasmine.  We are very sorry about the poor experience you had.  Please give us a call at 866-704-0777.

name: ALBERT THOR HARSTVEDT
text:
Atmosphere and food was great. Restaurant very clean. However, I've had better service at Waffle House. Our food was brought out pretty quickly. I had to get up and go get us both silverware and napkins. Server (Jania) never brought us any till I got up to go find another server to all for them. Jania did bring me a refill on my drink but not my son's water. What really got me was that Jania (our server) never took our dirty plates of the table. She brought the check, came back a few minutes later to process the pmt, brought it back again...but NEVER picked Any of our plates off of our table. Please train your wait staff to serve the guests that they are waiting on. My son paid the tab and still left over 20% gratuity. We hungout for a while after paying the tab to visit, but Jania never came back to remove our dirty plates. Yes, I'm going on about for a bit. Any restaurant establishment is only as good as thepeople that work for them. Be it a mom and pop owned restaurant or a 4-5 star establishment. Will I come back to this location...No, not now. Minimal expectations walking in....less than minimal results except for the quality of the food and atmosphere. Too bad as the cost of the owners investment in this location looks pretty expensive. Have a great day...
Guest

text: The place was great being new to the area, but experience bad service. One of the people in our party received cold food. She ordered I think fried mushrooms and the inside was still frozen🤢🤢🤢, how can that happen? Answer, rushing. Our server name was Dakota and he gave the wrong food to the wrong people and asked if they would just swap what they had already eaten off the wrong plate and give to the correct person😠. He then was forgetting to bring things to the table and refilling drinks.  I am a big Buffalo Wild Wings customer every Friday going to the Gardendale location with Noooo problems there. So downtown Buffalo Wild Wings I don't think I will be back🙁

name: Daniel Bolding
text: Great new addition to downtown Birmingham! It is conveniently located by the UAB campus and Regions Field where the Birmingham Barons play. I watched the first Birmingham Irons game there on the projector screen that was above the bar, and it was awesome! Great bartenders that remember your face and even your orders! I love going on Thursdays for the buy one get one free boneless wing days. My favorite sauces are Mango Habanero, Hot BBQ, Hot Buffalo, and Asian Zing. The new Bourbon Honey Mustard is great too, but the former sauces are hotter and better to me since I love spicy foods. Most BWW have been subpar recently, but this one is great!

They are there to make the coffee and make the orders right for the customers, so they shouldn't get mad at us when the order is wrong. Also when you hand a customer a drink you should hand them a straw to go with it and not get mad when they sit there and ask for a straw. Just some things to think about.

I'm also extremely thankful that they are continuing to adhere to the Covid-19 health guidelines, with everyone wearing masks and gloves, and touchless drive thru.

Thank you for holding steady at this location.

name: notthebeesxoxo
text:
This is the best DD in town. I love DD coffee but struggled for a while to find a DD that can consistently make a drink right. Every place, they either made it too strong, not strong enough, not sweet enough, too sweet... Just tons of issues and lots of wasted money on coffees I couldn't even force myself to finish.

Then they opened this location and they are the most consistent DD I've been to and I go here every single day during the week. The people are also so nice and the drive thru, even when busy, is so fast! There could be 7 cars in line and I'll still be done in 10 mins or less.

text: Pizza was hot and delicious.  It is getting pretty bad though when they get too cheap to give their customers parmesan cheese packs. Also, a delivery fee should be for the driver. If you don't physically deliver the food, the fees shouldn't be going to your pocket.

text: Called ordered 4 pizzas they apparently made 3 of them put them sitting to the side and said the 4th was coming it never did.. by the time they realized it my other 3 had already been sitting out on the counter 30 mins and was cold did not even attempt to store in the warmer.. there solution was to offer me a full refund(debit card could take 2 days to return to account) and me have to find food somewhere else and wait more or wait to remake all 4 pizzas together.. 1hr 45 mins later I left with my food!! While sitting there they also handed out another person's whole order to another customer so he had to wait for remake as well!! NOPE!! NOT ever again!!

name: Gary Kendrick
text:
Pizza Hut provides very good pizza and gives you great choices, as well as their wings are also good.  Some of their policies do, however, tend to make me question the thinking behind them.

The most recent one is doing away with the complimentary parmesan cheese packs making the customer pay for a small parmesan cheese shaker for a dollar if they want the parmesan cheese to go on top of their Pizza.

I also have a problem with chain pizza restaurants, like most of the main players in the chain pizza restaurants that charge a delivery fee for delivery yet that fee is not going to the drivers at all.  Pizza Hut, like many of the other major players seems to be doing away with their eat-in restaurants meaning you either have to carry it out or get it delivered so if that's going to be your main business you shouldn't be charging people extra for it making customers think the extra fee goes to the drivers because it doesn't.

If you're going to charge a fee for delivery then pass it along to your drivers and don't just add it to your bottom line.  I do like Pizza Hut pizzas but there are other places, in our area that I do like better.  I keep coming back to Pizza Hut because it's consistent, it's good, and when you crave Pizza Hut no other place will do.  Of the large pizza chain restaurants I do believe Pizza Hut delivers are provides the best product overall in their coupon specials are also good.

text: The five stars is only when you catch the funny cook that collects old currency when he works the grits are creamy and delicious eggs perfectly cooked chicken moist wish he was there today the fact that no one wears hair nets is a turn off watched the chick with the overly processed pinkish hair go in the coolant with the bacon and I won’t be eating mine I only mention it being overly processed because the chances of her hair breaking into my food increase

name: Tony Chatfield
text: Don't expect gourmet food, but do expect decent food at an excellent price. You can also get in and out quickly. The staff is very friendly. It's a good choice for a filling breakfast while traveling. Not so good a choice for a first date.

name: marshae davis
text: This was the worst experience ever. I ordered the chicken melt and after taking 2 bites the chicken was rubbery tasting and whwn i asked the server to only charge me dor for my other  food she said because there wasnt a manager there she couldn't but i could call and explain to them. I wasn't about to do all that when it could have been handled at that moment. U could clearly see i didn't eat the sandwich and i didn't want them to remake it because i felt like all the chicken probably tasted that way especially since she blamed it on the way in which it was cooked. I just feel like some things r a simple fix and that was not handled properly.

name: Jan Hill
text: I guess Waffle House is popular in the south and although the food isn't bad, it wasn't the best and the staff that was there didn't appear to really need customers. I felt like I was intruding and no one was pleasant until we gave them a tip. This appeared to lighten their mood. The waitress was much nicer after that. It was a to go order so I don't think we made to much extra work for anyone. The people in the south are usually so nice and its the one thing I always look forward to. Las Vegas can be very self absorbed. I guess Waffle House also had it's moments.

name: Nicholas La Rosa
text: Great place to get breakfast all day long, 24/7. If you like breakfast type food this is the place to go. Fresh food cooked when you order it, not waiting in a window to be stuffed in a brown paper sack like a fast food joint.

name: Jonathon Chew
text: This might sound like too much praise. But the steak was excellent. I ordered it medium and after cutting into it there was just a hint of a pink line through the middle, which, by the way it is not easy to do on such a thin steak. This place is very well staffed as well. Best waffle house ever.

text: Wes I am addicted to Subway sandwiches. Not all Subway's is the same. I like people that great you with a smile and fix your food the way you want it. I really like the nice people in Madison AL at the Subway Just behind the Regions Bank on 72 W Hwy Madison AL . The Ice tea is the same every time. Most places make sweet tea and it reeks of sugar. resp.text: We are sorry we got your order wrong and we want to help fix this. Could you please share your feedback with our customer service team here: http://bit.ly/JJsFeedback so we can educate the local store owner?

text: Past two times we have been to this location.  There is only one person in the store working making sandwiches.  The rest are out delivering.  It seems that they should always make sure the store is staffed with more than one person.  We ordered online in the car parking lot and it took 25 minutes to get food.  You call that freaky fast.... look at the order time then compare to the actual time on phone.  Poor management.

text: Listen, I gave this location a chance over and over again. They’re incredibly slow. I’ve been waiting for an online order for almost 25 minutes inside the store - there’s literally five employees behind the counter, and five other customers who all have their food. I know there’s a lot of online orders but this is ridiculous to experience multiple times at the same location.

text: Love the way their fresh baked bread tastes. And the service is very quick. They will let you come in earlier in the day and sell you the day old bread at a very discounted price and it's still just as good.

text:
Love the tuna salad.  I especially love the tuna salad delivered.  Online ordering system is one of the best.  Really cuts down on confusion and incorrect orders.

Edit 09/20/19  This has become a regular for me.  A once a week delivery of tuna, just like I want it.  Service is generally fast and friendly.

name: Kayla DeRider
text: I travel the country with my husband and have been to plenty of locations let alone have worked at 4 locations over 6 years and never have i walked into such a messy store! There were box lunched boxes everywhere stuff all over the cold tables ... and idk if its a new thing to not wear aprons and to be able to wear leggings but to me that was unacceptable.... and another thing .. is there a new way to make sammies? Cause i dont understand why both of my #16s and my 15 had its lettuce and onions underneath the meat and cheese?!? That just really ruined my whole sandwich... i think im going to message corporate ....

text: I ate here on Jan 8 because I wanted something quick before the national champ game.  I ordered a country club with all the freebees except sprouts and cucumbers.  The cashier rang up all freebees, add sprouts, add cucumbers.  Instead of remaking the sandwich, my toppings were scraped into the garbage and more toppings were placed on top.  There were still some reminence of sprouts on the sandwich.  Long story short, I got food poisoning from the sandwich.  Jimmy johns has now suspended sprouts from the menu temporarily due to salmonella.  I feel like this could have been avoided had they discarded the sandwich that was made in error and made me a new one.  (I have not been back)

text: we enjoyed the meal.  What i didnt enjoy is what happens all to often on any and all jobs. He acted as though it was a real problem for him to work the register and help the young girl out.  I understand the jobs, but there is a time that you just pitch in!!  If i was that manager at that store, the older man would be sweeping the floors and wiping down tables.  The black lady that did the cooking was just as much as a jerk as the older man.   She had an attitude a mile long.  Other than that the service from the young cashier was great she was very friendly and nice.  Did a wonderful job.  there should be 2 cashiers working. OMG!! Where do I begin????
I got there only to find the door locked. I had to be buzzed in.
Once inside, I thought I had walked into a third world country.
No one inside is wearing gloves, no one inside was wearing a hair net, the credit card swipe machine wasn't working, and one of the delivery drivers was wearing a gun on his hip.
That's right, dude was packing a pistol.
It's just my opinion,  but I feel that if you need to carry a glock to deliver pizzas, that may not be the best career choice for you.

name: Leslie Weaver
text: We LOVE Exotic Wings and eat lunch (take out) from here at least once a week.  Everything is made to order with fresh ingredients.  A handful of times, we have had less than perfect food, but it was cooked by a new employee and typically those employees don't last long.  If you haven't, try the philly cheesesteaks and chicken phillies!  You won't be disappointed. You're welcome. :)

name: Katie Jo Gossett
text: I am beyond disappointed, I put my order in online for delivery at 6:30pm. My 3 small children patiently waited at the door for the pizza man. I checked the tracker an hour later and was shocked to find they had cancelled my order. I had no idea. Not even a courtesy call to state that it had been cancelled. I'm certain it is because of the neighborhood, which I considered after the fact. I'm okay with them not delivering here, in fact I would have gladly given my $15 tip to the person who prepared my order had they just called and said.... We don't deliver there but we would be happy to prepare your order for pickup ( my husband was already out picking up my chinese, which will be cold by the time I eat because I refuse to eat without my children.) I might live in a budget friendly not so appealing possibly dangerous neighborhood but I'm a good customer, I tip well and I appreciate the courtesy of the places I give my money.

When I reordered later for a carry out, he threw in an extra surprise for my inconvenience😉😉 So kudos to Everett for the professionalism!!

name: Chris F. - iamd4g
text: Even their reply is fake and auto-generated like their b🤬🤬🤬t pizza and service. There will be no "next time" BOTTOM DOLLAR ON THAT. Horrible experiences at this locations but tonight's interaction burns bridges. Granted, there was inclement weather tonight so some delay and difficulties were expected. However, from what I experienced tonight, Domino's Pizza off of Mobile Hwy would have been better closed. No matter, I ordered from the app and request delivery. I finalized the order on the app but I later received a call from the store, saying they didn't have delivery drivers (again, expected difficulties) and I need to pick up my food. What they didn't tell me is that they voided my app order, placing a hold on my debit card (upcoming 'last straw'), and I would need to bring my debit card to re-order. So, when I arrived at the store, lo and behold. They told me that I needed my card. Thus, I had to drive back through Tropical Storm Sally in a partially wrecked car, just to get my debit card. (Now, given my past dealings with this store, I should have know better but I am a naive person person at times.) I get back to the store, just to find out that because of the order I made on the app, Domino's Pizza tried to charge me twice for the same order. One for delivery and the other for carryout. I snapped. So what? I need to have at least 40 dollars in my bank account to order pizza. I am sorry; your tax dollars don't pay teachers enough for that. I find it really funny that Domino's Pizza can jump into your bank account so fast when you order but, refunding and correcting orders, they feint as bumbling idiots. I do not just hold the store at fault but the entire corporation. They have no regard for customer service; Domino's Pizza only cares about profits and their shareholders. I wouldn't drop or invest a dime into Domino's Pizza, with all the dried and burnt pizzas I have ordered over the years. Hell, Pizza Hut has a hotline for situations like this, but you invest your time in 'Pizza Insurance' and 'HotSpots'. How about fairly selling pizza when trying to double dip into people's bank accounts? How about optimizing your systems so errors like this can fixed quicker? Just go under, already. But, before you do, give me my money back because YOU STILL HAVE NOT DONE THAT YET FOR A ORDER I CAN NOT EAT BECAUSE I NEVER RECEIVED IT!

resp.text: Hello Chris, I apologize for your experience and would like to assure you that this is not an automated response and your review is individually read and responded to because we want to make sure your concerns are addressed. We value your feedback and hope to talk with you in hopes of getting to the bottom of this. Please send your contact information to us at Dominos5885@5-StarPizza.com so that we may reach out to you directly. It is about 8 minutes from the store to my office. 1:00 pm, no pizza, 1:10 pm no pizza, 1:25 pm, still no pizza. Called the store. Only have one driver but it'll be out shortly. (Maybe Domino's should consider giving their drivers a living wage so they would stay).1:40 pm, pizza finally shows up at my office. The driver gave me my now cold pizza and seemed a bit miffed that I failed to leave a tip.  Guess I'll wait two more years. EDIT: 5-23-2019 Just got off the phone with a woman who identified herself as the "manager on duty"  per the response from the "owner" I called the number listed and explained that I  was asked to call regarding my order (#19 placed 5-3-19)  but twas told there is no record of it.  Yep, great customer service.

I called back I asked what were the specials I was placed on hold again, after about 5 min the girl finally came back to the phone I placed my order she told me we will get it to you when we can, after an hour passed we called back and were put on hold another women came to the phone and said the delivery driver was on her way. I waited another hour and forty minutes, no pizza I proceeded to call over and over again they would not answer the phone. The 2 women that I spoke to need to be fired I waited from 3 to 7 at night and needless to say I never received my pizza. This is truly bad business and very unprofessional. I will never eat at Dominos again if this is how you allow your employees to treat customers

He then proceeded to say that they were not taking orders at 10:30pm or later, but failed to relay that to me over the phone. Regardless it’s says they close at 11pm so why was my order not taken???

name: James Joyce
text: Though on the pricier side, Marco's is noticably better than other quick service pizza. This location is consistently great - accurate, fast, and not skimpy on toppings. I have to give credit to the owner, who I've spoken to once (on a Saturday, via his personal cell phone, of all things) after submitting some feedback about the corporate-run online ordering system. This person clearly cares about customer service and it's reflected in how well his franchise is run. My only complaint is they're not open later.

name: C J K
text: Sandwiches are decent. The elderly woman behind the counter in a small town counted out each pickle, 4 total, each piece of bell pepper, 4 little slivers, each jalapeño, 4 total, etc....on a foot long. For an $8 sandwich, Subway, quit counting and skimping on the cheap stuff, meats I can understand using the measured amount but I feel very confident that your bulk oder veggies come with a pretty hefty discount, so why count. I go to Publix for sandwiches now anytime I can because their sandwiches are better and they have no problem loading you down with a salad on your sandwich if that's what you want, pretty much the same price too. Obviously a way better meat selection too.....I know I'm not comparing apples to apples there, just stating a fact though.q

name: Moonstar79
text:
Everyone knows about Subway. Everyone understands what they're getting when they walk into the building. The customer service is generally sub-par, although once in a blue moon you'll get a duo that work together quite well. Again, though, this is rare, and the usual default is that one person behind the counter does all the work while the other takes perpetual breaks, as is the case in my local Subway. The food itself is actually not bad, as long as your cravings are in stock (and they often might not be). On the upside, it's usually a very relaxed environment with no rush on your order. On the downside, can you say cross-contamination? But don't like my experience affect yours. Perhaps you'll come out having rung the Perfect Bell.
Or perhaps not.

text: My husband and I got the rotisserie chicken and by time we drove not even a 2 minute drive home, both of our sandwiches were soggy and the meat was ice cold and wet! Never really cared for this place they’re always understaffed and slow. This will be our last time eating here.

name: Anna Gleason
text: Had a low to mediocre experience here. Friendly workers, but the guy who made my food forgot to put my cookie I paid for in the bag and then the food was undercooked and made me sick. I think he was new and like I said he was friendly but needs improvement.

name: Rodney Patton
text:
I was visiting family in the area today and stopped by this subway for the first time.   When I walked in, there was a semi long line.  I was about to turn around and go somewhere else until I noticed the young man behind the counter. He was the only employee in the building from what I could tell.  He is probably a manager. Maybe not but he seemed to be by the way he was carrying himself. If he is not he should at least be considered for a management position.
He was moving as fast as he could.  More importantly, (and the reason why I decided to stay and wait in line) he was having a great time talking to the customers and didn't seem to be discouraged by his circumstances.  Customers were laughing and talking and actually ENJOYING their time WAITING in line.   I've owned and sold customer service and hospitality related  companies before and you do not typically see customers that enjoy waiting. For any amount if time or for any thing   This young man, Steven or Steve, is the reason why I stayed.   I enjoyed my conversation with him and my time in line as well. As a former/semi retired franchisee, I can tell you, this employee will do great things for your company.
Everything was great on my visit. I even met some people in line who I would not have typically spoken to. All because if the atmosphere that was created by one employee.  Food was fresh and perfect.  I would recommend this subway over any others.

name: Robyn Counts
text: My husband and I went to eat here at 9:40pm tonight. My husband walked in first and the employee looked at him with a face of disgust. Like he didn't want another customer.  Then tell him they are out of bread?? Really? Every single kind of bread happens to be out. Lazy as he**. Then drive 10 minutes to the lakeshore Walmart to eat at that subway...but they closed at 10:04 instead of 10:30. I'm beginning to think all Subways have lazy employees.

text: Honestly I gave a 3 star solely because of the food. It's a good sandwich if you are in a bind and want to be filled with natural cut meats and cheeses but the customer service bites the big one. Everytime I call I get some boo boo Felicia that acts as though I'm inconveniencing her. They interrupt, are rude and really just don't seem to care about you at all. I had to yell to make sure that she didn't hang up on me with her assumption as to my address, phone number or method of pay. Seriously disappointed with this location in Mobile, AL.

text:
Clean, nice restaurant. Each item  is very flavorful! Bold and unique.
The lobster bisque is fantastic.
I had half a turkey avocado sandwich and the Greek salad. Alone, they are great, but together they did not compliment one another. Just be a little cautious in paring items.

text: Better then McAllister, wish I would have been sooner. Better service and establishment.

name: Robert Larson
text: I finally decided to give this place a try and I'm glad I did. This is a really nice and cozy place to eat. It's extremely clean and the staff is friendly.  I tried one of their pizzas and it was pretty good. I also got my food pretty fast. They also have a complimentary section with jalapenos, pickles, cheese, and more. I will be coming back for sure.

text: Wonderful delicious food at a great price with a great staff

text: My loaded baked potatoe soup was good.  No complaints with staff, place was clean and plenty of space.

resp.text: We are happy to hear you had a positive experience at 5555 Whittlesey Blvd! We truly value your input.

name: Mariah Glass
text: Our 1st time there. I had planned to try a pizza per the good reviews but the seasonal French dip won me over. Very good, the meat was cut nice and thick. The Au jus sauce had a nice flavor. I had it as it comes with no substitutes, the flavors were good and hearty.  We also tried the club sandwich which I was told was very good also. Crab and lobster bisque was better than some I  had in Florida. Staff and management very friendly and hospitable. We dined around 7:30pm on a Sunday and the atmosphere was cozy and relaxed. We picked up some of their chicken salad and lobster bisque soup from the to go market section. Nice feature especially if you need to grab something quick.  Chicken salad has pecans, celery and grapes in it, tasty but I like a few more grapes myself 😊. Nice experience, will definitely return!

name: Walter Johnson
text: Solid service and a nice place for soup and salad

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: ASD Jules
text: Great menu! Nice atmosphere! There's so much to choose from on the menu, definitely something for everyone.

name: Billy Bob
text: I love their salads and I used to get the Raspberry Vinaigrette dressing but for no apparent reason, they stopped having it as an option. Please bring back the dressing, it's my favorite. - Thanks

name: Jessica Andersen
text: came here on a friday i think. looking forward to a return visit. prices were decent.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Denise Ruiz
text:
Ok. So we have been waiting for a long time to try this place out since we didn't want to drive to Auburn to try that one.
First walk in it is very impressive and a very nice re do on the Atlanta Bread Co layout.  Friendly staff and very fast service from the time you order. We arrived at 11 right when they opened since it has been very busy but from the moment you go inside, the order counter is right in the doorway which doesn't allow much space to wait to place your order.
The soups are to die for and the salad was amazing. The pesto chicken sandwich was a bit much for my liking . It had too much pesto and almost no chicken.
The only main thing why I couldn't give it 5 stars was the fact that like every 2 minutes Andrew was coming by talking to us. I mean , ok, maybe we are more introverted than most but come on, we couldn't take a bite and here he was back again talking to us and trying to clear our plates. We joked about the next time we would go back we would get our food to go so we could enjoy it.
The kids got a pizza which OMG was sooooo good . Couldn't understand what the big deal was to just put pepperoni on half but no big deal really.
We def wanna go back and try other items on the menu for sure.

name: Lesa Monk
text: I LOVE the place.  The Tortilla soup is great!  And the Caesar salad was wonderful.  Try the pizza, crust is great.

name: Cherokee Bailey
text: My husband and I had a great time eating here.  The food is very good and even the new service since Covid19 came out was good.  The new atmosphere in the restaurant was very friendly and we had a great time.  He has pizza, and I had the mac and cheese  and we share the salad, our favorite salad is the black and blue.  We love blue cheese dressing. Lol. The roast beef is very good in the salad though.  They have a variety of food and so far all food we have had there, has been to die for. ..haha  my husband and I have found out that it's steak slices and not roast beef in the black and blue salad...

resp.text: We really appreciate your thoughts and feedback and look forward to continuing to service you as a customer!

name: Linda Churlin
text: Ok food is always good

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback! We truly value your input.

name: Becky Culberson
text: Super tasty and clean. Staff was great will be going back

name: Kevin Ray
text: Fresh, good food. Amazing staff with southern charm.

name: Kevin Ray
text: Fresh, good food. Amazing staff with southern charm.

name: Inja Gordon
text:
The direction in coming into this establishment is not a "good flow"... I didn't see anyone at EITHER cash register so as I went to take my mother to the restroom I came back up and asked where do I place my order order as there still wasn't anyone present at any register. I went to the front with one of the ladies. I asked her about her suggestions and I order d a sandwich based on it with a fruit cup for my mother. I ordered a veggie pizza with no artichokes, no olives, no goat cheese and no basil garnish with a large bottle of Acqua Panna spring water. Whwn was all said and done we BOTH went through the order THREE times but there were STILL a few discrepancies. I was never offered a bottle opened for a NONscrew top so as the lady looked at me struggling thinking why would they give nonscrew top without offering to open it? I walked up and a male came to me and asked me did I need help? The same lady who took my order then came by me and asked me did I need help and I told her this was not a screw off top and sarcastically said that was I supposed to open this with my teeth. She just walked away. The guy said sorry about that and opened it. Sat down and soon after the food was brought to us by the same girl and I noticed my mother was looking extra hard at the fruit cup. I asked her what was wrong and she didn't want it... I asked her was everything okay until I saw the hair on the fruit. Totally disgusted I took it up to he kitchen and told the same girl who seemed to dismiss that there was hair on the fruit and said would you like chips instead. I got my mother her chips (at least I know that we had a better chance of it being sanitary since it was in a bag). When I finally was about to eat my pizza that was clearly on the burnt side I noticed that there was an ingredient that I specifically asked NOT to have on my pizza that was still put on my pizza. Side note my mother said the turkey sandwich was not that bad. When I came in here there was one couple and one last sitting by herself. There is no reason why this place was not spotless, better service and customer care. Future reference if you want to have a successful business the following is crucial: good customer service, CLEANLINESS, attentiveness. I will not come back. Please check your food and proceed with caution.

UPDATE: I spoke with CURT(IS) and explained the whole situation. He was extremely receptive and apologetic. He also offered to reimburse me but I refused stating that maybe he could provide a free meal to someone else. Hopefully, he can get some of his staff retrained and to standard.

name: joe johnson
text: Food was good but stuff was very unprofessional. We were sitting by the drinks and staff was drinking in front of drink machines. A waitress was cleaning up the drink area while coughing all over and talking about getting off work. This will be my last time coming here for sure

resp.text: We are sorry to hear this. Our number one priority is the guest and their visit. We will let our management team know so we can fix this. Thank you.

name: Debbie McMillan
text: Food was great and fast service!

resp.text: We are happy to hear you had a positive experience at 5555 Whittlesey Blvd! We truly value your input.

name: Taysha BG
text: Yes please so good

name: shannon pittman
text: So good, everytime! My friend ordered no tomato, but her sandwich had tomatoes..... other than everything was great! My go to order is a half grilled chicken sandwich with soup. The staff was good, nothing above and beyond, but nothing terrible. The restaurant was clean and the pizza looked amazing!

name: La Shanda Hill
text: I was shocked to see it open for dine in service when so many other restaurants are offering only take-out.  There was even a large group celebrating a birthday.  If they are going to continue with offering dining in then it is time to have hand sanitizer at the door and at the register.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!
