text: Food was ok but nothing special..Staff seemed to be more interested in each other than the customers. 2nd time at a Newks establishment and I doubt there will be a 3rd.

text: The lady at the front desk was so rude. I promise this is my first time in this place and the very last.

resp.text: We apologize for the inconvenience and difficulty you experienced here. We promise it will not happen again and we will take extra care to resolve your situation.

name: Terri 68
text: The lady at the front desk was so rude. I promise this is my first time in this place and the very last.

resp.text: We apologize for the inconvenience and difficulty you experienced here. We promise it will not happen again and we will take extra care to resolve your situation.

text: Good casual place to eat. They also have a great selection.  I always get the half and half. This allows you to try more than one item for under $10.

text: I had the Chicken Club (no bacon) & Caesar Salad. It was $10.25. The sandwich was pretty good. It was very small. If they gave you a little more food it would be perfect.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Sally Moore
text: Food was good. Pricey for amt you get. Side of pasta salad-maybe 2 tablespoons. Grilled steak sand skimpy on steak for $9. But like the guy said, "free" bread sticks. Honestly, not worth the $24 for lunch for 2 people!

name: Danielle Sanders
text: Love the avacado shrimp salad !!! Friendly staff and clean place !!

name: Linda Martin
text: Service with a Smile.  Nice & personal.  If you have a Q - answered politely & all have great attitude.  Clean bathroom.  Always enjoy my food & will continue eating there with family & friends.

name: SnailLord
text: Went here yesterday and I’m 100% sure the cashier was high. He stared at the screen blankly for quite some time, asked us what we ordered multiple times then went back to staring at the screen. He then said our order back to us about five times over, and even then he got the entire order wrong. The whole ordering process lasted at least five minutes for a simple order of Mac and cheese with a salad. We stood there correcting him time and time again while a line formed behind us waiting for their turn. I couldn’t even get a good look at this guy’s face because his hat was pulled so far down to hide it. I used to really like going here, but if that guy is the cashier again I will not be coming back.

name: Miranda Dennis
text: We haven’t ate here since it was closed due to the virus and we picked up food today and I am really disappointed. We ordered my son the kids Mac and cheese and the container was not even 1/3 full of macaroni. He could’ve ate it in a few bites. Waste of money! I don’t think we are going to frequent this restaurant anymore.

name: Dennis Moore
text: Roast beef sandwich is very good. Although advertised as medium rare,  it was overdone. Also, a couple spots where there wasn't any meat. I had to open it up and rearrange it which left a thin covering. The sides seem a little small for the price.  All that said. It was still very good and we will return again and again. Friendly staff and clean environment. Job well done

name: steven howard
text: Very good food

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Ron Thomas
text: Salad was great very fast and prepared well.

name: cindi greer
text: Clean and my salad was awesome!! Staff super friendly. Got our food fast . I'll be going back

name: Autumn MoonPetal
text: I love the casual environment, it doesnt feel weird to come to eat alone. The food is Great! My favorite so far is the Spicy Shrimp Pizza!

name: Powell Smith
text: We really enjoy this place for their pick two combos. My wife gets the soup and salad and I get the soup and sandwich. The tomato basil soup and the half roast beef sandwich are great! Servings are large so get the cup of soup and half salad/sandwich unless you are sharing or just incredibly hungry. Prices seem a little high until you taste the quality and see the serving sizes!

name: Roger Garms
text: Good food selections and very tasty. Best bread & butter pickles I've ever tasted.

name: Gabriel Smith
text: Great sandwiches, split the Italian and the chicken salad with my wife. Both top notch.

name: NICOLE TORRANCE
text: First time eating here. Went with family. Food was EXCELLENT!!! Will go back again mos def ❤

name: Miriam Eve Tidwell
text:
The food is different from most fast food places. The meals taste home made. You can taste the ingredients.
Every person that worked there was smiling and helpful. You don't clear your own plates up.
Salads are huge. Ask up front for less arugula. We had the shrimp and avocado salad. Lots of shrimp and a huge portion of avocados. We also had the chicken soup. Had an eastern flavor.  The Cesar salad was full of ingredients. And they have a table with all kinds of extras like pickles and croutons, watermelon rinds, oinions etc...
Pizza may just be the best I have ever had.
I had the Margarita and my husband had the Mediterranean with chicken. The flavors were perfect together.
Last we tried the rich and creamy lobster bisk. Pow we were stuffed!
This my folks, will require many do overs!

name: joe johnson
text: Food was good but stuff was very unprofessional. We were sitting by the drinks and staff was drinking in front of drink machines. A waitress was cleaning up the drink area while coughing all over and talking about getting off work. This will be my last time coming here for sure

resp.text: We are sorry to hear this. Our number one priority is the guest and their visit. We will let our management team know so we can fix this. Thank you.

name: Tawya Thomas
text: I would like to know how did the staff get so friendly. That is definitely a plus. It is pretty busy today however everything is moving very quickly. Greeted me with a smile and took my order with ease. Restaurant looks absolutely amazing. The food was delicious. The macaroni and cheese was so creamy and cheesy what a little twist. Everything is going great. The sandwich was fresh the ingredients to Fresh every taste complimented each other. Thank you so much for my experience. I'm glad that you are here.

resp.text: Hi Tawya! Thank you very much for your wonderful review! We work really hard to offer the best food in a welcoming environment. Hope to see you again soon !

name: Shanon Collum
text: Awesome food and staff

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Shaina Merine
text: Always good!  I love their salads especially the Chicken Caesar salad.  The club sandwich and broccoli cheddar soup is great too!  And dont forget a slice of cake!  Both the strawberry and caramel cakes are delicious!  Never a bad experience and I've ordered from here too many times to count!

name: Dottie Adams
text: A few years ago while my husband was in med school, Newks was a go-to location for his study spot. I ate many a meal there while he studied with his classmates in the evening. Ever since then, I've been hooked and was happy when this Columbus location opened. The staff there do work really hard to provide a nice experience. I'd recommend trying the Ultimate salad or the Spicy Shrimp Pizza. Both are great! Lunch does get busy, but evenings are a bit quieter. Overall a nice place to grab a quick meal or a great place to hang out for a bit.

name: Emily Culpepper
text: I work here and I love it. I love some of the customers and all the employees. Its a great place to visit and eat every once in a while. Its expensive

name: Amy Sibley
text: Delicious sandwiches, soups, pizzas. Great for quick bite, families, or lunch meeting.

name: Cindy Lehman Dunning
text: Love the loaded potato soup!!

name: Lorraine Brown
text:
Good place for a delicious yet healthy lunch. Soups, salads, sandwiches are all fresh.
Quiet enough to read the paper. Tables well spaced so that a small gathering of friends would not feel claustrophobic.

name: Jill Welch
text: The steak soup was good. Roast beef sandwich was just so dry, with no mayo or spreads available to put on it. Management not knowledgeable about the food (I asked about the lower calorie options on the outside menu) and did not offer to find out. My friends liked their pizzas. Not worth going back for me.

name: Reynolds Cheney
text: Excellent food served quickly. Great place to grab a quick bite for lunch.

name: Greg Comiskey
text: Good food, service, and very clean. Love it!

name: Lizzy H.
text: I came here on a date with my boyfriend. Everyone was very nice, but when we got in out 4 cheese pizza, it was very greasy and messed with both of our stomachs. We decided that this was because it was the first thing we ate that day and got a to go box. IT LITERALLY WAS SO GREASY THAT IT SOAKED THROUGH THE BOX. Don’t get the pizza from here. I did go back and get a sandwich from this place later and it was good, so that’s why I gave it three stars.

name: Rachal Nocchi
text: Very nice place to eat, good food.

name: charles jones
text: The Eatery was nice, with a great selection of food, the staff was very friendly. Will be recommending to others.

name: Terry Reis
text: French dip was really good with tender roast beef and fresh bread.

name: Mrs. D
text: First impression walking in was great. Newk's has a cute and welcoming feel about it. It also was nice and clean. We went at lunch time on Wednesday and there was no wait. The employee who took our order was very friendly and our food we delicious! The only down fall was it was a little pricy but worth it.

resp.text: Awesome!  So glad we knocked it out of the park for you.  Feels great to hear this feedback.  Thanks for sharing & keep the positive vibes coming!

name: Hardik Hardiya
text: Pizza is good especially it's thin-crust all the veggie's are cooked well but please give us  more option's on vegetarian side.

name: Beth Heindel

name: Matthew Gerheart

name: Anthony Nocchi
text: My son loves this place. Food was pretty good and received fast. Good selection of sandwhiches, salads, and pizzas; however, limited selection outside of those items.

name: William Medaris
text: All i can say is, YUMMY!  Wish they'd bring back a few items.  Such as the chimichurri steak sandwich.

name: Ashley Stow

name: Abby R

I would like to say thanks for a great experience. I'm glad that you're here, and i would also like to give a big shutout to the young lady that waited on my family and I. Thanks Tammy Beck for such great hospitality and politeness, your service was the best and Newks will go places with you.

I like the "Roundtable" and all the goodies on there. This is a great addition to the Columbus restaurant screen. I highly recommend it.

name: Kimberlee Metcalfe
text: Very friendly personnel, very clean and the atmosphere was inviting. The food was AMAZING! I had a turkey and avacado sandwich with a side caesar salad. So good!!

name: David Hehman
text: We all had something different and everyone said theirs was delicious. I had the chicken salad on wheat and it was great. Grab some of the roasted garlic and fire and ice pickles from the condiment station. Yum.

name: Cheryl Whaley

name: James Wisdom

name: Kevin Bullock

name: Kimberlee Metcalfe

resp.text: Hi Katelyn ! Thank you very much for your wonderful review! We work really hard to offer the best food in a welcoming environment. Hope to see you again soon !

name: AshZy (Sernethia C)

name: Deborah Wood
text: Great place, go probably once a week. Service is always outstanding. I figure I will try everything soon. But the Newks q has me hooked

name: James Foster

name: Victoria Wiese
text: Food was delicious,  arrived quickly at our table. Line at the front moved quickly, and staff was professional and polite! Will definitely be coming back!

name: Nancy Loofboro
text: Most Tables cleared but not wiped off.  I was there 45 mins. Finally someone started wiping the tables off.  Had a chicken salad sandwich was too dry.

name: Ricardo Aikens
text: We love this restaurant’s atmosphere, meals & drinks! The staff are warm welcoming & professional! #delicious

name: Vee Bee
text:
Food was horrible, with a bad presentation. The tomato soup tasted as though it was rewarmed with lots of grease floating in it. The pizza was nothing like all of the other Newk's in the Atlanta areas. It was thin, and somewhere between warm and cool although we waited 20 minutes while they 'made' it.
Called to complain the same night, rude young folks literally playing on the phone. I asked for a manager from the start, and got one after repeating myself for approximately 8 minutes. He too was young and offered a poor excuse for the food, particularly the soup. He said that it probably had been out too long. Smh
He offered a credit for the soup that we never picked up.
We swear by Newk's in Dunwoody, and Newnan, GA, but this one in our home town will  NEVER get our business again. They have improvement to do!

name: Mattie East
text: Service was super friendly.  Food was very delicious, and I really enjoyed the fact that you can see the kitchen and how clean it is

name: debra ann williams
text: Very delicious, clean and polite service.  Fresh food!

name: David Hehman
text: We all had something different and everyone said theirs was delicious. I had the chicken salad on wheat and it was great. Grab some of the roasted garlic and fire and ice pickles from the condiment station. Yum.

name: D F
text: Where do I start? Food is great. Everything else is sub par.

name: Jon Preston
text: Great first time experience. Loved the round table and the helpfulness of the food expo/servers

name: will compton
text:
I am not one to usually care to write reviews, good or bad, but I felt that this one deserved it:

Tonight I ordered a meal from from Newks Eatery here in Columbus through the app Waitr (DO NOT EVER USE THIS APP THEY ARE HORRIBLE). Everything went smoothly until when I received my order, I realized that two things that I had purchased were missing from my bag. I was frustrated to say the least, so I called the restaurant to have the problem fixed.

I won't go into every little detail about the mess of what happened afterwards with Waitr, but I did want to give a shout out to the manager from Newks, Kayla, that helped me throughout the whole process. She really went above and beyond. Not only did she refund the money for the desserts, she also got a waitr driver back out to her restaurant,  even stayed late after they closed waiting on the driver to pick them up, and also included in an extra half sandwich for my troubles. She promptly called me back every time she had an update, answered my call every time I called, and handled to situation in the most professional and savvy way. She was the only person that saved the day and saved this situation from being an absolute disaster. THANK YOU KAYLA!!!

On a side note - Waitr is the worst, most poorly managed food delivery service company, and really service company in general, that I have ever used. They were the real problem in this whole situation and were basically running around with their heads cut off. Not to mention, this same situation had happened to me before while using the waitr app, this one just happen to top them all and be worse than anytime before. but again KAYLA SAVED THE DAY!

text:
I dined in Friday and Sunday. Friday night was awful. I waited hours for my pizza. I was angry and hungry. The store looked horrible. I had no idea what was on the round table or what it was until a dread headed server told me while finally serving my food after hours. She was the nicest person I had spoken to at Newks. Sunday was much better. I was greeted very nicely at the door so much enthusiasm especially for the morning time. Some of the servers looked very rude and like they had attitudes when you ask for anything. I luckily got the dread head server again whom remembered me from friday. She greeted us with a smile which was very warming, she is very sweet. Welcomed me back and served my food. Instead of pointing at the round table like the other server did when I asked a question she told me where I could find it and offered to bring it to me. Today the food was much better and out faster. But you really need to fix your servers attitudes and their conversations. One server smelt of marijuana and the to go area two ladies where complaining about customers all morning. I wanted to move away from that area. If you don't like your job quit! The dread head server is also very hot and looks very in shape :)

name: Gwendolyn Thomas
text: I frequent other Newks and have never had an issue before and if I did, it was handled professionally and with care. Today, I decided to try the one in Columbus, Georgia; well, the cashier was very friendly and very nice to me. I ordered two soups and only received one soup as I didn’t pay attention to my receipt as my total is usually the same every time I go. I alerted the young lady who brought my food to go to me. She got a supervisor or someone in charge to tell her my issue. She was very unprofessional telling me my soup was not free and I would have to pay for it! I then explained to her that I worked daily and can pay for my soup and I didn’t ask for you all to give me the soup for free! I simply asked to fix another one. When she saw I was then frustrated, she tried to “clean it up”! No ma’am! Too late! And to make matters worse, once I drove home, I opened my soup and realized I was given less than half of the soup; which by the way was $3.99! I called the manager Sam and he did not seem to care about my issue all he kept saying was uh huh ok. No, sir! Then, I had to ask him what he was going to do about this to make sure it didn’t happen again and they needed to replace my soup! Overall, I’m very dissatisfied and will continue frequenting the Newks in Newnan where they seem to care about their customers more!! People work hard for their money and expect to be treated kindly!

text:
I was at the Florala Subway today and ask the girl that was going to prepare me a meal to were a mask. She refused and started yelling at me inside the store.

Alabama Governor Kay Ivy has made it mandatory that everyone wears a mask because of COVID 19 spreading.

Where is Subway management in inforcing health rules? What happened to the customer is always right?  I'm sure the sales of this store is underperforming because of its staff.

I am a two-time stage, 4 cancer survivors and I will not put my life at risk. This girl has no clue who her customers are and what kind of health issues they are dealing with.  Staff and management do not care about their customers. Mater of fact the girl screamed that out at me as I walked out of the store.

Avoid this COVID 19 spreading store.

The person waiting on me seemed put out anyone was even there, I was the only one in line.  I ask it toasted, which seemed to only make it worse.  My bread was stale, she forgot the Mayo so it was dry, but the worse part she wasn't wearing a mask even though others in the store were and half way through finishing it she rang me up and then went back to finishing my sandwich and handling everything never changing gloves.   Yuck.   I couldn't  bring myself to eat it.  I managed to choke a bite down.   But just couldn't keep going.  Next time I'll just go to Hardee's.

text: Traveling on I-85 and remembered eating at this Newk's in the past. So called and placed a ToGo order. Order was ready as promised when I went to pick it up. Staff super friendly and food was great. Will definitely return.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: George Martin
text:
Extremely disappointed and uncomfortable.. Visited Newks for the first time on Sunday between 3 and 4 pm. It was empty. Took a while before we were helped. My wife and I both ordered a sandwich and soup. We noticed almost every table had trash and food. I don't mean that in a "every table - but really like 2", I mean well over a dozen at least.. The hostess said, "sorry about the mess, I haven't gotten around to it". We sat outside and it was a disaster. I mean, I've actually never seen something so bad. We were there for over an hour and the hostess never moved. She sat on her phone and never cleaned a single table. The iced tea was not good and I was concerned about sanitation honestly.. I don't think the dispenser has ever been cleaned and I felt like drinking it might make me sick. It tasted off. The chicken salad sandwich was disappointing and the bread was very tough to bite into. The lobster bisque that I was looking forward too must have come pre-made and frozen. All I could taste was cheese. Plastic utensils and 1 napkin each, but I let that pass because it may be a COVID restriction. We had to go and ask for the bill and when I said thank you to the 3 staff working, they just looked at me with dead expressions...

I'm not sure if this is normal or if this is how things run when management isn't around and just young employees are there, but I was actually appalled. Mind you, the state of the restaurant didn't bother me at first - perhaps they were swamped before we got there, but over an hour went by, with us as THE ONLY people there, and they never busted a single table. I did not take a picture because I didn't want to scare people away, but wow... I mean, wow... I only ate half my sandwich because I felt so uncomfortable with the sanitary conditions.

name: Debbie Hodge
text: I had the Newk's Special Salad. It was fresh and very good. It had a special dressing and a variety things on the lettuce- artichokes, grapes, blue cheese, nuts and other good things. I eat at Newk's often and I also like the shrimp and avacado salad.

text: Went in store at 6:30pm. No one at floor except girl cleaning. All waiters standing around. I had to ask if open shook head yes. Same person came to register I asked if pizza good shook head yes. I asked if she could talk she said yes'm. So I decided if they didnt want my business I left. I am not from there so I will not be going back.

text: The food was awful and extremely overpriced. Friendly and courteous staff got it two stars.

name: Faye Haag
text: At the Opelika location last night, I  ordered a Margherita pizza. A friend had eaten one there and sent a picture-- looked great. My pizza came with Very Little mozzarella and NO Basil. When I  sent it back, it was returned with a few sprigs of parsley ( I know the difference) and no cheese.  My husband and I  had just left a medical clinic where we had been for a couple of hours. I was tired and hungry and frankly did not want to be That Customer!  Please don't let your kitchen send food out to customers like this! Don't want free food! Just want what's on your menu!

text: We always enjoy the food. I was really happy with how they are being careful and proactive about keeping things sanitary, clean, and you at peace about not being concerned with anything. They are doing a great job with how they're handling this outbreak.

name: Paula Newton
text: The food was great! But the bathroom floor and toilet are disgusting. I was here two weeks ago and thought they had been busy and not able to attend to it. But I don’t guess that was the case. Same disgusting mess as two weeks ago.

name: Jim Napier
text: Food was perfect. Manager was great.clean. love the salad bar extras.

name: Duane Brown
text: Disappointed this time. Had the caesar salad with seasoned shrimp. Not as good as it used to be.

name: Suzanne Woodall
text: Can't get a better salad anywhere so far. I've looked. Sometimes they are overdressed so I order dressing on the side. I've been to this newks many times (maybe 20) and the salads are consistent. Sandwiches are meh and leave much to be desired. They are mostly bread and little fillings. Soups are OK. I would never order another pizza. We ordered a pizza once with chicken and when we told an employee that the chicken tasted like jerky her reply was "yeah, we don't sell a lot of pizza with chicken because it is really dried out." I had to insist that the uneaten  pizza be removed from our ticket. My kids really enjoy the kids meals. Service is lacking most of the time and the restrooms are nasty more than not. All in all if you want a great salad and maybe an ok cup of soup on a cold day- this is your place. Last time I was there I paid $10 for a half a salad and a bowl of soup with a water. My friend paid $12 for half a sandwich a cup of soup and a tea.

name: Kevin Kinsey
text:
Disappointing. Plain and simple.  Newks is one of our favorite stops foe grabbing lunch but tonight was our first time doing take out and it was not so good.

Ordered two items:

Black and Bleu salad and my wife said it was great.  Fresh. Etc.

Southern Salad (mine) appeared old.  I say this because the lettuce was wilted and dominated by stems.  Had to pick through it to remove all of the 'unsavory' parts. Purple onion was so thickly cut we had to rechop it, etc.

I hope this is not the norm as I can go down the street next time if I want chicken salad and I know it will be fresh and good.

name: Christie Ray
text: Love the food at Newk’s but am starting to be concerned about the cleanliness. Visited at 3:45 on a Saturday. There were 3 occupied tables hardly anywhere to sit. More than half the empty tables had plates/bowls/trash still left on them. The tables that were clear had trash and such in the seats or were sticky. Several employees were congregated at the front, chatting. The bathrooms are disgusting and need a deep clean.  If they don’t clean the rest of the restaurant, I worry the kitchen is not getting cleaned either.

name: Donald Autery
text: Fruit bowl had a hair in it and the rice krispy treat looked as though it had been bitten. Horrible quality control all around. I will stick with the Newks in Newnan.

name: Steven Bulin
text: It tastes good, don't get me wrong. The menu isn't as diverse as I would like it to be, and there aren't a lot of options. Also, good luck finding a salt shaker.

text: Newk Q sandwich is awesome!

name: Stacey Ernstberger
text: Love the food here, but the service needs a bit of work. The cashier was not helpful at all, and got confused at simple questions  - additionally she didn't seem to understand the menu. Her attitude was enough that we almost left. However, the food was great and the server had a very good attitude.

name: Trudy Morgan
text: The cashier tried to be nice but he needed help with the register and called for the manager. She proceeded tell me what I couldn't order, then told me what I could.  I informed her I ordered what was allowed in the first place. I asked for no tomatoes, no mayo and extra mustard. My sandwich had tomatoes and mustard was dripping everywhere. I've received much better food and service in Atlanta.

name: Joseph Rice
text:
I really enjoy the black and bleu salad. Good amount of steak for the price and the salad portion is very fresh.

Today I also got the 6 cheese pimiento mac and cheese as a side. It was 5.99 but it was barely a cup of food. This price is a rip-off for the amount of food. It was delicious but not worth that price.

Additionally I have been to this location twice and each time the person taking the order has been sullen and not welcoming. I think it was the same person both times. A smile and a greeting would be nice customer service.

I could go on
Should've made a video but waited to receive my order.

text: Not a bad place to get a good sandwich over lunch time. Here's a little tip if you get there during a crowded time, Waltz on over to the take-out line and place your order there, and just tell them that you are dining in. I have saved myself many hours it seems over the past few years by doing that little trick. May I suggest the Royal Sandwich with banana peppers. That is my favorite. Overall I find the food very good but for the cost of a sandwich and drink it is a little pricey for this area. If you just looking for a sandwich and a drink you can go to Jersey Mike's or Subway or Which Wich and get a good sandwich, chips and drink for more reasonable price, but don't short Change yourself you have got to try this place

name: Kay Woods
text: The base of the fruit bowls are way too bland. It taste like water with no flavor. It has me questioning there food integrity. Do they use real fruit ? I suggest Juice Bar

resp.text: Hey Kay, I am so sorry your meal was disappointing. We have amazing employees and they make fresh bases daily using only real fruit. We add no artificial juices or sweeteners, because we believe fresh fruit is tasty all on its own. We also make the bases up front if you ever want to see our process in action. And thank you for mentioning The Juice Bar, we also love them. We are proud to support our fellow businesses here in Auburn and especially locally owned restaurants who share our mission of serving the Auburn community fresh, heart healthy fruit. Thanks for the feedback and thank you for dropping by.

name: Levi Ponder
text: Super friendly staff! Awesome location - free parking in the West  & Wright parking deck is so convenient. I had one of their smoothies and and it was super yummy and fresh!! No other smoothie place compares!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Keith Milligan
text: Always love Frutta Bowls, but seriously, it’s football game day and Frutta Bowl is closed and it’s still an hour and a half until game time. It may be a good time to examine special hours on game days and take advantage of the extra crowd. I just witnessed three more people go up to the door and try to pull it open while I was typing this. Regardless, I’ll try again next time. It’s really good.

resp.text:
Hey Keith. So sorry for the inconvenience. One of our biggest challenges has been figuring out hours that work on game day. Today, from 4:00 until you tried to come in, we literally had only one customer.
Please have a bowl on us next time you come in. Show this message at the register. We really appreciate your business and feedback.

name: Born in the 70’s Peace

resp.text: 🤗 thank you!

text: My FAVORITE, healthy snack stop. Super filling & really yummy. My only complaint is the prices.

resp.text: Thanks Caroline! So glad you love us! Have you tried our combo pick 2 deal? You get two items for $11. Hopefully that might help with the price point and you get more food. :)

resp.text: Thank you Natalie! Now you need to move here :)

text: I think Frutta bowls is the best place in AL for Acai. Their granola & fruit toppings are great. Something about the acai base is kinda off. It doesn’t stay frozen as long as it should.

resp.text: Thanks for coming to see us. Our açaí base is only the açaí berry mixed with bananas. Our base recipe is supposed to be smooth/creamy. You might could try putting your bowl in the freezer at home for a little while if you like it frozen. Again, thanks for trying us!

name: Scott Beard
text: The staff at this Taco Bell is the friendliest you will ever meet. Just a short drive fr our house, we open swing through for a change of pace as we are always on the go. This staff always is so friendly, funny and talkative. They make the drive through experience enjoyable - and that's hard work!!

name: April East
text: Best Taco Bell I have ever been to. All of the food was good. All of the employees were nice and had very good customer service skills. Would definitely recommend this Taco Bell to anyone.

name: Craig Winn
text: New and neat. Great outdoor eating area. Service is a little slow on the inside but Drive Thru is speedy.

Hope this place will stay this way.

In fact the only reason it was wrong at all was because they gave me extra as a gift! Great taco bell, just wished the inside was opened longer.

name: Jason Azbell
text:
The sandwiches and tenders were good.  The cashier was nice.  The new promo sweet potato waffle fries tasted good but were cold. Offer for Sundays... kids receive free kids meal with adult combo.  We ordered two adult combos and one child's meal.  After we sat down, I noticed that they didn't honor their own special and charged me for the kids meal.

The kids meal included bottled water as a choice. I had to ask for the bottled water because they were preparing us tap water.  The kids meal side choice of applesauce was rung up correctly, but they gave us curly fries.  We ordered a Dr. Pepper for one adult drink, and it was rung up correctly.  They gave us water instead.  They did refund me $3 cash for the $2.99 kids meal.  I guess I donated the 27 or 30 cents tax.  Not sure.

text: I'm not sure what the problem currently is with the roast beef but the last few times I've ordered the beef and cheddar it's been a thick, miscut mess! Once it was just a roast beef (no cheddar) but still a horrible cut of meat that I had to throw away. The texture was rough and unpalatable. My order tonight was also thick and nowhere near the pleasant thin roast beef that I expect to get from Arby's. I'm at the point of not going to Arby's again because I'm tired of wasting my money on a less than eatable product. My husband has already washed his hands of them because of wrong orders at the drive thru. Who wants to drive all the way back to the restaurant to complain when you're already at home and tired? I don't and of course restaurants know this! Doubt seriously if I'll be back any time soon! Or maybe ever!

name: David Cagle
text:
As always, the food and service as well as the workers were great.  The workers were attentive and friendly as well as knowledgeable.  I've heard a lot of bad things about this Arby's, but even though there are times that that workers are possibly not "wonderful", I dare say that people who write bad reviews likely have more "bad" days than most others. That's why they have nothing positive to say about people who are new to the job,  having problems of their own or don't like the job they're having to do because they can't get the job they want or are qualified for.
Then you have those who just totally enjoy berating others and the business they go to.  They're angry because all they could get was a roast beef sandwich when they wanted a ribeye steak or maybe a T Bone.  I'm sorry you're stuck in a place where you aren't happy with your lowly position and can't afford to go to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse or even get a sirloin or T Bone from Waffle House.  Get over it.  Work hard wherever you are and do the best job anyone has ever done and that will help you get a chance for a position you can work up to. And stop complaining about others. Try being positive for a change and see what a difference it makes in your life and your career.
I will definitely be going back to ARBY'S to eat.  And,  by the way, no  I don't have any affiliation with the company or any of the employees.

name: Shelaine Pickron
text:
There is a young lady named Shay that works to drive through no. It is amazing I'm helping me order I wanted a Coke Icee and all they had was a strawberry and blue raspberry. Who recommended the strawberry was I was getting for someone else. And they absolutely loved it. She Calmed me down took me out of my anxiety into a calm peaceful place.
Thank you Shay.. God bless. give that baby a raise.

name: Gladys Daniels
text:
I'm sorry this was not good and it's a new place. Taco Bell where is the meat ?? The only thing good was my niece's frozen wild strawberry lemonade..The food wasn't hot at all barely warm
.The servers were very friendly and polite ..We was asked to pull ahead and park in front for food order.

name: Becky Chaffin
text: I went through the drive thru and what rude service by someone named Carolyn, talking to other customer when she is waiting on you and also no receipt. Covid19 or not, rude is rude!

name: Billy Beal
text: The dining room is never open. Some people can’t fit through the drive through. Definitely losing business.

name: Madelyn
text: I’ve been disappointed by this location so many times throughout different times of the day. They just recently opened so usually places work hard so they can have a good reputation.. but not here. The employees don’t want to take the time to prepare certain foods. They are “out of” at least 2 or 3 basic things off the menu every time I go. They have never had cheesy fiesta potatoes out of all the times I’ve been. I have given them many chances because they are a convenient location but I will never bother again.

Taco Bell has limited hours at the Bond Blvd location...they should open it up and shut this one down.

name: Angela D
text: Getting your money's worth went out the door at this subway.. My steak sandwich had not a heaping scoop like other subway sandwich shops and the order taker had the nerve to level out the meat on the scoop.  I believe what topped it all is the order taker made mention out loud that all they got was $2 each. Don't they get paid an hourly wage? And did she really deaerve a tip after she leveled my meat out instead of a heaping scoop. Big business really is gorging America because they can. Because there is no one to stand up against these franchises who want way more in money but do mot match the product. I am very disappointed in what I received today. I will not be going back anytime soon. I know my x comment wont matter. Subeay2will continue to find ways to cut back and get more of our monies. Thanks for a lousy lunch.

name: Cornelia Thrash
text:
Boi did I have to work for this food! 3 times I ordered the fried fish and shrimp and 3 times they brought out a partial order! I must say, "They weren't even worth the wait! The only seasoning I could taste was the pepper. The onion rings were free due to the constant order mix-up. I'm glad cause if I had paid for them the level of disappointment would have been overwhelming. They are the low quality frozen onion rings that has the very thin supposedly sliced onion that has no onion flavor that's breaded in breading that has no flavor! I also ordered the crawfish that's boil-in-bag with potatoes,  sausage,  and corn. I imagine it would have tasted alright if I could have eaten it! There was so much grease in the bag and on the food I was afraid to try it! I don't know if the grease came from the cheap sausage that was included or if they added margarine thinking that would add flavor. The corn literally had to be rung out with paper towels before it was edible!
All-in-all the jewel in this experience was the waitress Ashanti! Her patience and her professionalism spoke volumes! Not once did she even sigh amidst the order mishaps. Thank you Ashanti! I only wish that all those who work in customer service had your attitude,  patience,  and humility!

resp.text:
Hi,Cornelia.
Thank you for your time to give us a feedback.

first of all,I’m glad you like Ashanti’s work! We’ll pass along the kind words.”

Secondly,I’m sorry your experience with us didn’t go well.

We use Conecuh original smoke sausage,I think it is pretty good quality and it’s local favorites.
And Our fried onion is one of our popular items ,that’s why we gave it on the house as we made a mistake on your foods. I’m sorry you didn’t like it.

Our seafood served in the bag,It’s kinda a trend in big cities like New York and Atlanta.I understand that some people not familiar with it,since it is different from local .

And also Our seafood boil is served with our house sauces,which contains butter,And they all taste great,It’s new and different from local ,but we have confidence that our seafood boil soon will become a favorite to the local.

name: Eric Richardson
text: We had fried oysters and calamari appetizers as well as steamed King crab and shrimp with corn, potatoes and sausage. The menu says steamed, which I usually equate with bland. Royals great seasonings and spices, however, make it more like the great boiled seafood South Louisiana is so famous for, and far from bland. We especially liked that Royal offers several different seasoning combinations levels as well as heat levels. It was all very fresh and delicious. Service was great -attentive but not bothersome. Very clean and spacious. I highly recommend Royal Seafood.

resp.text: We are grateful for your kind words and your time to leave us this amazing reviews,Thanks for sharing your review with us and the community.

name: Matt Simon
text: This is a hidden gem!! The food and service was great. If you are looking for great seafood, go here!!  Better than all the other places on Airport Blvd. (And better prices). We had a great mix of food and it was all great and cooked perfectly.

resp.text:
Thanks for leaving our business a 5-star rating, Matt. I’m glad that you had wonderful experience with us.

Your review,WAW! one of my favorites,it means a lot to our team,thank you so much,it’s truly appreciated!

Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us this amazing review.

You know for a long time I prayed for a Taco Bell to come to Randolph County.  Now we
have one, it has just continued to go downhill no matter how many times I give the Roanoke Taco Bell another chance!!  This time, like every one of the last three times I visited, the order was messed up!   This time I got what I ordered by name, but three little pieces of steak on the steak nachos and less than a half container of LIMP nacho fries and a reheated taco salad does NOT make a decent meal.  And yes, the line was moving like a snail...I thought maybe it was the guy up ahead ordering, but I am tired of making excuses for this Taco Bell!!!  Other Taco Bells don't have such crappy service and food!   Management,  if you are worth anything, figure out "who" the problems are and correct/fire them.  Here's a pic of the order of nacho fries, you be the judge...
Ps.  I'm the one that gave you a 4 Star rating right after you opened...smh.

name: Emory Daniel
text: It's just another taco bell nothing to really comment about. Fast food texmex not something I want to eat often but ok from time to time when I don't want a burger. The chain was better many years ago but has steadily declined in quality in recent years. If you want this style of food and have one available you I suggest Dell taco.

name: Sara Sampson
text: We only went through the drive through, but service was excellent and order was done to perfection.

name: Steven Stanfa
text: Great experience here with staff and the food. Everything was fresh. This isn't our local taco bell but we were passing through and stopped.

name: #jbr old school
text: Wish I could give -5 stars. Me and my wife and daughter just left from here. And my daughter Mexican pizza and hard shell tacos tasted funny so she asked me to try it. It was treble I got to looking and the shells had mold or something on them. And the pizza tasted even worse I couldn't find anything on them but will never be going back.

name: Callie Pursley
text: For and service was great tonight. Manager comped meal due to bad service in the previous week.

name: Holly Petty
text: I always stop here when I travel to Alabama to see my family. Food is always fresh and the staff is generally pretty friendly.

name: Kim Phillips
text: I just waited for 45 minutes in the drive through wedged between two cars. I was second in line. So, only one car ahead of me.The staff does not care. They said they were backed up, but the parking lot was no where near half filled. The drive through girl ran my debit card and didn't even offer a receipt. It's just ridiculous.

name: GREGORY LAWRENCE
text: The food is always good, but the service is slow and last time it was freezing inside.  It did not feel like the heat was on.  About 45 outside and 50 inside.  Had to hurry up and get in my warm car.

name: Space monkey Gamer
text: I work in fast food business and I always give people benefit of the doubt, but these are the rudest employees and the longest drive thru time. Also, nothing is clean in the restaurant besides the soap. There is one manager I love, but the rest are awful, the food isn’t even hot.

name: Holli Nicole
text: Any time I come through. I always make sure Ashley is working. She's always the one to make my food. She is the best! And the food is always perfect! And I always get it fast. Chelsea and Sequante always make me feel welcome. Thank all 3 of you, for your hard work!

name: joshua smith
text: Fast clean and friendly staff.

name: Nathan heflin
text:
Service was a little slow. Apparently they were having computer issues that day. Will definitely try again to see if it improves. Food was excellent and exactly as ordered.

Edit: after a few weeks I was able to go back and retry this Taco Bell. Was definitely not impressed the second time around. Slower than the first time, and the restaurant was in bad need of some janitorial services. Trash all over the floor, tables that needed wiping down, and the staff was seemingly unconcerned with it. Definitely will not recommend this store until management has dealt with the problems.

name: Jennifer Newton
text: I had eaten here before.... But made the mistake of actually getting a job there! Not only was my order wrong and did not taste good at all and was very sloppy, they did not even send me my W2 or allow me to update my address without speaking to the regional manager who seemed to never be there! They would give me a time to call back but then they would never answer!!!! Isn't this against the law.... I mean withholding my W2?!?!?!?!?

text: Worst drive up window blunder at a fast food restaurant. Very long line, gave wrong orders to customers, so the food was being handled and then handed back to be redistributed after being given to other customers, management CLOSED the store as in LOCKED the doors at 9:50 p.m. which is 2+ hours before normal closing time and refused to allow counter service during all the fiasco and we were told to get BACK in the drive up line and wait again to get our correct food, which by then was cold and soggy. Did not even make new food, gave us the food other customers had handled and returned and had been sitting in the bag all that time. The bean burrito was simply beans and tortilla, there was NO sauce, no diced onions, nothing. The taco supremes were not supreme at all there was no sour cream. Awful experience. Closing the store to avoid customers PRIOR to closing time was absurd.

text:
Drive thru handed HOT coffee to us in a regular drink cup. They were too lazy to go look and get the correct cups that had not yet been taken from the box.
Restaraunt has been filthy up until last 2 months. Overnight staff leaves trash and dirty tables for morning crew apparantly. Workers stand around while folks waiting to give their orders(service has improved in last month as well). The overall arrangement of drink machine, trash cans, and condiment bar could've been designed better also. Very excited to see taco bell come into my community. But disappointed to feel like I'm in a grungy, unmanaged environment.
Up until the last month these were issues.
Staff,and environment and the restaraunts cleanliness has improved since the first of the year. So hoping.

I find it irresponsible, and lazy not to look at a screen to make sure all your orders are right or wrong, and if you notice that's it's wrong you should take the time to fix it not send it out just to get it back with a huge complaint that makes your store look terrible.
